loans.name: Ni Ketut Karni

texts.id:
With a loan from Dinari for Rp1,900,000 (about US$210), Ni Ketut Karni started her business. Ni Ketut Karni bought 2 mother pigs with a price of Rp600,000 (about US$66)/piece, so for 2 mother pigs it was Rp1,200,000 (about US$132). The rest Rp700,000 (about US$77) was used to buy feed. Every day Ni Ketut Karni is busy with her animals besides being a mother raising 1 school aged child. According to Ni Ketut Karni raising mother pigs would bring faster results, because the 2 mother pigs will bore piglets and feed expenses would not be too high compared to fattening piglets. Usually every 5 months mother pigs could bore around 5-6 piglets per mother pig. From potential sales from 2 mother pigs could reach Rp2,500,000 (about US$275). Feed expenses only Rp500,000 (about US$55). So nett Ni Ketut Karni could profit Rp 2,000,000 (about US$220). With this profit Ni Ketut Karni likes to buy 1 more mother pig, to increase income and to enhance family life.

Translated from Bahasa Indonesia by Gwan Liong Ang, Kiva volunteer.

Dengan pinjaman modal yang di dapat dari Dinari sebesar Rp.1.900.000,- Ni Ketut Karni memulai usahanya. Ni Ketut Karni membeli 2 induk babi dengan harga perekor Rp.600.000,- jadi 2 induk babi harganya Rp 1.200.000,-. Sisanya Rp.700,000,- dipergunakan untuk modal pakannya. Setiap hari Ni Ketut Karni sibuk mengurus usaha ternaknya disamping sebagai ibu rumah tangga yang mengurusi 1 orang anaknya yang masih sekolah. Menurut Ni Ketut Karni memelihara induk babi lebih cepat menghasilkan, karena nantinya dari 2 ekor induk babi ini akan beranak dan untuk biaya pakannya pun tidak terlalu mahal dibandingkan dengan memelihara babi pengemukan. Setiap 5 bulan induk babi ini akan melahirkan anak yang rata –rata bisa beranak antara 5 sampai 6 ekor per induk dari hasil penjualan anaknya dari 2 induk babi pendapatan kotornya bisa mencapai Rp 2.500.000,-. Pengeluaran pakan hanya Rp.500.000,-. Jadi bersihnya Ni Ketut Karni bisa memperoleh keuntungan Rp 2.000.000,-. Dengan keuntungan ini Ni Ketut Karni ingin membeli induk lagi 1 ekor agar bisa menambah hasil dan memperbaiki kehidupan keluarganya.

loans.use:
To buy mother pig and feed

Membeli induk babi dan pakan

loans.name: Faalogoae

texts.en: Faalogoae is 48 years old and lives in the village of Vailele. She joined SPBD a year ago, shortly before receiving her first loan, and has now applied for a second loan  to expand her barbecue business. She's done well in this line of work because her family owns a plantation where she gets most of the produce that she sells to her customers. Faalogoae will use her loan to keep her stand open every Wednesday and Saturday, the days when demand is strongest and sales are highest.

loans.use: To buy supplies and ingredients for her barbecue business and for home improvements

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Maribel is from Hualahoyo. Thanks to her dear parents' seeding skills she is very familiar with the agriculture work. Her loving mother gave her her farming fields three years ago and she's been working them ever since. She has two little children who, through her hard work and effort, receive wellbeing and safety so that they can develop without any inconvenient.

Maribel's wishes to improve the quality of her products drive her to request a loan to acquire fertilizers in order to obtain excellent products for this harvesting season. Make her request possible so that this hardworking mother can continue to develop her work with a lot of satisfaction.

Translated from Spanish by Yael Schwartzman, Kiva Volunteer .

Maribel es natural de Hualahoyo, gracias a la habilidad para sembrar de sus queridos padres conoce muy de cerca la labor agrícola.Su adorada madre le cedió sus campos de cultivo y por esta razón ella lleva desenvolviéndose con éxito en esta labor hace tres años. Tiene dos pequeños a quienes a través de su trabajo y esfuerzo diario otorga bienestar y seguridad para que puedan desenvolverse sin ningún inconveniente. Sus deseos de mejorar la calidad de sus productos la llevan a solicitar un préstamo para adquirir abonos y fertilizantes a fin de obtener excelentes productos en esta temporada de cosecha.Posibilitemos su solicitud para que esta trabajadora madre siga desarrollando su labor con mucha satisfacción.

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expansion of a business

loans.name: Bedith

texts.es:
Señora Bedith belongs to a communal bank called 'Women Leaders' located in the district of Calleria in the state of Ucayali. She's 28 years old and she has one son. Her husband is a salesman. With the first loan she obtained from Manuela Ramos, she decided to buy and sell lubricants for mototaxis.

She currently has a locale where she sells lubricants and accessories for mototaxis. Her husband helps her from time to time in taking care of the customers.

With this loan, which she will repay in 6 months, she will purchase more supplies for moto-taxis such as lubricants of different name brands and switches, etc.

Translated from Spanish by Carolina Zelaya-Kronlund, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Bedith pertenece al Banco Comunal Mujeres Lideres, ubicado en el Jr Unión N° 10,del Distrito de Calleria,Departamento de Ucayali. Tiene 28 años tiene un hijo, su esposo es comerciante. Ella con el primer préstamo recibido de Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la venta de Lubricantes para motocarro. En la actualidad ella cuenta con un local de venta de lubricantes y accesorios para motocarros, Su esposo la ayuda en la atención del negocio. Con este préstamo de S/. 1,700 el cual será pagado en 6 meses, comprara accesorios para motocarros como: aceite de diferentes marcas, llaves para ruedas y otros

loans.use: To purchase supplies for moto-taxis

loans.name: Batuli

texts.en:
Batuli is 45 years old and is a widow with 7 children, ages 18 to 36. Batuli owns a small food vending store, which she started in 1979. Every day she works from 7:15 AM to 6:30 PM at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $70 from her sales.

She now hopes for a loan to buy more food items (sugar, beans, rice) for her business.

loans.use: To buy more food items (sugar, beans, rice) for her business

loans.name: Nazarbek

texts.ru:
Nazarbek M. lives in the Shahrinau area. He is 45 years old, married with no children. He has a community college degree. He grows vegetables as a business on a piece of land that he owns. He has been doing this for 15 years. Right now it’s planting season and Nazarbek needs money to buy seeds and fertilizer. But because prices for seeds and fertilizer have gone up, he can no longer afford to buy them without a loan. He plans to repay the loan in 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Olga Espira, Kiva volunteer.

Мирзоев Назарбек проживает в районе Шахринау.Возраст 45 лет. Женат ,детей не имеет. Образование среднее.Занимается растениеводством. Имеет участок земли , который засеивает овощами.Сейчас посевной сезон и клиенту нужны деньги для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений .Занимается этим видом бизнеса уже 15 лет . но всвязи стем , что цены на семена и удобрения возросли без кредита клиент не может купить необходимые для посева вещи. Поэтому клиент решил обратиться к нам за кредитом. Погасить кредит он планирует в течении 12 месяцев.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer

loans.name: Maria Pascuala

texts.es:
Two years ago, Maria Pascuala started her business raising chickens in the patio of her house in order to help her husband with household expenses. He did not have a steady income since he only worked a few days a week as a motorcycle taxi driver. For this reason they needed extra income for household expenses and those of their 2-year-old son.

Currently she needs a loan for US $250, which will be repaid in 3 months, as she would like to increase the number of chickens since her business has gone well and has more demand. With your help this will be possible

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva volunteer.

Maria Pascuala empezó su negocio hace 2 años, la crianza pollos en el patio de su casa para ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que el no cuenta con un sueldo seguro ya que solo trabaja unos días a la semana como chofer de una moto taxi y por esta razon requiern de ingresos extra para los gastos de la csa y los de su hijo de 2 años.

Actualmente necesita un prestamo por US $250 que pagara en 3 meses ya que desea incrementar la cantidad de pollos, esto gracias a que le ha ido bien y tienen mayor demanda. Con tu apoyo esto sera posible.

loans.use: Purchase chickens.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Mr Antonio is a hard working man who has been transporting passengers for a long time - he is the owner and driver of a motorcycle taxi. Antonio is 42 years old and although he isn't a father yet, he anxiously hopes his partner will give him a child soon. She sells groceries and together they take care of their household's financial needs.

Antonio wants to be a prosperous businessman in the transport industry and as he is also a master pastry chef, he also wants to build an oven to make and sell his delicious pastry treats.

At this moment Antonio has worn out his motorcycle taxi and this is why he asks for a loan of 900.00 PEN to pay for it to be fixed and for the spare parts as these are very expensive. Your help will forever be in the hearts of this grateful couple.

Translated from Spanish by Inês Teles, Kiva volunteer.

El señor Antonio, es un hombre trabajador que se dedica al transporte de pasajeros desde hace mucho tiempo, él es propietario y chofer de un mototaxi. Antonio con sus 42 años de edad aún no es padre, pero espera con ansias que pronto su pareja le dé un hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes y juntos sostienen las necesidades económicas de su casa.Antonio quiere ser un próspero empresario de transportes y como es maestro pastelero, también desea construir un horno para hacer y vender sus deliciosos pasteles. En este momento Antonio tiene malogrado su motocarro y es para ello que solicita un préstamo de 900 soles, para pagar la reparación y comprar los repuestos que son muy costosos. En el corazón de esta pareja agradecida permanecerá por siempre tu ayuda.

loans.use: To fix and buy spare parts for his motorcycle taxi

loans.name: Patricia

texts.en: Patricia is 48 years old. She is married with five children. Currently all the kids are in school. She owns and operates a grocery shop in the local market and sells items such as rice, evaporated milk, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, washing powder, toilet soaps, candies and biscuits. She wants to use the loan to buy supplies in bulk to expand her business. Patricia hopes to make good enough income from the expanded business to enable her to provide the children with a quality education. She belongs to the community group called Humble Trust Group. The group members mutually guarantee loans through a repayment pledge and assist one another to repay the loan.

loans.use: To buy bulk food and supplies

loans.name: Laxmi

texts.en: Laxmi Chitrakar, 40 years old, lives in Kritipur, Kathmandu. She lives in a joint family with 7 members and her husband, Dhumi Chitrakar, their mother, two daughters, and two sons. She opened a small tea and snack shop. She and her husband work together in her shop. Her family's income is not enough to fulfill their needs. She needs a loan to expand her business to earn more and supply her family's basic needs. She seeks Rs. 20000/- to purchase more chairs, tables and utensils for her shop. She wants to to earn more to provide a quality education to her children.

loans.use: To purchase more chairs, tables and others

loans.name: Teofila

texts.es:
Teofila Es socia del Banco Comunal Marcela. Teofila es casada, tiene 51 años y 6 hijos, Teofila es artesana, elabora tejidos en telar como pasadizos, frazadas, tapices, individuales, actividad que realiza con la ayuda D. su hija, sus tejidos los comercializa a los comerciantes del mercado central D. la ciudad D. Ayacucho. Además Teofila tiene una tienda D. abarrotes en su casa, también venD. verduras, carnes, frutas.

Teofila necesita un préstamo D. 1050 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. hilos, tintes, arroz y azúcar. Los sueños D. Teofila son brindar una buena educación a sus hijos, mejorar la construcción D. su casa y ampliar sus negocios.
texts.en:
Teofila is a member of the Banco Comunal Marcela. She is a 51-year-old married mother of 6 children. She is an artisan who produces various textiles using a loom. Her daughter assists her with this work. They sell these fabrics to merchants at the central market of the city of Ayacucho. Teofila also has a grocery stand at her house where she sells vegetables, meat and fruits.

Teofila asks for a loan to purchase thread, dye, rice and sugar. Teofila's dream is to offer her children a good education, to improve her home, and to increase her businesses.

Translated from Spanish by Marco Alves, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase thread, dye, rice and sugar

loans.name: Rachana

texts.en: Mrs. Rachana S. is 27 years old. She sells used-clothes in the Svaychek Market, since 2000, getting profit US$8.20 per day. Rachana is married and mother of one child, and her husband, Mr. Chomren Youn, is 28 years old and always helps his wife's business, lives in Rolosh Commune, Banteay Meanchey Province. Rachana hopes to expand her business. Therefore, she decided to ask for US$1,000 to purchase more used-clothes to store for sale. The loans will help to increase their family's income and to support their family's living expenses stability.

loans.use: to purchase more used-clothes to store for sale

loans.name: Vicenta

texts.es:
La señora Vicente pertenece al Banco Comunal “Espíritu Santo” del Centro Poblado D. Chimbo del Distrito y Provincia D. Yunguyo-Puno desD. hace 8 años. Es casada y madre D. 05 hijos, 4 D. ellos casados y que viven en Lima y 1 que aun estudia y depenD. D. ella. Tiene 50 años D. edad. Con el primer préstamo D. S/: 300.00 nuevos  soles  compro animales D. carga “burros”.

En la actualidad se dedica a la crianza D. ganado vacuno para engorD., su esposo es el que lleva los animales para vender en la Feria D. Acora o Ilave, con la ganancia D. estas ventas paga puntualmente al Banco.

Con este préstamo D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, el cual será pagado en 5 cuotas, comprara 01 ganado vacuno a S/. 2.800.

Su mayor deseo es comprarse una maquina para confeccionar ropa e ir a trabajar a Lima junto a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Vicente has belonged to the Community Bank "Espiritu Santo" (meaning, Holy Spirit), located in Centro Poblado D. Chimbo, within the District and Province of Yunguyo-Puno, for the past 8 years. She is married and is mother of 5 children, 4 of whom are married and live in Lima. One of them is currently studying and still depends on her. She is 50 years odl. With the first loan of S/.300 nuevos soles she purchased working animals, donkeys.

Currently she raises cattle, and her husband takes the livestock for sale in the fairs of Feria D. Acora or llave. With the profit she always manages to make her payments to the Community Bank on time.

With this loan of S/.3000 nuevos soles, which will be repaid in a term of 5 months, she will purchase 1 head of cattle at S/.2800.

Her greatest dream is to purchase a sewing machine and to move to Lima to work alongsiD. her children.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de 1 ganado vacuno.

loans.name: Do Thi

texts.vi:
Chị Đỗ Thị Liễu 45 tuổi, chị tham gia Quỹ tình thương từ năm 2000. Hiện tại công việc đem lại nguồn thu chủ yếu cho gia đìnhchị Liệu là chăn nuôi và trồng trọt. Với việc chăn nuôi 50 con gà, 10 con lợn và 2 con bò, thu nhập của gia đình chị đạt 4.000.000đ/ tháng. Ngoài ra hàng tháng gia đình chị còn có thêm thu nhập từ lương đi làm thuê của chồng nên kinh tế rất ổn định.
Vòng vốn tới chị Liễu  mong muốn được vay 10.000.000đ để đầu tư cho chăn nuôi
texts.en:
Mrs. Do Thi L. is 45 years old. She has participated in TYM Fund since 2000. Currently, the major source of income of Mrs. L.'s family is from raising poultry/livestock and farming. By raising 50 chickens, 10 pigs, and 2 cows, her family's income is at VND4,000,000 per month. In addition, her family also receives income from the wages for temporary work of her husband. As such, the economic situation of the family is very stable.

In this loan cycle, Mrs. L. would like to borrow VND10,000,000 to invest in raising poultry/livestock.

Translated from Vietnamese by Tu Duong, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Raising poultry/livestock

loans.name: Shakirat

texts.en: Shakirat is 31 years old and married with a child. She is a client of LAPO (Kiva's Field Partner). She sells frozen foods like chicken, turkey, fish etc. She has been in this business for a long time. Shakirat needs the loan amount of N140,000 to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thank you to all that made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Nicolae Cebotari Group

texts.en:
This is a group of farmers that is hoping to secure a loan via MicroInvest to improve and expand their respective businesses. In particular, they are seeking this loan because they do not have sufficient capital to pay rent at the wholesale market, which hinders their ability to generate an increase in their profits.

The entire group consists of relatives, and everyone is held accountable by each other. Even so, the leader of this group is Nicolae C., who is the oldest of the group and who convinced everyone to request this loan from MicroInvest. Notably, this is not the first loan Nicolae has sought from MicroInvest, and he explains that he has a good credit history and that lenders should have confidence that the group will promptly repay this loan.

loans.use: To improve their businesses by increasing working capital to enable them to rent space at the wholesale market

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es:
En el municipio de Somotillo la señora Mariana N. se ha destacado por ser una excelente cocinera ya que se dedica al negocio de elaboración y venta de alimentos donde diariamente elabora deliciosos platillos los cuales son comercializados a sus clientes que le visitan a diario. 
Por tener la habilidad de cocinar muy bien y con el objetivo de mantener a sus pequeños tres hijos la señora Mariana ha decidido desarrollar el negocio y para esto ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un crédito. Con este crédito logrará la compra de la materia prima para elaboración de sus alimentos que tanto agradan a sus clientes.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Somotillo, Ms. Mariana N. stands out as an excellent cook because she prepares and sells meals for a living. She prepares her delicious dishes and sells them to her customers who visit her on a daily basis.

Because she has great cooking skills, and because her goal is to support her young children, Mariana has decided to further develop the business, which is why she is seeking Ceprodel’s support via a loan. With this loan, she will purchase the ingredients she needs to prepare the dishes that her customers like so much.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for meals

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El Sr. Adolfo V., està casado con la Sra.Ramona Falcon, juntos tienen 5 hijos ya todos mayores de edad e independientes actualmente.

                       Ambos se dedican al cultivo de diferentes plantas naturales para su comercializaciòn,dicho trabajo es ayudado por un hijo que es Ingeniero Agrònomo.
                          
                         Con el  ingreso   obtenido de  dicho  trabajo lograron sacar  adelante a sus cinco  hijos teniendo en cuenta que el vivero  con el  que  cuenta es unico en  la zona  y  les  sirve  de apoyo  econòmico para  salir adelante  

                           Solicitò el crèdito con nuestra entidad para la compra de semillas .
texts.en:
Adolfo V. and his wife, Ramona Falcon, have five children. The children are all economically independent. Adolfo and Ramona own a nursery, where they cultivate natural plants. One of their sons is an Agronomist, and he helps them. With the income from this work, the couple has been able to help their five children get ahead. This was possible because the nursery is the only one of its kind in their area. Adolfo would like a loan to buy seeds.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy seeds

loans.name: Maureen

texts.en:
Maureen A. is a 29-year-old mother of three children, ages 16, 12, and 7. She is married to a driver. Maureen runs a salon where she cuts both men and women’s hair. She says she has been running the business for 19 years (since she was 10). Maureen says she is very talented and that in good months, like December, she will see lots of customers. Now, due to the loss of purchasing power, Maureen says she is only seeing one or two customers a day. She is asking for 30,000 KSH to purchase hair dryers and chemicals for her business.

Maureen recently joined the K-MET volunteer Community Health Worker (CHW) group in Kisumu, Kenya. As a CHW she will be trained by K-MET and will begin visiting members of her community who are sick with a variety of illnesses. Her work will include distributing Nutriflour (a vitamin enriched flour produced by K-MET) to malnourished patients, providing reproductive health education, referring patients to local clinics and hospitals, and providing basic health care.

loans.use: Hair dryers, hair chemicals

loans.name: Abed Allah

texts.en:
Abed Allah is a 27-year-old man who lives in Nabatieh, southern Lebanon with his wife and their two children. Abed Allah has been working as a taxi driver for five years. Abed Allah requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to do some maintenance work on his car. This is the first time that Abed Allah has requested a loan. 
Abed Allah is special in his work because he does it well. His clients are people from his region. When he first started his business, he had to face the competition since there are a lot of taxis in Lebanon. Abed Allah decided on doing his business because he wanted to improve his family’s income. In the future, he plans on expanding his business by purchasing a van in order to have more passengers.

loans.use: To do some maintenance work on his car.

loans.name: Tin's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is requested by three people who reside in Ocha Commune, Battambang Province. Mrs. Tin S., 51, was selected to be the group leader by the group. Tin S. is married with eight children and her husband is Mr. Khoeun, a motorbike taxi driver. Tin S. makes a living selling Khmer cakes from home. She always goes to the village market to buy sugar, pork, bananas, salt, and then mixes them, makes them into packages, and boils them. One of her children helps with her selling the cakes. Many of her clients appreciate the tasty cakes she makes. In order to meet the customer's requirements, Tin S. is applying for a loan to support her business operations, by buying necessary ingredients to make the cakes to sell. The other two borrowers are P. and S. Y.. 
P. is a cake seller who is requesting a loan to expand the size of her business.
S. Y. sells cooked ingredients from home and is applying for a loan to buy additional items to sell.

loans.use: To support her business operations

loans.name: Fidelia Paola

texts.es: Fidelia Paola es soltera, tiene 34 años dedad con una hija de 4 añitos estudiando el pre-escolar, trabaja en els Super San Antonio desde hace 11 años como impulsadora de ventas, con un horario de 12 horas de Lunes a Domingo, con un dia libre el Martes, tiene la ayuda del padre de su hija quien le da un aporte de C$.100.00 quincenales.  Esta solicitando su 7mo credito el que destinará para la compra de 2 puerta y 3 ventanas para asegurar su vivienda, la que no pudo concluir con el credito anterior.  Expresa sentirse satisfecha con la atencion que la ha brindado AFODENIC, pues gracias a los creditos que le han brindado ha llegado a cumplir un poco el sueño de su vida como es tener una vivienda digna para su hija.
texts.en:
Fidelia Paolo is single and is 34 years old with a four-year-old daughter who is in preschool. She has worked at Super San Antonio for 11 years as a promoter of sales. She works for 12 hours a day, Monday through Sunday, with a day off on Tuesday. She has the help of the father of her daughter who gives her support in the amount of 100 NIO biweekly. She is requesting her seventh loan, which she will use to buy 2 doors and 3 windows to secure her home, which she couldn’t finish with her previous loan. She expresses that she feels satisfied with the attention that AFODENIC offers her. Thanks to the loans that they have offered her, she has begun to achieve a bit of her life’s dream to have a worthy home for her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy doors and windows

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en: Jennifer is 23 years old and married with four children. Her children are all in school and they range in age from 1 to 11.  Jennifer buys tomatoes from a major market in Kisumu and then resells them. She will use her loan to buy more tomatoes. She says that having the loan will help her to have good business because she will be able to buy more stock.

loans.use: To buy more tomatoes for resale

loans.name: Ermila Magaly

texts.es:
La señora Ermila Magaly V. P., tiene 30 años de edad, viven en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 3º de secundaria, tiene 3 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Ermila se dedica a la venta de pescado en el mercado de Moche y por zonas aledañas a su casa.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles compró javas (embase) y pescado.
Este crédito de 800 nuevos soles lo invertirá en la compra de javas y pescado que se congelará en la nevera que tiene en su domicilio.
Ermila sueña con tener un restaurante en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Sra. Ermila Magaly V. P. is 30 years old and lives in the Moche District of Trujillo Province, Department of La Libertad, Peru. This businesswoman completed 3 years of high school and has 3 dependent children. Ermila sells fish from the market in Moche and in the areas near her home. With her first loan of 300 soles, she bought containers and fish.

This current loan of 800 soles will be used to buy more containers and fish that she will freeze in her refrigerator at home. She hopes to open a restaurant in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy containers & fish

loans.name: Margarette

texts.en:
Margarette is a 60-year-old mother of six. A few years ago, she decided that she had to take a stronger role in providing for her family. As a result, she joined GHAPE in order to help her achieve this goal. Responding to this challenge, she started her own businesses and invested in developing her family farm. 

Having already been a member of GHAPE for almost eight years now, Margarette has engaged in a number of different money making enterprises. She has sold cocoyams, and has also bought a motorcycle to help her transport her goods to market. With the profits of each of these ventures, Margarette has spent the money on her children’s school fees and has also used this money to be able to feed and clothe the rest of her family. With the profits of her last loan, she also was able to bury her husband. 

With this next loan, Margarette is looking to start a tire patching business in Ntarikon, a neighbourhood of Bamenda Cameroon. This tire patching business will succeed because of her collaboration with her first born son, a very energetic young man, and also because of her good business location. In addition to this, she feels that her tenacity, a trait learned over years of raising her children all by herself, will also provide her business with strength and vitality in the years to come. 

Through this, she then will benefit the community in providing tire repair service, and will also be able to save people a significant amount of money over the full price of a new tire. Through the success of this venture, Margarette will also be able to put money directly back into the community through spending and employing other community members in the future. 

Margarette first came to GHAPE because of the quality of their training in business management, and also because of the low interest and easy payment plan. Through the success of these, she has become financially independent and has also been able to help some of her children start businesses of their own. 

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase of working tools for tire patching, marketing

loans.name: Paubla Francis

texts.es: La señora Paubla Francis C. de 32 años de edad, reside en el barrio Laureles Sur, casada, con dos hijos los cuales estudian en la primaria, su esposo trabaja en servicios de vigilancias y su salario es bajo, es por ella busco un trabajo en servicios domestico para sobre salir adelante con los gastos de la familia lo mas difícil la confianza de sus patrones ya que siempre desconfía. Con este préstamo es el octavo ciclo en Afodenic con estos préstamo ella ha ido mejorando poco a poco su casa. Con este préstamo hará un sumidero ya que el que tiene esta en malas condiciones y no es higiénico es por eso le urge comenzar a que le trabajen y poder dar a su familia lo que merecen.

loans.use: Comprar los materiales necesarios para hacer un sumidero

loans.name: Taulau

texts.en:
Taulau T., a 34-year-old woman living in the town of Matautu-Lefaga, is married and has seven adult children. To make a living, Taulau owns and operates a bakery – baking and selling a variety of confectioneries such cookies and cakes in her community. Taulau has been in this business for over four years and earns approximately 600 WST a month.

In 2008, Taulau (0) joined SPBD to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Taulau has successfully repaid a previous loan of 750 WST from SPBD. This previous loan was used to purchase baking equipment.

Taulau is now requesting a new loan of 1500 WST which will be used to purchase additional cooking ingredients. This will be Taulau's second loan from SPBD. Taulau plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About SPBD: SPBD's mission is to improve the quality of life of people living in poverty in the poor island nations of the South Pacific. SPBD's philosophy of lending is based on respect for each individual's innate human ingenuity, drive and self esteem.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional cooking ingredients

loans.name: Malakeh

texts.en:
Malakeh is a 48 year old woman who lives in Tripoli, northern Lebanon with her husband and their seven children. Malakeh owns a grocery store. She also sells home products. She requested a loan from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her shop. This is her fourth cycle loan and she has always paid on time. 
Malakeh is special in her work because she knows how to treat her clients. Her clients are her friends, neighbors and others. When she first started her business, she had financial issues. She decided to enter into this business because she wanted to improve her financial situation. In the future, she plans to expand her work by opening a clothing shop.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fertilizer and enlarge her growing area

loans.name: Mable

texts.en:
Mable is a 33-year-old married mother of two children, a boy and a girl. She has run her tailoring shop, Tailoring Mama Dan, for the last five years. She sells skirt suits, school uniforms, kitenge (African fabric), and children's clothing. She is requesting a loan of Kes. 20,000 to buy more clothing material. Mable describes herself as visionary and hardworking and says that since she has become a member of Faulu she has learned to be a better saver. In the future, she hopes to grow her business into a big shop and employ people. 

About Faulu Kenya:
Faulu Kenya aims to empower Kenyans by providing relevant financial solutions. Faulu is a sustainable and profitable microfinance institution that offers savings and credit services to over 225,000 Kenyans. Faulu recently became the first MFI in Kenya to be licensed as a Deposit-Taking Micro-Finance Company, which will enable Faulu to better serve its clients.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Hoshim

texts.ru: Ахунов Хошим проживает в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 42 года. Женат, имеет 3 детей. Жена, домохозяйка. Хошим имеет высшее образование. Он более 9 лет занимается торговлей стройматериалов на рынке. Кредит просит для увеличения товараоборота.
texts.en:
Hoshim A. lives in Qurgan-Tube. He is 42 years old and married with three children. His wife is a homemaker. Hoshim has a university education. For over 9 years, he has been selling building materials at the market. He has requested a loan to increase his sales turnover.

Translated from Russian by Susie Armitage, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to increase sales turnover

loans.name: God Grace Group

texts.en:
Josephine W. is the leader of a group of five borrowers called God Grace. She is 41 years old and is married with two children, ages 10 and 24. Her youngest child attends school and her eldest is a high school graduate. Josephine also cares for a nephew. She herself dropped out of high school due to conditions of civil unrest, but she had always wanted to get into business.

Josephine lives in the ELWA community on the southern outskirts of Monrovia. She works on Front Street in downtown Monrovia. Her business is the sales of used clothing. She buys used clothing and sells these in retail. The quality of her goods is high, and she offers affordable prices in order to encourage customers to continue buying from her. She started her business with LD1000.00, which was given to her by her sister.

She has been running this business for 12 years and hopes to open a building materials store in the future.

Josephine needs this loan to add stock and improve her business.

She dreams of becoming a well-established businesswoman and giving her children a better education.

loans.use: To add inventory and improve her business

loans.name: Night

texts.en:
Night S. is in the business of selling fresh vegetables and other items in the local market, and is requesting a loan to buy fresh and dried fish to sell to her customers. Night is 27 years old and married to a policeman. She has four children, all of whom are in school.  With the extra income made possible by this loan, she hopes to be able to continue to educate her children.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education , and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as a measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: purchase fresh and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Uktam

texts.en:
K. Uktam is a 40-year-old married man who lives with his 4 children. He has been running a business of raising and selling cattle. He has 12 years of experience in this field. Since cattle raising and selling is a profitable business, Uktam has become a very successful businessman in a very short period. He works very hard and spends all his time with the cattle, cleaning, feeding and pasturing them.

Now Uktam wants to expand his business and buy more cattle. Therefore Uktam applied for a loan of $3000 USD. He thanks all lenders for their support. With your help, Uktam can get ahead.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture, and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle

loans.name: Pich

texts.en:
Mrs. Pich R., 47, has been a scarf weaver for five years. She is requesting a loan of $1,200 to build a shop for her son’s tailoring business. She will also use part of her loan to buy cotton thread for her scarf-weaving business. 

Mrs. Pich R. has six children: two sons and four daughters. Five of them are married and live in separate homes and the youngest is the tailor. She lives about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh City.

loans.use: To build a shop for her son’s tailoring business and buy cotton thread for her scarf weaving business

loans.name: Tomas Elmer

texts.es: Tomas Elmer F. H. de 34 años de edad, reside en Cayultitán, departamento de La Paz. Vive junto a su esposa y dos hijos menores de edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Tomas, posee una venta de tamales especiales, los cuales están rellenos de carne de gallina india, lo cual por el hecho de ser de gallina los convierte en  algo muy atractivo para las personas del lugar, sobre todo porque su negocio está ubicado en Olocuilta, un lugar muy famoso en el país por sus pupusas, el cual es muy visitado por turistas de todos los lugares del país e incluso extranjeros, esto contribuye a que Tomas venda grandes cantidades de tamales. Es por esto que él solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de maíz para hacer la masa de los tamales, así mismo comprar las gallinas y verduras, esto con el fin de poder elaborar mayor cantidad de tamales y de esta forma aprovechar la clientela y aumentar sus ventas. Esta es la única fuente de ingresos con la cual cuenta su familia, es por ello que Tomas debe ingeniárselas para poder mejorar las condiciones del negocio, ya que dependen en absoluto de las ganancias generadas por este.
texts.en:
Tomas Elmer F. H., 34, lives in Cayultitán in the department of La Paz. He lives together with his wife and his two younger children, who are students. Tomas sells tamales which are filled with chicken meat. This type of meat is very appealing to people in this area, as his business is located in Olocuilta, a place that is very famous for their pupusas (thick tortillas typically stuffed with cheese, meat, and/or beans) and is visited by many tourists from all over the country as well as foreigners. These tourists allow Tomas to sell great numbers of tamales. He is asking for a loan so he can buy greater quantities of corn to make the dough for the tamales and so he can buy more chickens and vegetables. The loan will allow him to increase the number of tamales he produces and thus take advantage of his client base and increase sales. The tamales are his only source of income with which to support his family. It is for this reason that Tomas must be able to improve the conditions of his business, as his family is completely dependent upon the profits generated by it.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Sindewald, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn, chickens, and vegetables

loans.name: Onyinye

texts.en: Onyinye is a peaceful and hard-working woman. She lives in Lagos state. She sells drinks and cooked food in her shop. She cooks mouth-watering Nigerian foods for her customers. She is married with five children. Her children are still in primary school and she hopes they become graduates in the future. Onyinye has a lot of responsibility. That is why she is very optimistic about the prosperity of her business and that of her family. She is 34 years old and her husband is a businessman. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and to sell. She says thank you to all KIVA lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and foodstuffs to cook and sell.

loans.name: Ozodjon

texts.en: Ozodjon is 26 years old, married and has a little kid. He is a farmer and grows potatoes, carrots and wheat, something he has done for 6 years. This is the only thing he knows how to do and what he likes most. For Ozodjon, there is nothing better than being in touch with nature and watching the crops of his labor grow year after year. In addition, Ozodjon raises cattle and his family helps him with his business. Now he wants to borrow money for purchasing seeds and fertilizer in order to grow grains. This is the first loan by Ozodjon from IMON International and Kiva and he promises that he will not let you down. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing seed and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock merchandise.

loans.name: Lizhel

texts.en:
Lizhel M. is from the village of Matab-ang Dalipuga, Iligan City. She is 35 years old, married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Lizhel owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Lizhel has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Lizhel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan she has taken out from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Matab-ang, Dalipuga, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Jaime Roberto

texts.es:
El señor Jaime Roberto Z. G., vive en el Barrio Medardo Andino tiene la edad de 39 años es  casado y con su esposa tienen 3 hijas, y las cuales estudian dos de ellas la escuela primaria y la mayor la secundaria, ellos tienen una pulpería desde hace 15 años.

Dentro de las necesidades que tiene su negocio está,  la falta de financiamiento, y apoyo de las microfinancieras y/o bancos, para este sector de comercio, agradece el soporte que se le ha brindado en otras ocasiones, pues su negocio a salido paulatinamente adelante gracias a los prestamos de Kiva, ahora tras esta inversión en la compra de mayor inventario de abarrotes y lacteos, espera mejorar sus condiciones de vida para brindarle a sus hijos estudio y comodidades que puedan servir a su diario vivir.
texts.en:
Jaime Roberto Z. G. lives in the the suburb of Medardo Andino. He is 39 years old and married. With his wife he has 3 daughters, 2 of whom study in primary school and the oldest in secondary school. Jaime and his wife have had a grocery store for 15 years. Amongst the necessities of running a business is the lack of finance and the support of microfinanciers and/or banks for this sector of commerce. Jaime is thankful for the support that has been given to him on other occasions, as his business has improved step by step thanks to the loans from Kiva. This investment will be put into the purchase of more inventory and dairy products. Jaime hopes to improve his living conditions to allow his children to study and provide them with daily comforts.

Translated from Spanish by Jane McCrory, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase inventory and groceries

loans.name: Jose

texts.en:
Jose N., 54 years old, invests so much in his piggery business. It was in 1983 that he started growing pigs and, until now, he is still doing the same thing since it is a very profitable business. Jose has five children. His eldest child is 31 years old and unmarried.

Jose would like to request a loan of Php 6,000. He will use the loan to buy piglets for his piggery and farm supplies to increase his harvest. Jose chose CEVI because he likes the micro-insurance coverage.

loans.use: To buy piglets and farm supplies

loans.name: Takku Liggeye Group

texts.fr:
Le Groupe de solidarité du nom de TAKKU LIGGEYE, qui signifie "se ceindre les reins et travailler" est créé le 22 octobre 2007 lors de l'inauguration du Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE dont il fait parti. Il est composé de 10 femmes toutes mariées à l'exception de Amy D. et Fatou D. qui sont veuves depuis moins d'une année. Elles sont toutes issues du même quartier qui porte le même nom que le Banc Villageois. Elles sont d'ages différents variants de 34 à 60 ans. Leurs activités sont variées mais le petit commerce est dominant, elle font la vente de produits halieutiques, de produits cosmétiques, d'effets vestimentaire et la coiffure. Et ce nouveau crédit leur permettra de renforcer le niveau d'investissement en s'approvisionnant en quantité suffisante en marchandises.

Quant à la présidente Sokhna D., apparemment la plus jeune du groupe est âgée de 34 ans, elle est divorcée et vit avec son enfant de 8 ans qui fréquente l'école depuis 2 ans. A cause de son dynamisme, de son assiduité et de son sérieux dans le travail le groupe a eu confiance en elle pour élire responsable dudit groupe de solidarité. 
Elle est coiffeuse de profession, elle a commencé à pratiquer son métier chez elle pour ensuite, au bout de 3 ans ouvrir un salon de coiffure ou elle travaille avec une équipe de deux autres personnes. Dans le salon de coiffure elle y vend également de des effets de toilette. Son objectif est de renforcer son niveau d'épargne, d'assurer la scolarisation de son enfant et de satisfaire ses besoins personnels. Par ailleurs, elle paye chaque mois 5000 francs CFA pour des cours de renforcement à son enfant?

Le groupe, en plus des remboursements réguliers des crédit qu'il reçoit, utilise une partie de leur revenu faire face aux dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en:
The solidarity group by the name of TAKKU LIGGEYE, which means "to take hold the reins to work" was established on October 22, 2007 at an inauguration of the Banc Villageois de DIAMAGUENE to which it belongs.  The group is composed of ten women, all married except for Amy D. and Fatou D. who have been widows for less than a year.  The women are all from the same district with the same name as the Banc Villageois.  Their ages range from 34 to 60. Their businesses vary, but small-scale commerce is dominant, involving seafood products, cosmetics, clothing and accessories, and hairdressing.  This new loan will enable them to strengthen the level of investment by stocking up on sufficient supplies of merchandise.  As for the president, Sokhna D., aged 34, who is apparently the youngest in the group, she is divorced and lives with her 8-year-old child who has been attending school for two years.  Because of her energy, constancy, and seriousness with work, the group is very confident in Sokhna, having elected her as the head of this solidarity group.  Sokhna is a hairdresser by profession and started working in this trade at home.  And then, after three years, she opened a hair salon, where she works with a team of two others.  In this salon, she also sells grooming and bath items.  Her goal is to bolster her savings, to ensure schooling for her child, and to support herself.  In addition, she pays 5,000 francs CFA each month for enrichment courses for her child. In addition to the regular loan payments received, the group uses part of the revenues to cope with day-to-day family expenses.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increasing the level of financing for their businesses

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena O. is a 41-year-old married woman from Antipolo, Rizal. She and her husband are blessed to have three children. She is a member of the Upper Buhanginan center in Ahon Sa Hirap, Inc. (ASHI) Rizal West Branch. She is a very strong-minded woman, and she remarks that she works hard to better her status in life. 

Despite hardships brought about by poverty, Ma. Elena remains strong and dedicated in her pursuit to improve her family’s standard of living. The love and support of her husband makes her life quite significant. To make a living, she operates a sari-sari (variety) store. She has been engaged in this business for more than seven years. 

She joined ASHI, a micro-finance institution and Kiva partner in the Philippines, in 2006. During the course of her membership, she has been an excellent performer with respect to her credit rating (basis of loans). She is now seeking her tenth loan, this time in the amount of 45,000 PHP to purchase additional inventory of groceries for her store. She is positive that, with access to additional working capital through ASHI and Kiva, her dreams of winning business and sending her children to a university so that they can complete their college degrees will be achieved. Her wish to give her children a good future is what drives her each day.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory of groceries

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie A. is a married woman who lives in the Kanggapas zone of barangay Anahaw, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: general store and pig fattening businesses. Her husband Dionie A., who is 50 years old, works as a carpenter to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have five children who range in age from 6 to 21 years old. 

Rosalie joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2005 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past eight loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Rosalie has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5,700 - uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her ninth cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15000, which she intends to use to buy more hogs and stocks for her general store so that she can continue saving up for their future and her children's education. Rosalie A. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: Sonia Marisol

texts.es: Sonia Marisol P. D. R. D. 37 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio Zacatecoluca, ubicado en el departamento D. La Paz, lugar en el cual vive desD. hace 14 años mismo tiempo el cual también tiene D. poseer su negocio en el mismo lugar. Sonia vive junto a su esposo el cual trabaja en su propio negocio D. venta D. chatarra, y D. esta misma forma en sus tiempos libres le ayuda a Sonia con el negocio D. ella, así mismo vive junto a sus dos pequeños hijos D. 5 y 7 años D. edad, los cuales se dedican a estudiar. Ella posee una tienda, en la cual comercializa productos D. primera necesidad, tanto alimenticios como D. primera necesidad en el hogar, la cual esta ubicada en su casa D. habitación. Sonia solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir la tienda comprando más pan, leche, jugos y otros productos más, los cuales posee mayor demanda, así D. esta forma ella espera mejorar sus ventas. Sonia es una mujer muy trabajadora la cual desea mejorar su negocio y D. esta forma contar con una mejor estabilidad y D. esta misma forma brindarle un mejor futuro a sus pequeños hijos en el cual puedan contar con todo lo necesario para vivir mejor.
texts.en:
Sonia Marisol Perez D. R. is 37 years old. She has lived in Zacatecoluca (department of La Paz) for 14 years, the same period she has had her business in the same place. Sonia lives with her husband, who has his own business selling scrap metal. In his spare time he helps Sonia with her business. She also lives with her two small children, 5 and 7 years old, who are in school. She has a store, located in her home, and she sells basic goods, such as food and household products. Sonia is requesting a loan in order to stock her store, buying more bread, milk, juices, and other products, whatever is most in demand. She expects to improve her sales this way. Sonia is a hard-working woman who wishes to improve her business and thus enjoy greater stability, offering a better future for her two small children, one where they have what they need to live better.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Jane Wilkie, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic goods

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
El Sr .Maximo  es casado con 3 hijos ya mayores ,se dedica a la panadería  , que esta ubicado en su domicilio.  
 Don Maximo ya tiene una clientela ya formada , ya hace 6 años que se  dedica  a esta actividad.
 El Sr.  trabajaba en un panadería de un primo y con un poco de capital , se independizo .
El crédito será de ayuda para poder comprar un vehículo ya que le sera muy útil para el reparto de sus productos.
 En el futuro desea  ampliar su negocio y dar mas trabajo a la comunidad .
texts.en:
Maximo is married with three older children. He works in a bakery located in his home. Maximo already has an established clientele from having worked in this line of business for six years. He originally worked in a cousin's bakery and, with a little capital, was able to become independent. This loan will help to buy a vehicle, which will be very useful for distributing his products. In the future he wants to expand his business and provide more jobs for the community.

Translated from Spanish by Kara Gibson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a vehicle.

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda M., from the village of Manaring, is 38 years old, married, and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Imelda owns and operates a general store selling a variety of products in the local community. Engaged in her business for over eight years, she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Imelda joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Now requesting her first loan of 5000 PHP to purchase additional products to sell, she plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her store.

About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Raquel Emperatriz

texts.es:
la sra. Raquel Emperatriz N. S. se dedica al comercio, tiene un año de haber emprendido un nuevo negocio y su actividad es la venta de ropa y calzado nuevo, venta de cosméticos.
Es notable que durante este tiempo lo ha sabido administrar.
Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de pollo frito, pero Raquel decidió cambiar de negocio y cuenta con un año de administrar el mismo y manifiesta que le va muy bien, sus condiciones de vida han mejorado.
Doña Raquel, es casada y su esposo trabaja como motorista en la ciudad capital y de su matrimonio ya solo depende un hijo de ellos el cual esta cursando sus estudios secundarios.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de ropa, cremas, lociones, shampoos y calzado para niños.
texts.en:
Raquel Emperatriz N. S. is a businesswoman. She began a new business a year ago; her business is sales of new clothing and shoes, and cosmetics sales. It is notable that during this time she has known how to run this business. She used to sell fried chicken, but Raquel decided to change businesses, and she has run this one for a year and it is going very well for her. Her living conditions have improved. Doña Raquel is married, and her husband works as a driver in the capital city, and their only dependent now is a son who is in secondary school. She will use the loan to buy clothing, creams, lotions, shampoos and children's footwear.

Translated from Spanish by Danielle Maxson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Children's clothing, creams, lotions, shampoos, children's footwear

loans.name: Damis

texts.en:
Damis H. is 41 years old and lives with his wife and three sons in the Hentiy province of Mongolia. He and his family live in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent, in his relative's yard. His three sons attend a local secondary school and his wife works in a cafe as an assistant cook, earning a monthly salary of 85,000 MNT.
Damis operates a taxi service in his town. He began his taxi business in 2008 and has gained a lot of experience since then. His business earnings are the main source of his family's income. His daily business income is around 15,000 to 20,000 MNT. Damis is a very peaceful and helpful person who plans to repair his car before the winter season. "I work hard to support my family. I want to repair my car and transport my customers in a nice and comfortable car," he says. He is requesting a 500,000 MNT loan in order to buy spare parts for his car, which cost 380,000 MNT, and to purchase clothes for his children, which cost 120,000 MNT.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his car

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Four members living in Samraong village in Takeo Province comprise this group loan, led by 37-year-old Mrs. Sopheap S., the group leader selected by the other members, who will use their portion of the loan for various purposes to improve their living standards.

Sopheap is a chicken seller in the local market, earning sufficiently large profits to support her family. To improve her business, she is seeking a loan to buy more chickens to sell. Her husband, Mr. Rorth Nak Khoem, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land upon which he cultivates rice to sell to help support the family. The couple has three children, two of whom are students in the local village school, while the youngest one is only two years old.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell

loans.name: Bukasa Kirabo Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
Thirty-six-year-old Joshua W. has deduced over time that it’s hard work that is the road to short- and long-term business success. These deductions are based on a decade-long experience that he says has helped him see the checkered nature of running a business. 

Joshua W., who belongs to the Bukasa Kirabo Group-Mukono, operates a brick-laying business. He is an easygoing married father of two children whose faces glow with excitement every time he sends them to school. It is a business he began with inspiration from a close friend. Prior to that, he was operating a retail shop. Joshua, who also plies a canteen business, says he makes 40,000 shillings a week. With this loan, he wants to buy more firewood for burning his bricks.

loans.use: The purchase of firewood for burning his bricks

loans.name: Ceneida

texts.es:
Ceneida es estudiante de la UNA y está cursando el 1er. Año en Lic. en Obstetricia, ella tiene el deseo de ser una exitosa profesional en el futuro para poder ayudar a sus padres, ya que la economía de sus padres algunas veces ya es poca para cubrir los gastos que demanda dicho estudio.
El crédito que está solicitando es para la compra de libros y uniformes y algunos herramientas necesarias para las prácticas como la toma presión, y otros.
texts.en:
Cereida is a student at UNA and is completing her first year of study in obstetrics.  Her goal is to become a successful professional in the future so that she can help her parents, since their financial situation is sometimes demanding when they have to cover the cost of her studies.

She is asking for this loan in order to pay for books, uniforms, and a few other tools, such as a blood pressure cuff and other items.

loans.use: Books and uniforms

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es: Socorro tiene 58 años, su actividad es la venta de comida. Hace más de 17 años que tiene este negocio. Sus inicios se dan por inicios propios, ella siempre ha buscado la forma de trabajar y mejorar sus ingresos. Todos los días se levanta temprano para realizar la elaboración de sus comidas como gallo pinto, arroz, pollo, carnes, maduro, queso frito entre otros. La mayoría de sus clientes siempre llegan a buscar la gran variedad de comidas que ofrece. Socorro desea este crédito para la compra de arroz, pollo, carnes, verduras y granos básicos.
texts.en: Socorro is 58 years old.  Her business is selling food.  She has had her business for more than 17 years.  She started the business on her own, as she has always looked for ways to work and improve her earnings.  She gets up early every day to make the food she sells, like "gallo pinto" (a local dish of rice and beans), rice, chicken, meats, plantains, fried cheese and other items.  The majority of her customers come to her because of the large variety of food she offers.  Socorro wants this loan to purchase rice, chicken, meats, vegetables and basic grains.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Opani

texts.en:
Opani R. is currently in the business of selling onions, simsim (sesame) and beans and is requesting a loan to stock more beans and simsim to sell.  Opani is 28 years old and is married with a husband who is a businessman. She has four children and only one child goes to school.

With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to pay the school fees for her children.

loans.use: To stock more beans and simsim to sell.

loans.name: Ivan Rene

texts.es:
Ivan Rene L. M. tiene 37 años. Es casado, vive con la esposa y con los padres, vive en el cantón de Chillanes en la Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. EL BATAN se encuentra ubicada 90 minutos de la Oficina Chillanes, perteneciente al cantón Chillanes, esta ventanilla esta conformado por 21 socios que se dedica a labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Ivan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de cacao, yuca y maíz desde hace mucho tiempo. Compra sus productos en el Cantón Bucay y los vende en la feria de Chillanes y en el mismo recinto.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de cacao. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es seguir trabajando.

Le gusta hacer deporte.
texts.en:
37-year old Ivan Rene L. M. is married and lives with his wife and parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolívar province. He has three children.

The members of the V.R.C. EL BATAN community bank live about 90 minutes from the Chillanes office in the canton of the same name. The 21 members work in short-cycle agriculture growing cocoa, yucca, and corn. They have been doing this kind of farming for a long time.

Ivan has also grown cocoa, yucca, and corn for a long time. He buys the items he needs in Bucay canton, and then sells his produce in Chillanes market in the same area. He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizer for his cocoa crop. The money he earns would help him to support himself financially. 

The problems that Ivan faces include insect infestations, crop diseases, and weather. His goal is to continue in this line of work. He enjoys sports.

loans.use: farming supplies and fertilizer

loans.name: Lucas Kungu

texts.en:
Lucas Kungu is 28 years old and runs a motorcycle transport business popularly known as ‘bodaboda’ in Kenya. His business is in the town of Kiserian, which is a very busy place. He is married to Ann Wacu, and they have a two-year-old daughter. Lucas was introduced to KADET by another KADET client.

Lucas has been running his business for two years and his monthly profit is 20,000 Kenyan shillings. This loan of 40,000 Kenyan shillings is his second loan with KADET. He intends to purchase spare parts for his motorbike with the loan. If the loan boosts his business he will purchase another motorbike and employ someone to operate it.

Lucas dreams of buying a piece of land in the future and build houses to rent out. He describes himself as hardworking.

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his motorbike.

loans.name: Savun

texts.en:
Mrs. Savun K., 31 years old, and her husband, Mr. Pehn Chanrith Oem, 35 years old, live in a small village on National Road Number 2, about 20 kilometers from Phnom Penh City. They were married in 1998 and have three children; two are in school and the third is still young.  

Mrs. Savun K. is a rice farmer. Her husband has full-time employment in Phnom Penh. She is asking for a loan of $1,000 to purchase a motorcycle for her husband to get to work.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike for her husband to get to work

loans.name: Amor Y Amistad 3 & 4 Group

texts.en:
Martire is the coordinator of his group Amor y Amistad 3 & 4 (Love and Peace). He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long-term partner and their two children.

Martire is excited to be taking his 12th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and developed his business. He has had his business for around 7 years, starting with the first loan he received from Esperanza, after some neighbors invited him to join the group. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by purchasing pounds of fish and chicken and to buy coconuts to sell their water. He will continuing using his business profits to provide a better life for his family by building their house and having warm food, clothing and other needs. 

Martire's  story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in Samana, a lush rugged peninsula with a burgeoning tourism industry. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: to buy fish, coconut and chicken

loans.name: Los Angeles Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Isabel, tiene 2 hijos  es viuda y lleva trabajando con Edaprospo desde hace 2 año y medio, Isabel es integrante del grupo “Los Angeles”, grupo conformado por 8 amigas que pusieron este nombre porque su distrito se llama así. Isabel trabaja vendiendo comida, desayuno, almuerzo y cena desde hace 30 años, gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación a  logrado que sus dos hijos sean profesionales, ahora tiene su propio restaurante y con el fin de seguir creciendo a solicitado un nuevo préstamo para mejorar su negocio. Sabemos que Isabel  cumplirá sus metas con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo y que los prestamos de Edaprospo le ayudaran.


Nota
La Sra. S. Serna Edelmira esta como pasiva para este prestamo, es aquella que aparece en la foto sentada en el medio con polo blanco y cartera negra.
texts.en:
Mrs. Isabel is a widow and has two children. She has been working with Edaprospo for two and a half years as part of the group “Los Angeles” [The Angels]. The group is made up of 8 friends and they gave the group the name of their district.

Mrs. Isabel has been preparing and selling meals, breakfast, lunch and dinner for 30 years. Her hard work and dedication allowed her two children to become professionals. She now has her own restaurant and is requesting a loan to improve her business. We know that Mrs. Isabel will obtain her goals with effort and hard work and the loan from Edaprospo would contribute.

loans.use: To improve the business

loans.name: Roxanne

texts.en:
Roxanne is a married woman who lives in Daanbantayan, Cebu. She earns her living buying and selling dry goods.  Her husband Elmer, who is 35 years old, works as a vendor to earn his living and helps in his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are 7 to 17 years old. Roxanne joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past six loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Roxanne has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 7,000, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 7th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 15,000, which she intends to use to pay for more stocks for her business so that she can continue to save up for future education and expansion of her business. Roxanne is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed upon a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by joining the NWTF Kiva lending team at http://www.kiva.org.

loans.use: To purchase more stock to sell

loans.name: Marina Del Carmen

texts.es: Marina Del Carmen tiene 48 años. Su actividad económica es una panadería. Hace más de 6 años que inicio esta actividad ya que por medio de sus hijos ella decide incursionar en este negocio, pues es muy rentable y Maria estaba interesada en aprender este negocio. Su familia brinda el apoyo necesario en este negocio y así fue como unidos salieron adelante. El motivo del crédito es para la compra de harina, huevos, mantequilla entre otros productos necesarios.  Para un futuro le gustaría seguir apoyando a sus hijos para que salgan adelante.
texts.en: Marina Del Carmen is 48 years old. Her business is a bakery. It has been more than 6 years since she began this business as she decided to invest in it through her children as it is very profitable and Maria was interested in learning this business. Her family provides the necessary support in this business and by working together have been successful. The loan will be used to buy flour, eggs, butter, and other needed products. In the future she would like to continue supporting her children so that they will be successful and able to get ahead in life.

loans.use: Working capital for her business

loans.name: Lucio

texts.es:
El señor Lucio V. D. es de la Calle San Francisco, distrito de Guayaybide la ciudad de Santaní.
El señor es casado y tiene 3 hijos, una casa propia, y su señora es ama de casa; el señor es propietario de una despensa en su propio domicilio, además se dedica a la agricultura, posee plantaciones de piña, banana y mandioca, es una persona muy humilde, trabajadora, honesta y muy responsable, posee buenas referencias comerciales y personales.
El señor manifestó que empezó a vender piña, banana y mandioca en un carrito por toda la zona de Guayaybi, asi mantenía a su familia, con esmero y sacrificio salió adelante y siempre soñaba en tener una despensa propia, ahora que lo tiene sueña en ampliar su local y así cargar más su negocio para obtener más clientes y aumentar sus volúmenes de ventas mensuales, para poder cumplir las cuotas con la Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
Lucio V. D. lives on the Calle San Francisco, in the Guayaybide neighborhood of the city of Santaní.  He is married and has 3 children.  He owns his home and his wife stays at home.  He is the owner of a small grocery store located in his home.  He also farms and has pineapple, banana, and manioc fields.  He is very humble, hardworking, honest and very responsible.  He has good professional and personal references.  

He tells us that he began selling pineapples, bananas and manioc from a cart in the Guayaybi area to support his family.  With hard work and sacrifice he was successful, and he always had dreamed of having his own shop.  Now that he does, he would like to expand and increase his stock. This will enable him to have more customers and increase his monthly sales, to be able to make his payment with the Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to expand his shop and purchase more food items.

loans.name: Anconeras Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El esposo D. Flor se dedica a la pesca artesanal por más D. 40 años  ella y su familia  viven  en Ancón un puerto pesquero al norte D. lima, su negocio empezó  cuando ella se dio cuenta que los pescadores D. la zona requerían D. algunos instrumentos D. pesca sobretodo  redes que son muy necesarias para el trabajo que ellos realizan, fue  con  su primer préstamo D.  EDAPROSPO que pudo comprar algunas redes para incursionar en este negocio, sus  primeras redes  las  puso en alquiler  la temporada D. verano es muy buena por que tiene mucha demanda, este mes fue un poco difícil debido al tsunami ocurrido en Japón ya que pocos se animaron a entrar al mar, su préstamo actual le servirá para comprar mas redes y también reparar las que están deterioradas ella quiere mantenerse en este negocio y seguir creciendo, Flor es la secretaria del grupo “ANCONERAS EMPRENDEDORAS” ella es feliz por pertenecer a este grupo que la ayuda a seguir creciendo  en su negocio.

* Flor es la quinta D. las paradas viste polo celeste, en la foto también aparece una invitada del grupo.
texts.en:
For over 40 years Flor's husband has dedicated his life to artisan fishing.  She and her family live in Ancón which is a fishing port north of Lima.  She began her business when she realized that some fisherman in the area needed fishing supplies, especially the nets they use.  With her first loan through EDAPROSPO she bought several nets to get started.  

She began renting the nets in the summer months when demand was the highest.  This month business will be a little slow because of the tsunami in Japan which kept many fisherman from going out to sea.
