She plans to use the loan to buy more nets and repair the ones she has.  She wants to continue with and expand her business.  Flor is the secretary of the "ANCONERAS EMPRENDEDORAS" group, which she is happy to be a part of because of the support she receives in her aim to expand.

* Flor is the fifth from the left standing, dressed in light blue.  Also in the photo is a person invited by the group.

loans.use: To buy nets for artisan fishing

loans.name: Zoila

texts.es: Zoila tiene 38  años y es madre soltera de un hijo. Vive en casa de padres en la cual está ubicada a tres minutos del centro de la ciudad de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Zoila gana la vida brindando el servicio de costura. Zoila confecciona blusas,  pantalones, vestidos de fiesta, polos, carteras y otros tipos de ropa y accesorios. Cuenta con clientela fidelizada ya que tiene 05 años de experiencia en el rubro. Zoila desea invertir su crédito en la compra de una máquina recubridora, con la cual tendrá mejores acabados en la confección de polos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, Zoila podrá seguir ofreciendo un servicio de alta calidad. Con los ingresos de su negocio, cuida a su hijo y solventa sus gastos familiares. Zoila ha manejado otros préstamos y ha pagado sus cuotas con puntualidad.
texts.en:
Zoila, 38, is a single mother of one son.  She lives in her parents’ house located three minutes from downtown Lambayeque in northern Perú.  Zoila earns her livelihood working as a Seamstress.  She makes blouses, pants, party outfits, polo-style shirts, purses and other types of clothes and accessories.  She has a base of regular customers because she has 5 years experience in this line of work.  

Zoila wants to use her loan to buy a cover stitch sewing machine that will produce better finishings on the polo shirts.  Because of this she’s thought it convenient to request a 2000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa.  With this investment Zoila will be able to continue to offer a high quality service.

With income from her business she cares for her son and covers family expenses.  Zoila has had loans in the past and has paid her installments punctually.

loans.use: to buy a covers stitch sewing machine.

loans.name: Yajaira Cecilia

texts.es:
Yajaira B. Santo Domingo, tiene 35 años y se dedica al tradicional oficio de confecciones sobre medidas específicas, actividad  que combina perfectamente con la venta de mercancías variada al detalle y  que le han generado ingresos,  con los cuales ha logrado apoyar la gestión de su hogar,  conformado por su cónyuge y sus dos hijos en las edades de 1 y 5 años de edad  y que son su motor  en la vida y sueña con verlos convertidos en personas exitosas y muy educadas.
Su negocio nació cuando se quedó sin trabajo y emprendió su propio negocio con su liquidación con tal de continuar apoyando el bienestar de su hogar y poner al servicio de la comunidad sus conocimientos mientras generaba su sustento.  El credikiva es su quinto financiamiento con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo,  con el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como telas, hilos, correderas,  para confeccionar vestidos femeninos que venderá a sus clientes,  para que las mujeres  de su familia vistan elegantemente en el día de las madres.  Con sus anteriores financiamientos ha logrado aumentar su capital de trabajo y con ellos los ingresos familiares; hora su sueño es lograr hacer mejoramientos a su vivienda hasta que esté totalmente confortable. Mientras Yajaira trabaja en lograr sus sueños, también se esmera en fortalecer su negocio mediante su trabajo para sostenerlo y posicionarlo.
texts.en:
Yajaira B. Santo Domingo, 35, makes a living as a seamstress and makes clothing to specific measurements.  This activity goes perfectly with her retail sales of various merchandise.  This has generated income for her, which lets her support her home, which is made up of her, her husband, and two children, who are 1 and 5.  They are her motivation in life, and she dreams about seeing them become successful, well-educated people.

Her business was born when she lost her job, so she started her own business so she could continue supporting the well-being of her family and serve the community with her knowledge while generating income.  This is her fifth Kiva credit with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with which she will buy supplies like fabric, thread, and notions to make feminine dresses to sell to her clients so women can dress elegantly on Mother's Day.  With her previous credits, she increased her working capital and her family's income.  Her dream is to make improvements to her home until it is completely comfortable.  While Yajaira works on achieving her dreams, she also goes to a lot of trouble to strengthen her business to sustain it and to position it well.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fabric, thread, and notions.

loans.name: Segundo Jacinto

texts.es:
Segundo Jacinto R. P. tiene 33 años, es casado vive con la esposa y con los hijos en  el Cantón Guaranda Provincia de Bolívar. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C.  GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY se encuentra ubicada en la comunidad El rayo, parroquia Guanujo, cantón Guaranda a una distancia de 25 minutos de la oficina de la Cooperativa se dedica a diferentes actividades como: agricultura, ganadería, comercio, crianza de animales, albañearía y aserradero.

Luis se dedica a aserrador de madera en la ciudad de Riobamba. Las compras las realiza en el mercado de Guaranda y las vende en el mercado mayorista de la misma ciudad.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar insumos para trabajar en la agricultura. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentar desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es tener un vehículo para el trabajo.

Le gusta escuchar música.
texts.en:
33-year old Segundo Jacinto R. P. is married and lives with his wife and two children in Guaranda canton, in the province of Bolívar.

The members of V.R.C. GRUPO NUCANCHI KAWSAY live in the community of El Rayo, in Guanujo parish, in the canton of Guaranda, about 25 minutes from the Cooperative’s office. The members are involved in such activities as agriculture, livestock, business, animal raising, construction, and a sawmill.

Luis is a wood saw operator in the town of Riobamba. He buys supplies in the Guaranda market and sells the products in the wholesale market in the same town.

He is seeking a loan to buy agricultural supplies. The money will help him economically to obtain much-needed items. The problems he faces include insect infestations, illness, and a difficult climate. His dream is to own a vehicle he can use for work.

Luis enjoys listening to music.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies

loans.name: Martina

texts.es: Martina tiene 54 años,  vive con su esposo y 2 de sus 5 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niño, sus padres le enseñaron la agricultura, actividad que por muchos años ha sido una fuente de ingresos para su familia. Actualmente lo sigue, siendo sus días dedicándose a la siembra, así como también en la venta de animales y leche. Entre los productos que cultiva principalmente son el maíz y la papa; sin embargo en esta actividad requiere de mucho esfuerzo por lo que tiene que contratar a jornaleros para que le ayuden en la siembra y en la cosecha. Al final sus productos son comercializados en la ciudad de Lima, pues ahí es donde recibe más ganancias.  Por otro lado trabaja de manera dependiente, como personal administrativo en un centro educativo, que se encuentra muy cerca de su casa, trabajo que le toma medio día, y el resto lo dedica a la actividad agrícola. En delante desea mejorar en la producción de sus cosechas, por ello espera que la ayuden con un pequeño aporte para que continúe en este trabajo. Este será su crédito número 18 con MFP, manifiesta que trabajar en un banco comunal es una de las mejores experiencias que ha tenido, porque le agrada ver a su grupo unido y bien organizado. Asimismo se compromete nuevamente a ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono ya que sembrará alfalfa, que el alimento indispensable de sus animales.
texts.en:
Martina, 54, lives with her husband and two of her five children in her own house.  Since childhood her parents taught her to farm, an activity that has been a source of family income for many years.  She’s still in this line of work dedicating days to planting as well as in selling animals and milk.  Among the products she grows are corn and potatoes, mainly.  However, this activity requires a lot of effort so she must hire day laborers during harvest and planting to help her.  At the end, her products are sold in the city of Lima because that’s where the best profits are to be had.

On the other hand, she is employed as part of the administrative staff of a school that’s very near her home, a job that is half time; the rest of her time is spent on farming.  She’d like to improve her crops and hopes to be helped with a small contribution to continue with this work.

This will be loan #8 with MFP.  She states that working in a communal bank is one of the best experiences she’s had because it pleases her to see her group unified and well organized.  She once again commits to be very punctual with her payments.  She will use the requested loan to buy sacks of manure because she will plant alfalfa which is an indispensable food for her animals.

loans.use: to buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en:
Lilian is a 38 year-old businesswoman.  She is married and a mother of  four children. Lilian has been running a green grocer business in an open air market for the past 15 years. Her monthly income is KES. 30,000. 

She is applying for her second loan from KADET LTD, after paying the first loan successfully. She will use the loan to purchase cabbages, kale, onions, potatoes and tomatoes for sale. 

With the anticipated profit from the business, she plans to invest it back into the business. Her hopes and dreams are to expand her business and improve the living standard of her family.

loans.use: to purchase potatoes and vegetables for sale

loans.name: Emerlyn

texts.en:
Emerlyn is 30 years old and has 2 children, 1 of whom is in school.

Emerlyn is in the agricultural business farming coconuts in the Philippines.  She has requested a loan for PHP 29500 through NWTF to pay for laborer  salaries and purchase more coconuts from her neighbors to sell in bulk.

Emerlyn has been farming coconuts for 8 years now, and has borrowed 29 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her farming activities.

In the future, Emerlyn would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her child to college.

loans.use: pay for labor and buy coconuts

loans.name: Oswaldo

texts.en: Oswaldo is 21 years old and lives in Machachi, Ecuador. He is single and lives with his mother. Oswaldo is an enterprising person who confronts problems calmly so that they can be resolved. He is engaged in the sale of oil and other industrial lubricants. He is seeking this loan to acquire more products to sell and expand his business. Oswaldo began his business two years ago. At the beginning, he did not have much success and almost “threw in the towel” until his mother’s encouragement helped him move forward. With his income, he helps his mother support his younger siblings. This is his second loan from FODEMI. Oswaldo reports that his first loan helped him expand his merchandise. He hopes this loan will help him give more support to his family. His dream is to continue growing his business and supporting his family.

loans.use: to buy more oil and industrial lubricants to sell

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is a resident of Kitale, where she works as a kindergarten teacher. She also practices farming. 

She has been farming for over 20 years with her produce of milk, maize and beans going to the local market. She is the mother of six children who are all adults, though the last born is still in school.

Florence requested a loan of 31,200 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to purchase and insure a dairy cow. She says her focus is to see the last born through his education, and she strongly believes farming will help her achieve this. She hopes to have acquired two more dairy cows in five years.

She says market fluctuations and animal diseases are the greatest challenges in farming.

loans.use: To purchase and insure a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aliaxsar Hermogenes

texts.es:
Aliaxsar de 27 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su menor hijo en su casa propia, la cual cuenta sólo con servicio de luz, ubicada en el distrito de Pomahuaca que pertenece al departamento de Cajamarca.  Zona que se caracteriza por la actividad agrícola, ganadera, minera y turismo.

La actividad que desarrolla Aliaxsar es la agricultura, cuenta con sus propias tierras de cultivo donde siembra café, con una experiencia de 2 años, una vez que realiza su cosecha su producto los ofrece a los diferentes mercados de la zona donde vive y a otros sitios también, así puede obtener ingresos para cubrir sus gastos y necesidades familiares. 

Ha solicitado un préstamo a Edpyme Alternativa de 1000 nuevos soles para comprar fertilizantes para mejorar sus tierras como su producto y en pago de mano de obra  gastos cuando se cosecha el producto, con la finalidad de ofertarlo a un mejor precio a los comerciantes y así tener mejoras económicamente.  Aliaxsar es una persona que se preocupa porque sus tierras cada vez sean más productivas para poder brindarle más adelante una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Aliaxsar, 27, lives with his wife and minor son in his own house which only has electricity and is located in Pomahuaca District that belongs to Cajamarca Department, a zone noted for farming, animal husbandry, mining and tourism.

Aliaxsar’s activity is farming.  He has his own fields where he grows coffee.  He has two years’ experience.  Once his harvests are in he sells his products in various local markets in the zone where he lives and in other places too to earn income to cover expenses and family needs.

He has requested a 1000 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa to buy fertilizer to improve his land and his coffee and to pay labor costs for harvesting so that he can sell it to merchants at a better price and thus improve economically.

Aliaxsar is a person who is concerned that his land be more productive every time to provide his family with a better quality of life later on.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet lives in Uganda. She is single and has three children, two of whom are in school.  Harriet operates a restaurant as a business.  She has been in this business for two years, and she works six days out of every week.  Harriet sells her products at the market, by means of retail. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes. 

The main business challenges for Harriet include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a fully stocked restaurant. Harriet lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent, medication and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bunches of bananas, beef, rice and sweet potatoes.

loans.name: Annalie

texts.en:
Annalie is 34 years old, married, and has three children. The oldest child is 9 years old.

Annalie has been engaged in farming for 10 years. She helps her husband plant rice and corn crops on their land. They earn about 9,000 PHP per month doing this farming.

Annalie is requesting a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. This loan will help Annalie’s family continue generating income from their farm.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 34 years old, married to Francis, and they are blessed with two children. Hellen runs a clinic in Kituluni, Kenya. She has been in this business for the last seven years and earns an income of KES 20,000 per month.

Hellen has got good credit history with KADET and she is applying for her sixth loan of KES 65,000 from KADET LTD which she plans to use to buy modernized equipment and medicine for sale. 

She will use the extra profit to diversify the business. She hopes to own a private hospital. She is very hardworking.

loans.use: To purchase medical equipment etc.

loans.name: Jerry

texts.en:
Jerry is 21 years old and lives in San Vicente Bajo. He is married with one child. 

To earn a living, Jerry has a business selling different kinds of dried fish. He earns about PHP 1,500 each month doing this work. Jerry has requested a loan of 5,000 to purchase dried fish for his retail business.

Jerry has been a member of PMPC for three years.  In the future, Jerry would like to have a space to sell his dried fish in the market.

loans.use: to purchase dried fish for his retail business

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is from the village of Lalog 1, Luna, Isabela. She is 53 years old, married and has two children. Susana owns and operates a farm, primarily planting and harvesting corn for sale. Susana has been engaged in her business for over 30 years and earned approximately 55,000 PHP for the last cropping

Susana is requesting a loan of 30,000 PHP to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizer. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support extended members of her family.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, pesticides and fertilizer

loans.name: Ma. Gina

texts.en:
Ma. Gina is 43 years old and is a married woman with five children. She lives in the town of Talibon, Bohol with her family. Ma. Gina's husband is a fisherman.

Ma. Gina has had a sari-sari (variety) store business for five years. She sells items like soft drinks, rice, corn and daily use products like soap and shampoo. Each month, Ma. Gina earns 15,000 PHP with her sari-sari store business. She requested a loan to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, soap, rice and corn. Ma. Gina hopes to improve her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell such as soft drinks, soap, rice and corn.

loans.name: Ynes

texts.es: Ynes tiene 46 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y amable, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Hernán de 46 años y sus 05 queridos hijos, quienes son el principal motivo de sus esfuerzos. Ynes se dedica a la venta de combustible, negocio por el que la gente recurre la mayoría de veces. La amabilidad de Ynes hizo que la gente compre combustible sin duda alguna. Tiene 02 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que permanecer durante el día y noche sin descansar. En adelante espera incrementar más productos para su tienda de combustible como: aceites para carros, lubricantes.  Este será su crédito número 06 con MFP y esta dispuesta a seguir pagando sus cuotas a tiempo. En su banco comunal es participe en todas las reuniones que se realiza. Con los 3,000 soles que solicita, podrá comprar productos para su tienda de combustible como: aceites para carros, lubricante, entre otros.
texts.en: Ynes is 46 years old and is a hardworking and friendly woman who lives in her own house with her husband Hernan of 46 years of age and her 5 dear children, who are the main reason for her efforts. Ynes sells fuel, a business which is most used by people. Ynes' friendliness convinces people to buy fuel without a doubt. She has been doing this work for 2 years and believes that the hardest part of the job is having to be permanently available, day and night, without being able to rest. In the future she hopes to increase the number of products for her fuel store such as: car oil, lubricants. This will be her 6th loan with MFP and she is willing to continue paying her repayments on time. She takes part in all the meetings her communal bank holds. With the 3,000 soles (PEN) she will be able to buy products for her store such as: car oil, lubricants among others.

loans.use: to buy fuel, oil and lubricants for cars.

loans.name: Ammabille

texts.en:
Ammabile. a 36-year-old married mother of two children, has been operating a retail store that sells canned goods, detergents and batteries for two years now. As well, she and her husband own a motorcycle used to transport passengers in their village.

A member of HSPFI since 2007, Ammabile is requesting a loan of PHP 30,000 to buy stocks such as detergents, batteries and canned goods for the sari sari store and to pay for the maintenance of their motorcycle. In the future, she hopes to improve both her businesses and her family's standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for motorcycle maintenance and to buy additional items to sell in the sari sari store.

loans.name: Biasha

texts.en:
Biasha, 35, is a married woman with three children all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, she has operated a food stall business, selling from home to her neighbours and passersby. Her major challenge is the high cost of transportation of food staff from the market to her place of operation. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing a clothes selling business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily is a 24-year-old, hardworking lady from Migori County, Western Kenya. She is married to David and they have two children. 

Emily has been operating a tomato selling business in Suna Ragana for the past six years. She is taking her third loan from KADET LTD which she will use to purchase new stock of tomatoes for sale. She will use her profits to expand her business by adding to her tomato stock.

Her dream is to continue doing this kind of business to support her family.

loans.use: To buy stock of tomatoes.

loans.name: Guillermina

texts.es: La señora Guillermina se dedica al comercio de camas y frazadas al por menor. El crédito que solicita es para compra de más camas y frazadas en distintos tamaños, colores y así aprovechar las ventas de fin de año. Guillermina es soltera y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa en anticretico ubicada en la zona  23 de Marzo  de la Ciudad de El Alto. Guillermina se encuentra muy satisfecha con los créditos  otorgados (que son cuatro, todos pagados en su totalidad) ya que le ayudo a mejorar  su calidad de vida. Es la segunda vez que desea trabajar con kiva.
texts.en:
Sra. Guillermina sells beds and blankets at retail. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more beds and blankets in different sizes and colors so that she can take advantage of year-end sales. Guillermina is single and has one child. She lives in a rented home in the March 23rd District in the city of El Alto.

Guillermina is very pleased with the loans she has received (four in total, all of which have been paid in full) because they have helped to improve her quality of life. This is the second time she has wanted to work with Kiva.

loans.use: to buy beds and blankets to sell during the Christmas season.

loans.name: Ninalita

texts.en:
Ninalita is 33 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has two children. 

Ninalita has a food shop or sari-sari store that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan for 5,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages. 

Ninalita is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Ninalita hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Ofeira

texts.en:
Ofeira is thirty-seven years of age and is married with four children.

Ofeira owns and operates a business venture sewing clothes to sell to her villages . She has one year of experience in this business. Ofeira needs a loan of WST 1,000 to purchase materials , threads and needles.  She plans to use the profit from her business (estimated to be 350 talas or US $146 per week) to improve/expand the business.

In 2011, Ofeira joined SPBD to gain access to financial services. Most of SPBD's clients are unable to borrow from commercial banks, because they lack collateral.  This is Ofeira's first loan with SPBD.

loans.use: to purchase materials, threads and needles

loans.name: Jamla

texts.en:
Jamla is 32 years old and married. She lives in Al Salt, Al Balqa, Jordan.
Jamla is looking to have a loan of 1000 JDs so she can expand her trading in home products by buying more quantities. She wishes her project to be bigger and more successful.

loans.use: to buy home products to sell

loans.name: Seth's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from Kampong Cham province, Seth is 57 years old and married. She is a  mother of three children. To struggles for a living, she grows cashew nut as the main source of her income. it is the business that she has had for several years. Now, in a group of two, she is a leader. For Seth, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer, labor cost, and to pay for reaping fee. She strongly hopes that she can gain a good yield than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, labor cost, and to pay for reaping fee.

loans.name: Gbenan Group

texts.fr: GBENAN est un groupe composé de trois personnes qui résident dans le même quartier. C’est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'appui financier de ALIDé. La représentante du groupe, du nom de Afiavi Sidonie (celle qui a la main levée sur la photo) est âgée de 38 ans. Afiavi Sidonie est mariée à un soudeur du nom de Antoine. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés et à leur charge. Les diverses charges du ménage sont supportées par Afiavi Sidonie et son mari. Pour cette raison, Afiavi Sidonie vend des fruits de saison par la technique de distribution depuis douze ans. De façon secondaire, Afiavi Sidonie vend égaelment des bidons d'huile végétale ; ce qui lui permet de mieux faire face aux besoins de ses enfants et à leur éducation. Afiavi Sidonie s’approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d’affaire et son revenu, Afiavi Sidonie sollicite ensemble avec les membres du groupe GBENAN, un deuxième crédit auprès de ALIDé. Le crédit reçus antérieurement a été bien remboursé.

loans.use: Acheter des fruits de saisons et des bidons d'huile.

loans.name: Louise Gbègniwannan

texts.fr: Âgée de 42 ans, Louise Gbègniwannan n'a pas fréquenté l’école. Louise Gbègniwannan ne vit plus avec son mari. Louise Gbègniwannan est mère de cinq enfants, dont certains scolarisés. Louise Gbègniwannan vit toute seule et assure toute seule ses divers besoins.  Pour cette raison, Louise Gbègniwannan vend des objets de piété à son domicile et de façon ambulante. Louise Gbègniwannan s'approvisionne dans un un marché du Bénin et au Nigéria. La clientèle de Julienne devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, Louise Gbègniwannan sollicite une sixième fois l’appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits reçus antérieurement ont été bien remboursés.

loans.use: Acheter des objets de piété.

loans.name: Remely

texts.en:
Remely is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Remely is 31 years old and has two children are still in school.

Remely has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Remely requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more fresh fish to sell to her customers.

Remely has been in this business for 2 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fresh fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Kamala

texts.en:
Kamala was born in Siyazan region of Azerbaijan. After wedding they moved to Sumgait. Difficulties of life forced them to start the business. She is the only breadwinner in the family. In the beginning she used to sell vegetables. By borrowing the loan amount of $400 she wants to buy refrigerator and improve condition of her family. 

She applies for $400 to buy the refrigerator.

loans.use: To buy the refrigerator

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Expand and diversify my business

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica is in a polygamous marriage with two children. Emotional, financial and health necessities are her motivation to start a small income-generating business with the hope of seeing it grow. Encouraged by group members, she has successfully completed GHAPE's initial capacity building training covering topics like marketing techniques, group dynamics, basic health care, credit and general management.

With her determination and training and given a loan of $75, Veronica plans to buy logs to chop in small pieces and sell as firewood. Firewood is the major source of energy for cooking in this community. There is an available market. Veronica plans to repay the loan in a timely manner.

loans.use: purchase logs to make firewood

loans.name: Mario Alberto

texts.es:
Mario is married and has a 3 year old son. Facing a lack of jobs and the need to secure an income, Mario began selling snacks from a table he set up in front of his house. His home faces a plaza frequented by many people, and his business grew as a result of that traffic. When his wife became pregnant with their second child this summer, Mario sought to increase their income by selling yuckis, a drink made of crushed ice and flavored syrup, similar to a slushie. This was very well received in the summer months.

Mario is requesting a loan in the amount of US $750, to be repaid in 6 months, to purchase a cart to carry his products around to other plazas in the vicinity in order to increase his sales. He hopes you will want to support his growing business and thanks you for your assistance.

Translated from Spanish by Rosario McFaull, Kiva Volunteer.

Mario es casado y tiene un pequeño hijo de 3 años de edad. Ante la falta de empleo y la necesidad de contar con un ingreso Mario comenzó a vender botanas en una mesa afuera de su casa y como enfrente hay una plaza su negocio comenzó a crecer ya que pasan muchas personas por ese lugar, en este verano su esposa se embarazó de su segundo hijo y para poder lograr mayores recursos Mario incorporó a su negocio la venta de yuckis, que es una bebida a base de hielo picado con jarabe de sabores, muy consumido en temporada de calor, por lo que tuvo buena aceptación de sus clientes.

En estos momentos Mario está solicitando un préstamo de $ 750 dólares que utilizará en la compra de un vehículo que le permita desplazar sus productos para venderlos en las plazas cercanas y poder hacer crecer su negocio, él se compromete a regresar esta cantidad en 6 meses. Se parte importante en el crecimiento de este negocio y ayuda a quien más lo necesita, muchas gracias.

loans.use: To buy a food cart and supplies/inventory

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Isatu is twenty-six years old, married, and has one child.  She is a member of ROSCAs (Village Rotating Savings Clubs) and sells palm oil in Makeni town of Sierra Leone.  Her husband is also a petty trader in the same market and both work hard to earn an income for the family.  She is requesting a loan of $250 so she can expand her market business and increase her income.  Her savings with the ROSCAs club will enable her to repay her loan on time and help her save for future investments.  She and her husband dream of building a house for their family.

loans.use: Epansion of her business in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Purchase raw goods.

loans.name: Jorge Felix

texts.es:
Jorge is 57 years old and has been separated from his former wife for many years, having taken charge of his children. The youngest son, 21 years old, lives with him but is becoming financially independent since he started working 8 months ago.

Jorge works as a taxi driver and delivers correspondence for a courier business as well. He has great experience as a taxi worker, since he’s been in the business for many years. He is also well known by some courier business that retain his services on a temporal basis.

There is an intermediate degree of competition in the field and, as the number of vehicles grows, so does the demand.

With the loan Jorge will buy tires for his taxi. The amount is sufficient for exactly four of them.

Jorge is a long time client of Agrocapital, the only lending institution he works with, and this is the sixth loan he has requested.

Translated from Spanish by Leticia Britos, Kiva Volunteer.

Jorge es un señor de 57 años de edad, se encuentra separado de su esposa hace muchos años y él se hizo cargo de sus hijos, el menor de los cuales -de 21 años- actualmente vive con él pero empezó a trabajar hace 8 meses, por lo que ya está independizándose económicamente.

Jorge se dedica al transporte de pasajeros brindando sus servicios como taxista, y aprovecha sus recorridos para hacer entregas de correspondencia para una empresa de courier. Trabaja con su taxi desde hace muchos años, por lo que tiene bastante experiencia. También es conocido por algunas empresas de courier que contratan temporalmente sus servicios.

La competencia en el rubro es media, y así como el parque automotor crece, también está creciendo la demanda.

Con el crédito comprara llantas para su taxi; el monto le alcanza exactamente para 4 llantas aro 13.

Jorge trabaja hace bastante tiempo con la institución, la única con la que trabaja, siendo este el sexto crédito que solicita en Agrocapital.

loans.use: Purchase of tires for his taxi.

loans.name: Zenobia's Group

texts.en:
Victoria and Zenobia have been members of the members of the community bank Kallpanchik for 1 1/2 and 2 1/2 years respectively. In this time they have learned to be responsible and punctual. They say that they enjoy coming to weekly meetings because they can forget the problems they have at home.

Victoria is 38 years old and has six children. She has been selling shish kabob from a stand in the market for eight years. Before that she washed laundry but it maD. her sick. Zenobia is 40 years old and has three children. She has owned a grocery store for the past 12 years. Before that she sold grocery staples from a cart but since buying her house she has been able to sell more products from her home.

Victoria and Zenobia need loans of 200 and 1200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in meat, onions, flour, rice, sugar, and other similar products.

Both women have a savings account with their community bank and are saving in case of an emergency and to buy a car. Victoria and Zenobia dream of continuing to develop their businesses.

loans.use: Victoria and Zenobia need loans of 200 and 1200 soles respectively (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in meat, onions, flour, rice, sugar, and other similar products.

loans.name: Murodjon

texts.en: K. Murodjon started working as an odd-job worker in a plant repairing vehicles.  In time, he became the master assistant. Mr. K. has been working in the plant since he was 14 years old. Now he is the master in the plant and has his own station on the technical vehicles service. He is very experienced in repairing vehicles and has repeat clients who come only to him. Mr. K. is applying to  MicroInvest for a 3100 TJS ($900) loan to purchase special equipment for technical service.

loans.use: Purchasing special equipment

loans.name: Melva

texts.es:
Melva sells a variety of goods, especially candies, cookies, sodas, etc. near a school. She has become the top seller in the area. In order to offer more goods, she is requesting this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Rives, Kiva Volunteer.

La señora Melva oferta diversos productos y en especial caramelos, galletas, refrescos, etc, cerca de un centro de estudios y se ha convertido en la mejor comerciante de esa zona. Su deseo de incrementar su capital para ofertar mayor cantidad de productos la conducen a solicitar un préstamo.

loans.use: To be able to offer more goods

loans.name: Isaac

texts.en:
Isaac S. is a dealer of home appliances. He is married and has 4 children. His wife is helping him meet the family’s needs. Business is doing very well, and he wishes to improve the business.

He is asking for $525 as additional capital to buy more goods (appliances) for sale.

loans.use: As additional capital to buy more goods (appliances) for sale

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Kwame is a father of 3 children. All his children are currently in school. He buys blunt cutlasses and hoes and sharpens them for retailing to farmers. Most farmers in Ghana use cutlasses and hoes as the main farm tools to work in the farms and therefore the demand for cutlasses and hoes is high, especially as it is a farming season. Kwame wants to use his loan to buy more cutlasses and hoes to enable more farmers to have access to tools to farm. He is a member of the group called Paul Amantem. Members guarantee for each other as social collateral to repay the loan. Kwame is sharpening cutlasses in the photo and beside him is his assistant.

loans.use: To buy more cutlasses and hoes for farmers

loans.name: Sarun

texts.en:
Mr. Sarun Chorn, 51, and his wife, Mrs. Saron Chem (shown in the picture) were married in 1977. They have nine children--three sons and six daughters. Three of the children are married and live outside the family home. The other six children live at home. Four of the children are in school and the other two are garment factory workers. The family lives along National Road number five about 15 kilometers from Phnom Penh. (Note: Mr.Sarun is not in the picture because he was busy teaching at school. His wife appears in the picture instead.)

Mr. Sarun has been a primary school principal for many years while his wife stays at home take care of the children. He started teaching when he finished with his studies.

Mr. Sarun is requesting a loan of $1200 to fill in the land around his house.

loans.use: To fill in the land around the house.

loans.name: José Helidoro

texts.es:
José lives in the 3-80 neighborhood of the city of Managua. He is married with 3 school age children. He has been working as a bricklayer for 20 years. His wife is a domestic working and supports her husband with the household expenses.

Jose's house is still under construction; he has been building it bit by bit due to the family's meager income. He is ready now to build the family's bathroom. He already has the building materials but lacks the toilet, and for that reason he is applying for a loan. He deepest desire is to be able to complete the construction of his home and to have a bedroom for each of his children in order to give them better quality of life.

Translated from Spanish by Erin Corcoran, Kiva volunteer.

Don José habita en el barrio 3-80 de la ciudad de Managua, es casado, tiene 3 hijos, todos en edad escolar. El oficio de Don José es albañilería y tiene 20 años de trabajar en esta actividad. Su esposa es empelada doméstica y apoya a su marido con los gastos del hogar.

La casa donde habita Don José todavía no está terminada de construir, debido a los pocos ingresos que generan la casa la van levantando poco a poco, actualmente necesita construir el servicio higiénico, ya tiene los materiales de construcción sólo le falta el inodoro, y para eso solicita el préstamo. Su mayor anhelo es poder terminar de construir su vivienda, y hacer una habitación para cada uno de sus hijos y así poder darles mejor comodidad y mejor calidad de vida.

loans.use: Buy a toilet for the bathroom he's installing in the family home.

loans.name: Elly

texts.en:
Elly is 30 years old. She is a married with 2 children, aged 1 and 10 years old. She has been a clothes seller since 2005. Every day, she works from 8am to 6pm at her business and can earn a monthly profit of about $155 from her sales.

Elly now hopes for a loan to buy more clothes for her business.

loans.use: To buy more clothes for her business.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.es:
Modesta tiene 5 hijos de 16, 13, 7, 5 y 3 años de edad, su esposo trabaja en el área rural como agricultor. Ella y los niños viven en la calle Sgto de Munaypata  de la zona villa Cooperativa en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Su oficio es la compra de ovejas en el área rural, animales que luego vende en la feria semanal de la zona, igualmente, realiza tejidos a mano para obtener mayores ingresos.

El crédito lo destinará en la compra de ganado. 
 
Es su segundo  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Modesta has five children of 16, 13, 7, 5, and 3 years of age. Her husband works in a rural area as a farmer. She and the children live on Sgto de Munaypata street in the "villa Cooperativa" zone in the city of El Alto.

Her craft is the purchase of sheep in rural area, animals that she later sells in the weekly market in the area, also, she makes textiles by hand to make more income.

The loan will be allocated to the purchase of livestock.

This is her second loan with Impro. The completed evaluation qualifies her for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Joanna Silverman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Business Capital

loans.name: Akoele

texts.fr: Akoele L. est âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants. Elle est revendeuse de céréale à Lomé, la capitale togolaise. Akoele espère par ce crédit, faire des stocks de maïs, de mil, arachide et de haricot. Cette chance lui permettra de subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants
texts.en:
Akoele L. is 39 years old, married and the mother of five children. She is a retail vendor of cereal grains in Lomé, the capital of Togo. With this loan, Akoele hopes to restock her inventory of corn, millet, peanuts and beans. This opportunity will allow her to provide for the needs of her children.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Restock inventory of corn, millet, peanuts and beans to meet customer demand

loans.name: Flora

texts.en: Flora sells clothes, wrappers, bags, shoes and laces in her house. The demand for her goods is high. Flora lives in Ajamgbadi, Lagos State, Nigeria. She is a LAPO client. Flora is requesting  a loan in the amount of N140,000 to purchase more clothes, shoes, laces, and bags to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sreng

texts.en: Mr. Sreng S. is 30 years old, has two young children, and lives in the Krodas Kor village in Kampong Cham Province. He earns income cultivating rice on a piece of land that he owns, while his wife, Mrs. Koeun Chhen, breeds pigs. Mr. Sreng S.'s rice plantation is not very productive, as the fertility of the soil is low. He has therefore decided to ask for a loan to be able to purchase fertilizers and thereby improve the productivity of his farming business.

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for a rice field

loans.name: Mrs. Morn Penh Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Morn P. is the village bank president for nine people who are all living in Tropang Chom Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. All the members will use the loan which they have obtained for different purposes. For instance, Mrs. Morn P. is requesting a loan to buy more grocery products for her inventory since her business is going well. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan. Her husband, Mr. Chay Senh, helps her with the current business. Mrs. Morn P. is 61 years old and the mother of two children both employed in different positions in Phnom P. city, Cambodia. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of partially end-of-term loans. Four members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT borrowers are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more grocery products for her inventory

loans.name: Moses' Group

texts.en:
M. Moses is one of the executive members of Ndwaddemutwe group in Lugazi, Uganda. He is a very hard working man who has operated a private clinic for more than 10 years. Moses has received medical training and his clinic treats people from his locality who cannot afford the high transportation costs to get medical care in a major trade center. He has all kinds of medication in his clinic that he buys from the pharmacies in Kayunga and Kampala where the prices are more favorable, allowing him to treat his patients at a lower rate.

Moses has a wife and children who work the family farm back in the village and this helps to reduce food costs. As one of his achievements, out of his savings he has purchased a plot in the trading center that should sell like a hot cake in the near future. He needs his portion of this group loan to help buy more medicines, including anti-malarial tablets and syrups, syringes, needles, and so on as needed in his village.

loans.use: To purchase medicines and equipment for a clinic.

loans.name: Saniya Group

texts.fr:
Le  groupe Saniya est composé de huit (08) femmes toutes mariées ayant 35 ans et 5 enfants  en moyenne. Elles vivent dans des familles monogamiques dans le quartier Darsalam de Ségou (la 4ème région administrative du Mali).
Ce groupe de femmes fait le petit commerce d’articles divers de poissons de mer, la fabrication de jus locaux, des gâteaux frits (pâté), des pagnes wax etc. Elles ont connu Soro Yiriwaso à travers une commerçante de pagnes wax dans le marché Médine Ségou qui est dans le système depuis plusieurs années.
 Après avoir bien remboursé le 1ier prêt, elles sont à leur 2ème prêt de groupe qui sera utilisé pour acheter, 9 sacs de sucre, 10kg de gingembre, 1sac de citron, 30kg d’oseille de Guinée, 50kg de poudre de pain de singe (fruits de baobab,) 1carton d’essences (aromes) et 18cartons de 20kg de poisson de mer.
 Elles s’approvisionnent en ingrédients de jus locaux au marché de Médine Ségou et en poisson de mer à Bamako auprès d’un grossiste du marché Dibida. Les marchandises sont vendues au marché de Médine, à domicile et en ambulant dans les quartiers au comptant et à crédit à une clientèle composée d’hommes, de femmes et d’enfants. 
Elles espèrent réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 48.000FCA dont une partie est épargnée et le reste rentre dans le remboursement du prêt et la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
The group Saniya is composed of eight women, all married, who average 35 years of age and five children. They live in monogamous families in the Darsalam district of Ségou (fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali). The group members do small-scale commerce in various items... seafood, making local juices, fried cakes (pâté), Wax-brand pagnes cloth, etc. They discovered Soro Yiriwaso through Wax pagnes merchants at the Médine Ségou marketplace, which has been in the system for several years.

After having repaid their first loan, the women of the group are on their second group loan, which will be used to buy: 9 sacks of sugar, 10 kg of ginger, 1 sack of lemons, 30 kg of oseille de Guinée (dried hibiscus flowers), 50 kg of monkey bread powder (from the fruit of the baobab tree), 1 box of flavorings, and 18 boxes of ocean fish (20-kg per box). The local juices are gotten at the Médine Ségou market, and the fish is gotten in Bamako from a wholesaler at the Dibida market. The goods are sold at the Médine market, at home, and door-to-door through the districts, cash or credit accepted, to customers composed of men, women, and children.

They hope to realize an average monthly profit of 48,000 francs CFA, of which a portion will be saved, and the rest, for repaying the loan and covering the children's schooling costs.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients for local drinks and seafood

loans.name: Abed

texts.en:
Abed, 54, lives in Tyre, southern Lebanon with his wife. Abed has owned an accessory shop since 2001. He sells gifts. Abed requested a loan of $1000 USD from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his shop. This is the first time that Abed has requested a loan.

Abed has a big selection in his shop. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and tourists. When he first started his business, he had difficulty purchasing merchandise for his shop as well as diversifying his stock. In the future, Abed plans on expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for his shop

loans.name: Flor De Maria

texts.es:
Flor es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas.
Flor es casada tiene 44 años, tres hijos de 27, 19 y 14 años él ultima está estudiando en la escuela estatal.
Flor  tiene su bodega hace quince años, es un local que su papá le vendió  y la fue pagando poco a poco, sus hijos le ayudan, ella también   hace composturas y cose ropa.   
Flor necesita un crédito de 1600 soles, para la compra de gaseosas, helados.
Desde que está en Finca pudo comprar su máquina exhibidora para las gaseosas, vitrinas, para su bodega  su economía ha mejorado.
El sueño de Flor es surtir más su bodega, y le gustaría poner una cabina de internet.
texts.en:
Flor is a partner in the Amigas Unidas Community Bank. She is 44 years old and married, with three children. Flor's children are 27, 19, and 14 years old, and the youngest attends public school. Flor has had a small store for five years, in a building that her father sold to her. She has paid him back little by little, and her children help. Flor also sews and repairs clothes. Flor needs a loan of 1600 soles, which she'll use to buy sodas and ice creams for the store. Since she's worked with Finca, Flor has bought a cooler for her store, where she showcases the soft drinks for sale. The store has improved her economic situation. Flor dreams of supplying her store with more products, and she'd like to add a station for customers to use the internet.

Translated from Spanish by Sarah Bishop, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy soft drinks and ice creams

loans.name: Le Thi

texts.en:
Hà Lê (1716080910) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoá. She is married and has two small children. To making a living, Hà operates a family member's business venture which is a specialized retail store. While not the only revenue, the main source of income from this business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap and toothpaste in the local community. Hà has been engaged in this business for over five years and earns approximately 5000000 dong a month from these activities.

In 2008, Hà joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Hà is now requesting a loan of 9000000 dong which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. The loan will be the second loan taken out by this borrower from TYM Fund. Hà plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase additional goods for a store

loans.name: Mojisola

texts.en: Mojisola sells sarongs and jewelry. She hopes for the loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more sarongs to sell. Mojisola is 43 years old and married with four children. She says thank you to all Kiva Lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Honorine

texts.fr:
B. Honorine est née le 23/07/1947 à ALLADA, dans le Département de l’Atlantique. Honorine est veuve et mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille. Depuis huit (8) ans Honorine vit chez sa fille à Sènadé, un quartier de  la Commune Cotonou, Capitale Économique du Bénin. Honorine vend des tissus depuis vingt deux (22) ans à domicile. Honorine a vu son activité accroître avec le premier crédit qu’elle a eu de ALIDé. Pour mieux développer son activité Honorine sollicite un deuxième crédit. 

 
La signification de ALIDé en langue locale du Bénin, le Fon, est « un chemin existe toujours pour les plus pauvres ». Le Bénin est un petit pays de l’Afrique de l’Ouest à coté du Nigeria où le PIB par habitant est à $1,500.
texts.en:
B. Honorine was born on July 23, 1947 in ALLADA, in Atlantique County. She is a widow and mother of three children, 2 boys and a girl. For eight years, Honorine has been living with her daughter in Sènadé, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. She has been selling cloth for 22 years at home. She has seen her business grow with the first loan she had with Alidé. To develop her business further, she’s requesting a second loan. Alidé means “there is always a path for the poorest” in Benin’s local language of Fon. Benin is a small West African country located next to Nigeria and has a per capita GDP of $1,500.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ten bolts of Hitarget cloth (25 meters each) and some kitchen utensils

loans.name: Leilanie

texts.en:
Leilanie is 36 years old. She is married to Marlon P., who is a farmer. They were blessed with three children: Kristine Jenel, 16; Queen Xyrish, 15; and Marlon P. Jr., 13. They are all attending high school in their town of Cabatuan, Isabela. Her family resides in Barangay Tandul, where most people produce rice.

Leilanie is a vegetable vendor and hog raiser at the same time. She works hard at her business for the future of her three children. She is requesting a loan of PHP 13,000 to use as additional working capital. Some of the loan will be utilized to buy different vegetables to sell in their village and some will be used to buy five bags of feed for her hog-raising business. She hopes that Kiva will continue to give support to small entrepreneurs like her so that they may also have the ability to help themselves.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and five bags of feed

loans.name: Emma

texts.en: Emma C. is 43 years old and married with two children. She presently resides in Sinacaban, Misamis Occidental. Her loan is intended to buy vitamins and feed for her piglets. She has been a member of Paglaum MPC, a Kiva partner, since March 2005. She admitted that with the help of PMPC-Micofinance, her business has grown in such a way that she has a better income now than before. She is seeking a new loan of Php6,000. She hopes to have a comfortable life someday and to be able to send her children to school so they have a brighter future.

loans.use: To purchase feed and vitamins for the piglets

loans.name: Yovani

texts.es:
La Señora Yovani R. D. tiene 45 años de edad, vive en el distrito de Moche, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
La empresaria presenta estudios hasta 5º de secundaria, tiene 4 hijos quienes dependen económicamente de ella.
Yovani se dedica a la venta de menús en un puesto frente al hospital de essalud de Moche.
Con su primer crédito de 300 nuevos soles, compro insumos como: arroz, fideos, menestras, azúcar, papas, etc para la preparación de menús.
El crédito de 700 soles, lo invertirá en la compra de mas insumos para la preparación de sus menús.
Yovani sueña con ampliar su local y modificar su infraestructura.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yovani R. D. is 45 years old, she lives in the district of Moche, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru.

The entrepreneur studied until 5th grade, she has 4 children who are economically dependent on her. Yovani sells food from a stall in front of the hospital of Moche.

With her first loan of 300 nuevos soles she bought ingredients such as rice, pasta, vegetable stew, sugar, potatoes, etc. to prepare her menus. The loan of 700 soles will be invested in buying more supplies for the preparation of her menus. Yovani dreams of extending her stall and remodel it.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for food preparation.

loans.name: Dianora Del Socorro

texts.es:
En el municipio de Telica de la ciudad de León, la señora Dianora H. ha unido sus esfuerzos para lograr mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia la cual requiere de la inversión en su vivienda de habitación la cual ha sufrido mucho a raíz y que los años han transcurrido y debe ser reconstruida.

Es por este motivo que ella ha acudido a Ceprodel para solicitar un crédito para la compra de los materiales de construcción y de esta forma salir brindar un mejor nivel de vida a su familia que tanto requiere de su apoyo.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Telica in the city of León, Ms. Dianora H. has united her efforts to be able to improve her family's living conditions. This requires an investment in her home, which has suffered much at its foundation as the years have passed by and therefore must be rebuilt. It is for this reason that she has turned to Ceprodel to request a loan to purchase the construction materials and in this way to provide a better quality of life to her family who need her support so much.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Villa Nueva Group

texts.es: El grupo “Villa Nueva” esta representado por la señora Silvia y conformada por 14 miembros que conforman un grupo relativamente nuevo con socias(os) muy responsables en sus pagos y unidos como lo han demostrado en sus reuniones previas. En general los socios se caracterizan en su trabajo por no dejarse vencer por ninguna adversidad porque saben que el fruto D. su trabajo servirá para darles a sus familias un mejor futuro, es por esta razón que requieren el financiamiento que ayudara en la adquisición D. materiales, mercadería, insumos y herramientas para hacer crecer sus negocios D. venta D. verduras, pan, comida, abarrotes, cosméticos por catálogos, coca medicinal, costura D. prendas D. vestir y la agricultura. La competencia a nivel comercial es alta pero la socias tienen mucha experiencia y saben como sacar adelante sus negocios ofreciendo productos variados y D. buena calidad. La socias van cursando su primer ciclo pero ya cuentan con experiencia en grupos solidarios por lo se comprometen a dar todo D. si para salir adelante con responsabilidad y unidad.
texts.en:
The “New Town” Group is represented by Sra. Silvia and has fourteen members. It is a relatively new group with members who show responsibility in their repayments and demonstrate in their meetings that they can work together. The strong work ethic of the group is shown by their desire not to let any adversity get in their way--they know that the fruit of their work will allow them to offer their families a better future. For this reason they require a loan to buy materials, merchandise, ingredients, and tools so that they can grow their businesses selling vegetables, bread, food, groceries, cosmetics by catalogue, medicinal coca, making clothing, and farming. There is a lot of competition, but the members have a great deal of experience and know how to make their businesses successful: by offering a variety of good-quality products. The members are taking out their first loan, but they already talk knowledgeably about group solidarity. They promise to work together responsibly and make every effort to help each other succeed.

Translated from Spanish by Jane Agg, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo O. is from the village of Purok 6, Gingoog City. He is 67 years old. Reynaldo is married and has 6 school-aged children. Reynaldo sells seafood products including fish and shrimp to the local community. Reynaldo has been engaged in his business for over 20 years and earns approximately 2,000 Philippine pesos (about $41 US) a month for these activities.

In 2009, Reynaldo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Reynaldo is requesting a loan of 5,000 pesos which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Reynaldo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement income of the family.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Angele

texts.en:
Angele M. is 48 years old and is married with four children aged between 18 and 7. She lives in the Gasabo district of Kigali, the capital of Rwanda, where she has sold foodstuffs for 18 years.

Before this business, Angele was a full-time housewife and was not able to supply all the needs of her family. With this new loan from Vision Finance Company, she plans to purchase a fridge for cooling her produce. With the extra profit from the produce she sells, Angele hopes to expand her business, get more food for her family and pay her children’s school fees.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator for her produce

loans.name: Jeffrey

texts.en:
Jeffrey is 49 years old and married with two children. He is the provider for eight dependents including several extended family members. His son and his daughter, aged 19 and 22 years respectively, live in Bo (the second largest town in Sierra Leone) with Jeffrey and his wife. His daughter is a college graduate. His son attends high school and is planning to attend university upon graduation.

To help supplement his income and support his family, Jeffery, an experienced accountant, left his job on a study leave for 2 years to open a pharmacy. Although Jeffery has recently obtained another accounting job at a local firm, he continues to manage the pharmacy where he employs one person. The neatly kept pharmacy is located in a residential area of Bo.

With this loan, Jeffery plans to restock drugs needed by the local community and to provide for his family.

loans.use: To restock drugs needed by the local community

loans.name: Sorie

texts.en: Sorie S. is a 30 year old resident of Magbass who has been selling rice in the market for six years. Sorie has a wife who is also in business, and together they have one child. He is seeking a loan of 1 million Leones from SMT and Kiva Lenders to invest in his business and help it to grow.

loans.use: To expand his rice business

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma A. owns and operates a specialized sari-sari retail store selling different products and gasoline in her community. She is 32 years old, married and has two school-age children. They are from the village of Bitibut, Sapang Dalaga, Mis. Occ. Wilma has been in her business for over five years and earns approximately 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month.

In 2008, Wilma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from GDMPC which was used to invest in expanding her business. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her fourth loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue to improve and expand her business.

About GDMPC: GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has four branches and three unit offices covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Jackson Kijiwe

texts.en:
Jackson is a 25-year-old farmer who resides in Malindi town, together with his young wife Agnes and two sons: Daudi and Antony Kijiwe.

He has been farming for the last three years and plans to increase his acreage from one acre to three acres so as to be self-sustainable. He is a KADET client and he has applied for a loan with which he plans to buy 3 gallons of petrol, hybrid seeds, fertilizers CAN and DAP and pay for labour that will be done on his farm.

Jackson dreams of being able to educate his children comfortably and he describes himself as quiet and easy-going.

About KADET:

The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empowering its clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: Buy petrol, hybrid seeds and fertlizers and pay for labour

loans.name: Gil Abelinda

texts.es:
La socia ABELINDA es una humilde joven que pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN PURIFICADA - ANGOSTURA”. 

La socia tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos. Ella vive en el distrito de San Jerónimo en la comunidad de Angostura que se encuentra ubicada al sur de la ciudad del Cusco. Ella por las mañana trabaja de 6am a 2pm en el Hotel “José Antonio” como recepcionista. Ella domina dos idiomas el francés y el Ingles pues es importante para su trabajo y esta estudiando otro tercer idioma el italiano. Ella por la tardes atiende su librería que esta ubicado en la mismo distrito de San Jerónimo. Ya son varios años que trabaja en el negocio y le ha ido muy bien gracias a todo el empeño que pone en su trabajo. Nuestra socia es una joven trabajadora y emprendedora que saca adelante a su carrera profesional. La socia requiere el préstamo para y aumentar el capital del negocio de la tienda de librería comprando materiales de trabajo para el colegio como  cuadernos, lapiceros, borradores, reglas y láminas escolares.
 
La socia se encuentra agradecida por la oportunidad brindada mediante este medio y así mismo se compromete a cumplir con el pago correspondiente al cronograma.
texts.en:
Miss Abelinda is a humble young woman who belongs to the Virgen Purificada - Angostura Community Bank. She is 26 years old and is married with no children. She lives in the district of San Jeronimo in the community of Angostura, which is located south of the city of Cusco. In the morning she works from 6 am to 2 pm in the Hotel Jose Antonio as a receptionist. She speaks two foreign languages: French and English, and she is studying Italian because it is important for her job. In the afternoons, she runs a bookstore which is located in the San Jeronimo district. She has been in this business for several years and she has done well thanks to all of her hard work. She is a hard-working young woman who is trying to improve her career. She needs the loan to buy materials for her bookstore like notebooks, pens, erasers, rules, and other school materials. She is thankful for the opportunity, and she promises to complete her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Patrick King, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of school supplies

loans.name: Clemetina

texts.en: Clemetina sells Nigerian cooked foods at retail prices to her customers. She is a LAPO client. The Lift Above Poverty Organization is committed to improving lives in Nigeria and elsewhere in Africa. She is 42 years old, married, with 5 children. Her husband is a teacher. She hopes for a loan amount of NGN 150,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to cook and sell

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
La señora Luzmila, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Las Abejitas”, Distrito de Moyobamba, Provincia de Moyobamba, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos pequeños, que aun dependen de ella y están estudiando.

Luzmila, es una mujer trabajadora y luchadora, se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y a pesar de las dificultades, que paso en el trascurso de su vida, siguió adelante. Lleva 08 años, dedicandose a este tipo de actividad y hoy en día vende productos de catálogos de línea: Avon y se siente muy contenta por lo logrado.

Con este préstamo de S/. 800.00, comprará productos de belleza para su stock como, perfumes para damas y caballeros, cremas, polvos compactos, talcos,  tanto para adultos como para bebes, lápices labiales, esmaltes de uñas,  asimismo otra vitrina para exhibir  sus productos.

Luzmila, con su madurez es un ejemplo a seguir de muchas mujeres que se inician en un negocio y con perseverancia logran alcanzar sus sueños. Esta muy agradecida con el Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por ayudarla a iniciar su propio negocio y a otras mujeres a crecer empresarialmente.
texts.en:
Luzmila, 42, is a member of the "Las Abejitas" communal bank, which is located in the Moyobamba district, Moyobamba province, San Martín department. She has two small children who are in school and who depend on her. Luzmila is a hard-working and tenacious woman who sells beauty products. Despite the difficulties she has had in life, she has forged ahead. She has been in this line of work for 8 years and she sells catalogue-listed products of the Avon brand. She is very happy to have accomplished this. With this 800 sol loan she will buy beauty poroducts to stock her inventory like: perfumes for women and men, creams, compact powder, talcs for adults and babies, lipsticks, nail polish, as well as a display case to exhibit her wares. Luzmila, with her level of maturity, is an example to many women who are starting out in business and who, with perseverance, reach their goals. She is very grateful to the Manuela Ramos Movement for helping her to start her own business and for helping other women as well to grow as entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty products.

loans.name: Jorge Alexander

texts.es: Jorge Alexander M. L. de 32 años de edad, reside en Santa Tecla, ubicado en el departamento de La Libertad, lugar en el cual vive junto a su esposa. Él posee un taller de automóviles, en el que se encarga de reparar y vender repuestos para vehículos. Jorge es una persona que ha aprendido mucho y es muy preparada, razón por la cual desarrolla un muy buen trabajo, lo que llena de satisfacción a sus clientes y así mismo le permite obtener nuevos. Como todo hombre visionario él desea crecer más en su negocio, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda invertir en el taller comprar más repuestos, de diferentes marcas, así como también contratar nuevo personal para que le ayuden a atender el negocio, ya que Jorge cuenta con una gran cantidad de clientes. Es a través de este trabajo como él se gana la vida y obtiene el dinero necesario para solventar todos los gastos del hogar es por esto que es muy importante mejorar el servicio al cliente y mejorar el tiempo en que se entregan los vehículos a los clientes, lo cual lo logrará contando con los repuestos necesarios y el personal adecuado.
texts.en:
Jorge Alexander M. L. is 32 years old. He and his wife are residents of Santa Tecla, which is located in the Department of La Libertad. Jorge runs an auto repair shop and also sells spare parts. He is very knowledgeable and always prepared, which explains why he is very good at his job. His existing customers are very satisfied and his reputation allows him to attract new ones.

Like any other man with a vision, Jorge wants to expand his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in his shop by purchasing more parts of different brands. He plans to hire new employees to help attend to the business because he has many customers. It is through his work that Jorge is able to earn a living and obtain the income he needs to meet all of his household expenses. He believes it is very important to improve customer service and turnaround times when servicing each vehicle. These goals can be achieved when he has sufficient parts and adequate staff.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase automobile parts

location.town: Santa Tecla, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a 33-year-old married woman. She has four unemployed children. She has been working since 2005, selling all types of lingerie. She presents her products at her home in addition to selling through moving around and upon the request of her clients. Lina helps her husband with her limited income to support the heavy needs of life. 

Today, Lina is requesting to borrow $1,200 to buy more merchandise to attract more clients to her products and augment her sales and profits.

loans.use: To buy more merchandise

loans.name: Safari

texts.en: Safari M. is 33 years old, married and has two children who are four and two and half years old. His business is located near a bus stop at Tudor Estate in Mombasa, Kenya, a coastal town that is well known for its many tourist attractions and white beaches. For the last 10 years, Safari has earned a living by selling rice, flour, oil, detergents, soft drinks and other items to people who live nearby. He says that this business is profitable, even though many people are in this line of work, which gives customers the ability to choose where to shop. Space is also difficult to find, and financial constraints have prevented him from expanding as much as he would like. Despite this, he works very hard to keep his business doing well. He has applied for a loan of Kes 40,000 to buy more items to sell. In the future, he hopes to become a wholesaler and have enough money to give his children a quality education. He believes he can do this because he is very hardworking and focused.

loans.use: To buy more items to sell to his customers

loans.name: Abigaël Plus Group

texts.en:
Bernadette M. is the director of the group “Abigaël Plus” made up of thirty-nine members firmly united to receive loans from the MFI (micro-finance institution) HOPE RDC in order to develop their businesses.

Bernadette’s main business is selling clothes and pairs of shoes in a market to the west of Kinshasa. Since 1990 she has acquired solid experience in her area and works hard with good management skills in order to realize her dream of one day opening a clothes shop.

Bernadette would also like to achieve financial independence through her business that earns her $160 per month. She works to the best of her abilities and uses her contacts so that she might achieve her goals.

Bernadette is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having six times obtained and correctly repaid loans. She will increase her stock of products with her next loan by buying clothes and pairs of shoes and reselling them at a profit.

45 years old, Bernadette is married and has five children whose ages vary between 5 and 15 years old. All of them go to school.

loans.use: To buy more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Brak

texts.en: Brak S., age 27, is married and resides with her children in Takeo Province, Cambodia. She has two children. She is engaged in a business of selling various kinds of groceries at home in her village, earning a gross income of $16 per day to help cover the family expenses. Her husband is a translator at a local garment factory, earning an income of $5 per day. S. is requesting a loan of $800 to purchase more groceries to stock the store and expand her current business. This is her first loan from CREDIT, Kiva’s partner.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to stock the store

loans.name: Paz Y Amor 1,2 Group

texts.en:
Jaqueline is the coordinator of her group, Paz y Amor (Peace and Love), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Jaqueline’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their six children.

Jaqueline is excited to be taking her eighth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a general store by purchasing clothing, beans and rice to sell to the members of her community.

Jaqueline will use her profits to invest in her home by building a wall and in her children by purchasing shoes and uniforms for school. She also has a dream of one day traveling to Panama and she would like to save money for that. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more clothes, rice and beans

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 24 years old. He is married and has one child. He graduated from primary school. 

He sells electrical supplies. He will use the loan funds to purchase electric materials such as, wires, cables, and lamps. He has been working in this field for a long time and has acquired a great deal of experience and expertise. He has enough customers because of the good quality of his work. His income will rise because of this loan and could change his life because he has a strong desire to succeed and is serious about his job.

loans.use: Cables, wires, and lamps

loans.name: Zebedee

texts.en:
Zebedee is 60 years old and is married with six children aged between 16 and 35 years. All of his children except one have completed school.

Zebedee is a farmer from Kitale town in Western Kenya where he has been farming for thirty years. His main produce consists of vegetables, eggs, chickens, maize and beans which he sells to the local market. He also operates a school academy to help the poor locals in the area. His main challenges in the farming business are lack of security for the chickens, poultry diseases and lack of management expertise.

Zebedee has requested this KES 50,000 loan from Juhudi Kilimo to expand his poultry project. This loan will enable him to increase his stock of chickens and earn him income that will enable him to meet his family's needs.
