He hopes that the prices of his poultry products will stabilize in future since this will be an ongoing income-generating activity for him.

Zebedee says that poultry farming is a challenging and delicate business but he hopes to beat the challenges and come up as a successful poultry farmer. He wants to make poultry farming a business and not a way of life.

loans.use: To expand his poultry project

loans.name: Maksim

texts.en: Maksim is 40 years old and an internally displaced person from the region of Khalbadjar. He now lives in the Absheron region. He is the sole provider for his family and has two teenage boys. In his store he sells cooking pots and dishes, a business he learned from his brother 10 years ago. Maksim is asking for a loan of 2000 AZN to update his merchandise. He hopes that having more (and newer) merchandise in his store will help him sell them more competitively. To buy new items, he’d travel to the Logbatan region.

loans.use: to update his merchandise

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda V. is a married woman who lives in zone 2, barangay Nabulao, Sipalay, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling rice, being an Avon dealer and running a pig fattening business. Her husband Edwin V., who is 47 years old, works as a laborer to earn his living and also helps with his wife's business activities. They have two children, who are 20 and 23 years old. 

Imelda joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2002 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Imelda has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 17,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 11,080 - uplifting the family's standard of living.  

This time, for her 17th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 12,500, which she intends to use to buy rice and other feeds so that she can continue saving for their future and expand the business. Imelda V. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path towards the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:  

In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

loans.use: Additional working capital

loans.name: La Gula Group

texts.en: This communal bank is called “La Gula” and it is composed of 20 members from the city of Valparaíso. They dedicate themselves to many different kinds of businesses, like the sewing of pajamas and sweatshirts, dessert making, jewelry making, the sale and repair of eyeglasses, the sale of undergarments, the preparation and sale of breads and cakes, sculpting and auto repair. Mónica, the group’s treasurer, is seen in the photo on the right-hand side, wearing a burgundy-colored jacket. Mónica works with her father in the business he has run for 30 years. Mónica is in charge of purchasing the ingredients to prepare sopaipillas (fried pastries), empanadas (stuffed savory pastries) and cakes. With this loan, Mónica will purchase a fryer, because when they get a lot of orders for sopaipillas and empanadas, it takes a long time to fry them in a normal pan. She will also purchase aluminum plates, oil, and cheese in bulk, along with papaya jam and dough for the sopaipillas and empanadas. Her dream is to incorporate new products into the business; for example, an ice cream machine as they do not currently have one and it would be a good investment for the summer months to take advantage of the businesses location. In general, she would like to grow the business. Mónica’s motivation comes from her children. She has one son who is 20 and in his third year of university, studying electrical engineering, and she has a 15-year-old daughter who also wants to continue on to college after finishing high school. Her other daughter, who is 28, sells jewelry and is also part of the Fondo Esperanza communal bank. Mónica very much enjoys attending the weekly meetings of their bank because it gives her a moment to share with her friends and a distraction from day-to-day activities. Valparaíso is a city situated 120 kilometers to the northwest of Santiago, on the Chilean coast. It is the regional capital of "Region Five" and is the seat of the Chilean legislative government. Valparaíso is the nation's primary port, and in addition to a bustling economy, it offers a great variety of beautiful and picturesque places, like the home of Nobel Laureate, the poet Pablo Neruda.

loans.use: Purchase a fryer, plates, dough and jam

loans.name: Jacoba

texts.es:
Doña Jacoba de 46 años de edad es casada,  habita en la colonia el verdun a 5 km de Nueva Guinea, tiene una hija a cargo de 11 añitos de edad estudiando la primaria.  Actualmente labora para el MINED como docente de primaria  desde hace 12 años, desempeñado su trabajo con gran responsabilidad y honestidad. 

Esta solicitando su 8vo credito con el objetivo de construir una habitacion y asi tener mejor comodidad y privacidad en su hogar.  

El mayor sueño que tiene es poder darle a su familia las condiciones necesarias en el hogar.
texts.en:
Jacoba is 46 years old, married, and lives in the Verdun colony, 5 km from New Guinea, with her 11 year old daughter who is in primary school. For 12 years now, she has worked for MINED as a primary school teacher, performing her duties with great responsibility and honesty. She is requesting her 8th loan with the goal of constructing a room to have better comfort and privacy in her home. Her biggest dream is to be able to give her family the necessities at home.

Translated from Spanish by Pamela Reynolds, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a room

loans.name: Bridget

texts.en: Bridget is a 27-year-old single lady. She has a one-year-old son. She has been selling secondhand clothes and shoes for seven months. She was previously selling water to earn a living. Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become self-reliant because her business has grown. She is requesting 20,000 KES from Faulu Kenya. This will be her first loan, and she will use it as capital to start a business selling cosmetics. She hopes to expand her business so as to employ people.

loans.use: To start selling cosmetics

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es:
la sra. Gloria de Jesus C. se dedica al comercio, venta de abarrotería negocio el cual opera bajo el nombre de Pulpería “LYLI”. Doña Gloria tiene 6  años de dedicarse a este tipo de actividad, además de dedicarse al negocio de pulpería también  se dedica a la compra de leche y transforma este producto para venta en: queso, cuajada, requesón y mantequilla. 
La señora Gloria es viuda ya que su esposo fue asesinado en Diciembre del año pasado, pero a pesar de ese percance doña Gloria continua saliendo adelante con su familia, ya que ahora sus 3 hijos dependen totalmente de ella.
con los ingresos recibidos de sus negocios esta pagando los gastos de salud, alimentación, vivienda, vestuario y estudio de sus hijos.  
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia para surtir su pulperia.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gloria de Jesús C. is a grocer; she has a store called “Pulpería LYLI.” She has six years experience in this line of work. In addition to her grocery store she also buys milk to make cheeses and butter. Gloria is a widow; her husband was assassinated in December of last year. Despite this tragedy, Gloria continues forward with her family since now her three children are totally dependent on her alone. With income from her businesses she is paying for her children’s food, health, clothing and schooling. The loan will be used to buy stock items for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn flour, wheat flour, lard, cooking oil, beans, rice, sugar, coffee, bread, cookies, soups, pasta, sauces, tooth paste, toilet paper, eggs, tortillas, juices, soft drinks.

loans.name: Guljamish

texts.en:
Guljamish I. is a 65-year-old widow who lives with her three daughters in a house in the Bayan-Ulgiy province of Mongolia. Her oldest and youngest  daughters are currently unemployed while her middle daughter helps in his mother's business. Guljamish's husband passed away ten years ago.
Guljamish operates a sewing business in her town producing traditional clothes and home products. She worked in the garment industry from 1985 to 1995, then started her own business in a rented workplace in 1996. Since then she has built a stable operation. She pays rent of 30,000 MNT per month. Over the many years of operating her business, her earnings have enabled her to pay tuition fees for her three daughters. Now all her daughters are married and live separately from their mother. 
Guljamish usually makes a variety of home felt items and traditional ornaments. During the summer months, demand for her products is increased so she needs to purchase more materials in order to meet customer demand. Guljamish is a very hardworking and open-minded person. She is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to import more fabrics and materials from Taikeshken state, China.

loans.use: To import more fabrics and materials for her business

loans.name: Shiringul

texts.ru: Давлатова Ширингул проживает в районе Яван. Возраст, 53 года. Замужем, имеет 4 детей. Муж на заработках в России. Сама Ширингул имеет среднее образование. Более 13 лет занимается торговлей. У нее продуктовый магазин. Сейчас ей приходится много работать, чтобы накормить семью, так как у нее большая семья. Кредит берет для увеличения товарооборота.
texts.en:
Shiringul D. lives in the Yavan region. She is 53 years old. She is married and has four children. Her husband is working in Russia. Shiringul has secondary education. She has been in the retail business for more than thirteen years. She has a grocery store. She has to work a lot right now to be able to feed her family as it is quiet big. She is taking out the loan to increase sales.

Translated from Russian by Elena Bortnikoff, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To stock more food to sell

loans.name: Celia Del Carmen

texts.es:
la señora Celia B. tiene 62 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria, tiene su negocio en su casa de habitacion el cual se encuentra en un punto de facil acceso para todas las personas, cuenta con el apoyo
de sus hijos para la atencion de sus clientes.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de mercaderia, desea surtir mas su negocio y tener mayores ventas, las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con sus hijos.
texts.en: Celia B. is 62 years old and she has a grocery store. She has the business in a section of her home where customers can easily access. Her children help her with the costumer support aspect of the business. The loan will be used to purchase merchandise, wishing to increase the variety in her business in order to obtain better sales. She needs her profits to support her children.

loans.use: To purchase merchandise.

loans.name: Francisca Enriqueta

texts.es: Francisca Enriqueta tiene 42 años, su actividad es brindar el negocio de molino. Hace más de 30 años que tiene este negocio, por lo que no ha sido fácil sufragar los gastos de su hogar, ella tiene 1 hijo menor de edad a su cargo que como Madre soltera lucha todos los días por él. Este negocio inicio como herencia de su Mama ya que ofrecía un buen servicio a la mayoría de sus clientes. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de motor nuevo y para la reparación de uno de los motores. Sueña con realizar la compra de mas equipo modernos.
texts.en:
Francisca Enriqueta is 42 years old. As her business she provides milling services. She has had this business for more than 30 years and it has not been easy covering her household expenses. She has one minor child in her care and as a single Mother struggles every day on his behalf. This business began as an inheritance from her Mom since she offered a good service to the majority of her customers. 

The purpose of the loan is to purchase a new motor and to repair one of the motors. She dreams of being able to purchase more modern equipment.

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Farida

texts.ru: Ниёзматова Фарида проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 31 год. Замужем, имеет двоих детей. Муж, работает таксистом. Сама Фарида имеет среднее образование. Работает на рынке района. Она имеет торговую точку, где продает запасные части велосипеда. Этим видом деятельности занимается уже восемь лет. Кредит берет для увеличения ассортимента товара.
texts.en: Farida N. lives in Shahrituz.  She is 31 years old, married, and has two children. Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Farida has a secondary education. She works in the local market.  She has a shop where she sells bicycle spare parts. She has been doing this work for eight years. She is taking out a loan to increase the variety of goods she carries.

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Heriberta

texts.es: Heriberta R. F. de 52 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora, la cual vela por el bienestar de su pequeña nieta de 8 años de edad, la cual es su mayor incentivo para seguir adelante. Ella vive junto a su nieta en la ciudad de Nueva San Salvador, ubicada en el departamento de La Libertad. Heriberta trabaja de forma ambulante, elaborando y comercializando tortas mejicanas. Generalmente su negocio se encuentra en las afuera de fábricas o en parques, en donde ella considera que hay mayor afluencia de personas. Heribertar con mucha ilusión de mejorar su negocio solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar mayor cantidad de materia prima como: pan, aderezos, aguacate, jamones, carnes y otros más, los cuales le permitan elaborar más tortas. Ella ha deposita en gran forma sus esperanzas de mejorar en dicho préstamo, a través del cual espera salir adelante.
texts.en:
Heriberta R. F. is 52 years old.  She is a very hard-working person who looks out for the well-being of her 8 year-old granddaughter who is her biggest incentive to keep working.  She lives with her granddaughter in the city of Nueva San Salvador, in La Libertad department.  Heriberta works as a street trader, making and selling 'tortas mejicanas' (a type of sandwich).

Generally Heriberta makes her sales outside factories or in parks where she considers there to be a large number of people.  Heriberta has a great desire to improve her business.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more ingredients such as bread, dressings, avocados, ham, meat, etc. which will allow her to make more sandwiches.  She has placed a lot of hope in improving her business with this loan and she hopes to use it to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making her sandwiches

location.town: Nueva San Salvador, departamento de La Libertad

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SIEMPRE ADELANTE”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco  y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Victoria; ella tiene 46 años de edad es separada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de compra y venta de fruta, la socia tiene su stand en el mercado Virgen Asunta por el centro de la ciudad , la socia trabaja conjuntamente con sus hijos y se encuentra muy feliz con su negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar mas mercadería para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Introducing Victoria, a member of “SIEMPRE ADELANTE” (Always Ahead), a communal bank located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Victoria is 46 years old, she is separated and has 3 children. She alternates her daily chores with her activity: she buys and sells fruits and vegetables. She has her own stand in the Virgen Asunta market located in the city center. She works together with her children and she is very happy with her shop.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy more products for her shop.

Victoria is happy about the loan and she commits to comply with the repayment of her debt.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop.

loans.name: Altantuul

texts.en:
Altantuul M., 39 years old, lives with her two children in the Sansar district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. She and her family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and enclosure. Her youngest daughter attends a local high school.

Altantuul operates a shoemaking business at home and sells at wholesale prices in the “Narantuul”, a market in Ulaanbaatar. Altantuul sews traditional Mongolian shoes according to her customers' orders. She started her business in 2003 and has since gained much experience as a shoemaker. Altantuul is a hardworking person and is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase materials and supplies for her business.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies

loans.name: Lidy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” MUJERES UNIDAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Lidy; ella tiene 31 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia se dedica al negocio de venta de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, la socia confecciona la ropa al gusto del cliente ella trabaja desde su casa a pedido, la socia a la vez también trabaja en un jardín de auxiliar pero ahora está de vacaciones así que se puede dedicar a lleno a confeccionar mas ropa y así poder generar más ingresos para su familia.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de una maquina remayadora para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "MUJERES UNIDAS" (United Women) communal bank which is located in the district, province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Lidy is 31 years old, and is in a common-law relationship, with two children.  She sells women's, men's and children's clothing which she sews at home based on orders she receives from customers.  She also works as a gardener assistant.  She is now on vacation and can spend all her time sewing clothes and generating income for the family.

She plans to use the loan to buy an overlock sewing machine for her business.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine for her business

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karina, reside en Jiquilisco, departamento de Usulután, tiene 34 años de edad, se dedica a vender verduras y frutas, vive con dos hijos y su esposo, él es ganadero y le ayuda a cubrir los gastos del hogar, Karina tiene 13 años de dedicarse a la venta de verduras y frutas, posee suficiente experiencia para atender a los clientes y para manejar el negocio.
Por el momento solicita un préstamo para la compra de verduras y frutas, dicha mercadería la necesita para surtir el negocio y permanecer competente ante la demanda, ayudando así a continuar en el comercio, ya que sus aspiraciones son poseer cada día un mejor negocio, con las cualidades que el cliente busca y generando los ingresos necesarios que le den estabilidad a su familia y le permitan ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios.
texts.en:
Karina lives in Jiquilisco, in Usulután department.  She is 34 years old and sells fruit and vegetables.  Karina lives with her two children and her husband.  Her husband is a livestock farmer and he helps her cover their household expenses.  Karina has been in her fruit and veg business for 13 years.  She has the experience needed to both serve her customers and run her business.

Karina is currently requesting a loan to buy fruit and vegetables.  She needs this merchandise to stock her business and be able to cope with demand.  This loan will help her to continue in her business.  Karina's aspirations are for her business to improve every day and for it to have the qualities customers are looking for.  She hopes to make the income she needs to provide her family with stability and help her children to pursue their studies.

loans.use: To buy fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann G. is from the village of Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 35 years old. Mary Ann is married and has 3 school-aged children. To make a living, Mary Ann owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Mary Ann has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 3000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Mary Ann joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Mary Ann from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

location.town: Brgy. Bone North, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Maritza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “JUNTAS Y UNIDAS”; Este banco está ubicado en el distrito de Huanchac, provincia de Cusco, Departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra: Maritza; La socia es casada,  tiene 45 años de edad, y tiene 1 hijo, la socia, se dedica a la venta de materiales de construcción, ella también tiene una pequeña ferretería, la socia trabaja de forma independiente y ya tiene sus proveedores, ellos le traen la mercadería y ella paga a fin de mes, La socia desea dar un adelanto para descargar unos materiales en su negocio. La socia requiere el préstamo para dar un adelanto para que descarguen la mercadería en su negocio.

La socia está feliz con el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the community bank "Juntas y Unidas". This bank is located in the district of Huanchac, Cusco Province, in the Department of Cusco.
The member is Maritza. She is married, 45 years old, and has 1 son. She sells construction materials and also has a small hardware store. She works for herself and already has suppliers. They currently bring her the supplies that she needs and she pays them at the end of the month. The member wants to pay in advance to secure some materials for her store. The member needs the loan to pay in advance so that the suppliers will deliver the merchandise.
The member is happy with the loan offered and promises to make the repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: The member requests the loan to pay in advance for some supplies to be delivered to her business.

loans.name: Jose Cecilio

texts.es:
el sr. Jose Cecilio S. tiene 50 años de edad, vive en Villa Santa Danli y se dedica a la venta de repuestos para motocicletas, ademas hace servicios de reparacion de refrigeradoras, reparaciones electricas y reparación de motocicletas, tambien hace cambio de aceite automotriz y carga de baterías para automoviles.

Don José es una persona bien reconocida en la aldea de villa santa por el tipo de negocio que tiene ya que él es el único con este tipo de actividad y se a sabido ganar la clientela por la atención que les brinda y por la garantía de sus trabajos.

Don José es casado y de su matrimonio dependen 2 hijos, el varón le ayuda en el negocio de la reparación de motocicletas.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de repuestos y aceites para motos.
texts.en:
Sr. José Cecilio S. is 50 years old. He lives in Villa Santa Danli and is engaged in the sale of motorcycle spare parts. In addition, he repairs refrigerators, electric appliances, and motorcycles. He also changes motor oil for cars and charges automotive batteries.

Don José is well-known in the village of Villa Santa because he is the only one with this type of business. He knows how to attract customers through the good service he offers and the guarantee of his work.

Don José is married and has two children. His son helps him in the business of repairing motorcycles. The loan will be used for the purchase of spare parts and motor oil.

loans.use: to purchase oil for motorcycles, chains, ball bearings, brake pads, cables and brake fluid.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 47 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su querido hijo Ronald de 28 años y lo que más desea es brindarle una mejor calidad de vida. Los arduos días de trabajo que Yolanda tiene en su chacra, le han servido para mejorar sus cultivos y hacer más productivas sus tierras, trabaja desde muy temprano por la mañana, cultivando papas, choclo y habas, productos que posteriormente llevara a vender al mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es sembrar sus tierras y ver como sus cultivos van creciendo, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es fumigar sus tierras, teme que los químicos sea dañino para su salud. Con el tiempo espera comprar más tierras y así ampliar la cantidad de su producción. Este el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querida por el resto de sus socias. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará abono para sus chacras.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 47, is a very pleasant and hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her beloved son Ronald, 28. What she wants most is to give him a better quality of life. The arduous days of work Yolanda has invested in her farm have improved her crops and made her lands more productive. She starts work very early in the morning, growing potatoes, corn and broad beans, which she later will sell in the largest market in the city of Tarma. 

What she likes most about her work is planting her fields and seeing how her crops grow. She has done this for 10 years and says the most difficult thing is fumigating her lands, as she is afraid the chemicals might be bad for her health. In time she hopes to buy more lands and increase her production. 

This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that if she pays it on time, she will be able to get another with greater ease and without making things complicated for her communal bank, where she is well-loved by the rest of the members. With the requested two thousand soles, she will buy manure for her farmlands.

loans.use: to purchase manure for her fields

loans.name: Tamaz

texts.en:
Tamaz P. lives in the village of Mukhrani in Kartli Region. He is married and lives with his wife, children and parents. Tamaz’s wife works as teacher in a kindergarten. Tamaz has three children: 7- and 5-year-old sons and a 4-year-old daughter. 

Tamaz is a joiner and likes his trade. He often gets orders to design different types of furniture. Along with this, he is also heading the small farm in the family. They have two milk cows and two pigs. They sell dairy products in Tbilisi (capital city of the country). Also the family produces and sells different types of pickled vegetables (marinades). With the requested credit Tamaz will expand the dairy farm. With the first half of the credit, Tamaz will purchase additional milk cows to get more milk and sell more dairy products. The second half will be used to pay for vegetables, to be pickled and sold. The increase in their income will be used for expansion of the pig-farm.

loans.use: for purchase additional milk cows and paying for vegetables to pickle for sale.

loans.name: Alba

texts.es:
En el municipio de Tierra Blanca en la carretera (Tierra Blanca-joachin) se encuentra una comunidad llamada El Jicaro la cual se caracteriza por ser un pueblo ganadero en el cual vive Alba C., ella tiene la edad de 24 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria y es soltera.

Alba nos platica que cuando termino de estudiar la secundaria sus padres no tenian los recursos para que ella continuara estudiando asi que tuvo que iniciar a trabajar desde entonces ella trabaja en la purificadora de agua del pueblo.

ella nos dice que como aun no se casa el dinero que habia estado ganando lo habia ahorrado y hace un poco mas de 2 años decidio invirtirlo en la cria de cerdos, ella ha construido un pequeño corral en la par de atras de su casa en la cual cria sus cerdos desde pequeños y cuando estan grandes los vende y recibe su pago en rocompensa al trabajo y dedicacion que le dio a sus animales.

ella necesita este credito para invertirlo en compra de cerditos, alimentos y desparacitantes.

ella espera que dia a dia su negocio cresca mas y en un futuro le gustaria agrandar su corral poder criar mas cerdos y que sus ganancias aumenten.

ella se encuentra muy agradecida con el prestamo otorgado y envia un saludo a las personas que hacen posible estos creditos.
texts.en:
In the town of Tierra Blanca, along the Tierra Blanca-Joachin road is a community called El Jicaro, characterized as being a livestock raising community.  Alba C. lives here; she is 24 years old, attended three years of junior high school, and is single.

Alba says that when she finished junior high school, her parents didn’t have the resources to allow her to continue studying, so she had to begin working at the town water purifying plant.

She also says that since she has not married yet, she’s been saving the money that she’s been earning and a little over two years ago she decided to invest it into raising hogs.  She built a small pen behind her home and raises piglets and receives the reward for her dedication and care for her animals.

She needs this loan to buy piglets, feed, and anti-parasite medication.  She expects her business to grow daily and in the future wants to add another pen to raise more hogs and increase her income.

She is very grateful for the loan and sends her greetings to those who make these loans possible.

loans.use: to buy piglets

loans.name: Mayra Ivette

texts.es:
Mayra trabaja como maestra de secundaria siendo su trabajo desde hace cinco años, casada, y vive con su mama en el terreno, haciendo un cuarto pequeño, aun no con las mejores condiciones,  pero en un futuro irá mejorando. Con los financiamientos que Afodenic, está otorgando atreves del préstamo.
Con el crédito anterior logro, dividir el terreno con muro, y hacer pegado a él un cuarto,  y hoy levantara el muro en la parte de atrás, logrando cerrar todo el terreno. Materiales a comprar piedra, arena, cemento, hierro. El cual está satisfecha por mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
Mayra has worked as a secondary school teacher for five years.  She is married and lives with her mother on their land.  They have a small room that isn't in the best condition, but they are slowly improving it for the future.  With the financing from Afrodenic, it is giving through the loan.  

With a past loan, she divided the land with a wall and built a room.  Now, she wants to build the wall in the back part to enclose all of the land.  She needs to purchase stones, sand, cement, and iron.  She is satisfied by improving every day.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to build a wall in the back part of her land.

loans.name: Olimpio

texts.es: Olimpio tiene 68 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 31 años decidió incursionar en el comercio, es así que tiene una tienda, en donde vende productos de primera necesidad. Desde entonces le va muy bien en las ventas, aunado a que su negocio se ubica en una zona donde hay mucha afluencia de gente, garantizando así más ventas. Procura siempre de abastecerse de productos, de ello depende de que sus clientes vayan seguidos a su establecimiento. Él siempre esta pendiente de las necesidades de sus consumidores y ver que productos son de su preferencia y eso le favorece en el negocio. El tiempo donde hay más ventas son en fiestas patrias y navideñas, por ello espera ahorrar dinero para abastecerse de mercadería para las próximas fiestas patrias que se acercan, por tal motivo espera de su apoyo para concretar sus planes. Este será su crédito número 18 con MFP,  es uno de los socios más antiguos de su banco comunal que siempre motiva a los demás integrantes a ser unidos, responsables y colaboradores de las diversas actividades que se proponen. En esta ocasión el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de mercadería, para tener mayor variedad de productos en su tienda.
texts.en:
Olimpio, 68, lives with his wife and two children in his own home.  Over 31 years ago he decided to go into commerce.  He has a store where he sells basic need items.  He has done very well with his sales thanks to the fact that his store is located in a spot where there is much foot traffic thereby insuring sales.  He always strives to be well stocked with merchandise because this is what brings his customers back to his store repeatedly.  He is always conscious of his customers’ needs to see which products are their preferred ones and this benefits his business.  The time when sales are highest is during national holidays and during the Christmas season.  Because of this, he hopes to save money to stock up on merchandise for the approaching national holidays.  He hopes to have your support to meet this goal.

This will be loan #18 with MFP.  He is one of the longest standing members of his communal bank who always motivates the others to be united, responsible and collaborative in the various activities they propose for themselves.  On this occasion, he will use the requested loan to buy merchandise in order to have wider variety of products available in his store.

loans.use: to buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Edang

texts.en:
Edang is 48 years old and has four children. She is married and three of her children are in school.

Edang is in the agricultural business growing rice in the Philippines. Edang requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers & other farm supplies.

Edang has been farming rice for five years and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. 

In the future, Edang would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers & other farm supplies

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 50 years old.  She is married and has 5 children who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  

Julieta has a furniture making business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 16 years.  Julieta has requested a loan of PHP 29500 through NWTF to purchase additional lumber and other materials for her furniture making business.   In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: buy lumber and materials to make furniture

loans.name: Sonia Patricia

texts.es:
Sonia es una mujer de gran empuje, pues maneja su tiempo, está pendiente del hogar y desde allí realiza ventas por catalogo a vecinos, familiares y amigos, quienes se han convertido en sus clientes. Esta emprendedora inició con su negocio motivada por la ilusión de mejorar sus ingresos y lograr tener una mejor calidad de vida ya que a raíz de la separación con su esposo la familia quedó en una situación económica muy difícil por lo que ella decidió emprender un nuevo negocio y trabajar duro para sacarlo adelante.
 
Actualmente, Sonia es vendedora de productos de revistas y accesorios, y es conciente que para generar mejores utilidades debe invertir capital de trabajo lo que le ayuda progresar y sacar adelante las ventas, sin embargo Sonia actualmente no cuenta con ese capital por lo que solicita un préstamo, oportunidad que hará de su microempresa un negocio prospero y una esperanza para el futuro de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Sonia is a woman with a lot of drive.  She manages her time, looks after her household and makes catalog sales to her neighbors, family members and friends who have become her customers.  This entrepreneur started her business motivated by the hope of improving her income and achieving a better quality of life as, owing to her separation from her husband, her family was left in a very difficult financial situation.  She decided to set up a new business and work hard to get ahead in life.  

Sonia currently sells catalog products, and accessories.  She is aware that, in order to make more income, she must invest working capital to make progress and get ahead in her sales.  However, Sonia currently doesn't have this capital and so she is requesting a loan.  This opportunity will make her small business prosperous and a beacon of hope for her children's future.

loans.use: to buy stock for her business

loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina sells cereals to earn her living. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works seven days out of every week. Madina sells her products at the retail level at the market. Her main business challenges include defaulters, transportation costs, and seasonality. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start selling solely on a wholesale basis and also to buy a plot of land upon which to build rental rooms. 

Madina and her husband rents a house that has access neither to electricity nor to piped water. Their major monthly expenses include rent, school fees, and piped water. They have six children, three of whom are in school. Madina also takes care of her mother.

She has requested a loan in the amount of 700,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of ground nuts

loans.use: to buy more bags of ground nuts

loans.name: Adelina

texts.es: La señora Adelina vive en casa propia en union libre desde hace 12 años, tiene 3 hijos que va a la escuela, su esposo se dedica al campo y al cultivo de nopales y de hortalizas, en conjunto tanto la señora como el señor trabajan en el cultivo de estas plantas, en el negocio la señora Adelina tiene poco mas de 9 años en el invernadero, el prestamo lo esta solicitando  para poder comprar semillas y cultivar mas plantas, la verdura la esta vendiendo por kilos, es une negocio pequeño pero sueña con que llegue el dia en el que tenga clientes que le pidan por lo menos mas de 30 kilos de hortaliza por semana, el prestamo le ha servido de ayuda para poder estar levantando las plantas y aporvechar bien la cosecha, otra meta que tiene la señora es poder comprar otro terreno para poder seguir con el cultivo de hortaliza.
texts.en: Ms. Adelina has lived in her own home in a committed relationship for twelve years, and has three children who are attending school. Her husband devotes himself to the rural life and growing nopal and vegetables. Together, the wife as well as the husband, work growing these plants. Adelina has been in this business for a little more than nine years working in the greenhouse. She is seeking the loan to be able to buy seeds and grow more plants. She sells the vegetables by the kilo. It is a small business but she dreams that the day will arrive in which she has customers who order more than 30 kilos of vegetables minimum from her a week. The loan has been helpful to her so that she may cultivate the plants and make good use of the harvest. Another goal she has is to be able to buy another plot of land so she may continue growing garden vegetables.

loans.use: to grow vegetables.

loans.name: Yatta

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Yatta. She is widowed and has seven children aged 21, 18, 15, 12, 10, 6 and 5, all of whom are in school. In 1996, Yatta established her foodstuff business (selling bulgur, garri and cornflour). She began her business in order to effectively play the role of her late husband as a breadwinner. This business is her only source of income. Working seven days a week, and eleven hours a day, she earns about 1,000,000 SLL every month from this business. 
Yatta requires a loan in order to buy bags of bulgur, garri and cornflour. She is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 SLL. In the future, Yatta plans to build a back house in her compound, and further support the education of her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bags of bulgur, garri and cornflour.

loans.name: Rosayde

texts.es:
La  socia pertenece al banco comunal “CUSCO” el banco se encuentra ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac, en la Provincia de Cusco y Departamento de Cusco.

La  socia Rosayde; tiene 25 años de edad,  la socia es soltera; la socia  trabaja años en una agencia de viajes pero ella ahora esta independizándose y apertura una agencia de viajes, la socia estudio turismo y con todos los años de experiencia ella tendrá sus propia agencia de viajes, la socia desea el crédito en esta ocasión para poder invertir en la agencia de viajes ella necesita ahora poder implementar la agencia y para ello ella cuenta con un pequeño ahorro que tiene pero de todas maneras a ella le servirá muchísimo para completar con sus proyectos el préstamo que se le pueda otorgar, la socia desea invertir en la compra de una computadora para hacer sus reservas y poner sus paquetes en línea. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de una computadora para su nueva agencia de viajes y turismo.

La  socia agradece el apoyo que se le otorgara y así mismo se compromete a cumplir de manera disciplinada con los pagos de las cuotas.
texts.en:
Rosayde belongs to CUSCO community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province and department.  She is 25 years old and single.

Rosayde has been working in a travel agency for years.  However, now she is setting up on her own and opening her own travel agency.  She studied tourism and, with all her years of experience, she will have her own travel agency.  She would like a loan on this occasion to invest in her travel agency as she needs to stock her business.  Rosayde has a small amount of savings but this loan will be really useful in helping her to complete her projects.  She would like to invest in buying a computer for making her reservations and putting her packages on line.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying a computer for her new travel and tourism agency.

Rosayde is grateful for the support that she will receive and, for her part, pledges to make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying a computer for her new travel and tourism agency

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman with three children; two attend school while one is still too young. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past seven years, she has operated a retail shop, selling to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she sells shoes, for an additional source of income. She faces the major challenges of theft and the high cost of transportation in her business. Her biggest dream is to establish a wholesale shop in the future.

With the 30,000 Kshs loan, she wants to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar.

loans.name: Marufjon

texts.ru: Маруфчон проживает в районе Шахритус. Ему 31 год. Он женат. У него трое детей. Его жена занимается домашним хозяйством. Сам он имеет среднее образование. Более пяти лет Маруфчон занимается животноводством. Он откармливает и продает крупнорогатый скот. Таким способом он зарабатывает на жизнь. Кредит берет для закупа коровы вместе с теленком в дальнейшем для продажи. Он хочет улучшить финансовое положение в семье и построить новый дом.
texts.en: Marufjon lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 31 years old, married and has three children. His wife takes care of the household. He has secondary education. Marufjon has been doing animal husbandry for more than five years. He feeds and sells large horned cattle. This way he makes a living. He is taking out the loan to buy a cow with a calf for future resale. He wants to improve his family's financial situation and build a new house.

loans.use: to buy a cow with a calf.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is 34 years old. He is married to Pauline and they have two children, 6 and 8 years old. Edward is a horticultural farmer, farming tomatoes. He has been in the business for the past five years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000 from it.

This is Edward's third loan with KADET LTD, and he will use it to buy tomato seedlings. Edward repaid his previous loans successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to help him build a residential home for his family. His dream is to expand his business by also planting other horticultural crops.

loans.use: to purchase tomato seedlings for planting

loans.name: Jong

texts.en:
Jong, 48 years old, plants vegetables to sell with his wife and earns $6 per day. They have four children: three are studying and one more is working and earns $3 per day. Every month, he has to spend $70 on food, $3 on electricity, $20 on school fees and $10 on other expenses. 

He would like to request a loan of $1,000 to pay for his children's school fees and buy other school materials for them. He wants to help all of his children to study in the university after they finish high school.

loans.use: To pay for his children's school fees and other school materials.

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.es: La Señora Fabiola nacida en la ciudad de Beni,  vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz hace 15 años, tiene un hijo de 4 años,  trabaja con EMPRENDER desde el 2010 es su segundo ciclo, se dedica a la venta de comida desde hace dos años, vende comida por su zona donde tiene muchos clientes ya que la Sra. Fabiola cocina riquísimos platillos, además que atiende con amabilidad a sus clientes, el crédito tiene como destino Compra de Frízer para poder mantener sus verduras para realizar sus platillos y los refrescos fríos, este frízer seria de buena utilidad para el negocio de la  Sra. Fabiola, por lo cual Kiva la esta ayudando para que siga adelante.
texts.en:
Fabiola was born in the city of Beni and has lived in the city of Santa Cruz for the last 15 years; she has a four-year-old son.  She’s been working with EMPRENDER since 2010 and this is her second cycle.  She has been selling food for the last two years in her neighborhood where she has many customers.  Fabiola cooks delicious dishes and also treats her customers kindly.

The loan will be used to buy a freezer so that she can store vegetables to make her dishes and to keep her beverages cold.  This freezer will be very useful for Fabiola’s business that Kiva is helping her to make progress in.

loans.use: to buy a freezer.

loans.name: Merluville

texts.en:
Merluville is 25 years old and married with 2 children. She is from Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental in the Philippines. 

Merluville operates a family member's business venture providing transportation services to local community members, and she's been in this business for 6 months. She earns 5,000PHP a month from this work.

Merluville joined GDMPC in 2009 to obtain financial services to improve her living situation. Merluville is requesting a loan of 10,000PHP to repair a transport vehicle used in her family's business. This will be the second loan taken out by Merluville from GDMPC. She plans to have her own house and lot someday.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in her family's business.

loans.name: Thamer

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 42 years old, married and has five children.

Thamer has been an owner of a food market since 2006, selling soft drinks, juices, vegetables, cheese and dairy products. He has a deep understanding of local consumer needs; he has sufficient experience in this field. His market is situated in a crowded area so there are a good number of customers passing by.

He decided to apply for a $1800 loan in order to redecorate his market and to make a ceiling. He is aiming to gain more profits to offer him the opportunity to provide a better life for his family as a whole.

loans.use: to redecorate his food market and to make a ceiling

loans.name: Bakhtiyor

texts.ru: Бахтиёр зарабатывает путем разведения мелко - рогатого скота. В этой области он 10 лет. Ему 35 лет. Он женат. У него двое детей. Кредит берет для закупа несколько голов мелко – рогатого скота.
texts.en: Bakhtiyor is a rancher who raises goats for a living. He has been working with livestock for the last 10 years. Bakhtiyor is 35 years old, married and has two children. He needs this loan to purchase a few more animals for his herd.

loans.use: to purchase a few heads of livestock

loans.name: Gorret

texts.en:
Gorret lives in Uganda. She is married and has two children, both of whom are in school. She also takes care of her grandchildren. Gorret lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, medication, and food for the family. She  rents out a room to generate additional income.

Gorret has run a food stall from her home for 10 years, and she works 6 days per week. She has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bunches of bananas, onions, and tomatoes. Her main business challenges include seasonality, transportation, and theft. Her goals and aspirations are to own a fully stocked food stall and to build more rental rooms.

loans.use: to buy bananas, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Librado

texts.en:
Librado is 54 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married and has four children.
 
Librado has a tailoring shop that makes and sells office and school uniforms and dresses and repairs shirts. He has had this business for 20 years. 

He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

Librado is a new member of HSPFI. In the future, Librado hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for the tailoring shop.

loans.name: Ludmila

texts.ru:
Людмила – вдова. У нее есть двое взрослых детей. Людмила – из Мелитополя. Она работает на местном Районном рынке, торгует женской одеждой: кофтами, футболками, платьями. Людмила очень трудолюбивая. Она занимается предпринимательством уже 15 лет. На данный момент у нее 20 000 гривен оборотного капитала. 

Людмиле необходим кредит КИВА  в размере 10 000 гривен для того, чтобы закупить женскую одежду к сезону. Она хотела бы увеличить ассортимент и, реализовав его, получить дополнительную прибыль.  За счет получения дополнительной прибыли Людмила хотела бы провести автономное отопление в своей квартире. Более того, Людмиле нравится работать с этой группой товаров, поэтому она планирует и дальше вкладывать полученные от реализации средства в дальнейшее развитие своего дела. 
Пометка: история на русском языке
texts.en:
Ludmila is a widow. She has two grown children. Ludmila is from Melitopol. She works at the local market selling women's clothing: sweaters, shirts, dresses. Lyudmila is very hardworking. She has been in business for fifteen years. At the moment, her working capital is 20,000 hryvnia. 

Ludmila needs a Kiva loan of 10,000 hryvnia to buy women's clothes for the season. She would like to increase the variety she carries and thereby earn extra income. With the profit she makes, Ludmila would like to install a heating system in her apartment. Moreover, Ludmila enjoys working with these products, so she plans to continue to invest funds she receives from sales to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy seasonal women's clothing.

loans.name: Damianus

texts.en:
Damianus is a 41-year-old, married man with children.  He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda.  Damianus is a teacher and he has his own school that he has run for eight years. His goals are to build a permanent house and expand his school.  He faces the hardship of inadequate capital to purchase the necessary equipment.

Damianus requests the loan to buy desks, beds and other school equipment.

loans.use: to buy desks, beds and other school equipment for the school he runs.

loans.name: B. Alexandrine

texts.fr: B. Alexandrine âgée de 25 ans a arrêté l’école au niveau primaire. B. Alexandrine est ne vit plus avec son mari et a un seul enfant scolarisé et à la charge du couple. B. Alexandrine vit seule avec son enfant. les différentes charges de la maison sont supportées par le couple. Pour ce faire, B. Alexandrine vend divers produits (sucre, lait, biscuits etc) à son domicile depuis sept environ ; ce qui lui permet de contribuer aux besoins de la maison. les différentes charges de la maison. B. Alexandrine  s'approvisionne dans un marché du Bénin. La clientèle de B. Alexandrine devient de plus en plus grandissante. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son chiffre d'affaire et son revenu, B. Alexandrine  sollicite une première fois l’appui financier de ALIDé.

loans.use: Acheter divers produits.

loans.name: A New Day Group

texts.en:
Mr Nam is 37 years old and he is married.
 
He has worked in agriculture raising cattle for 5 years.
Nam lives in Tinh Gia district, a  rural town in Thanh Hoa province.
His family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
The main hardship that Nam faces is lack of capital.  is requesting a loan to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.
This is Nam first loan with Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
With his business profit, Nam hopes for his business to do well, for his family to be healthy and happy, and for his children to find a good job.

loans.use: to purchase baby cattle to raise and sell in future.

loans.name: Elnur

texts.en:
Elnur is Internally Displaced Person ( IDP ) from the Armenian-ocupied territory of Azerbaijan Lachin. He settled with his family in Sumgait city. Elnur is 28 years old. He married and has 1 child. He is the only breadwinner in family. In the beginning his business he sold the fruit. He borrowed the loan amount of $500 to be engaged in sale of fruit. For the second time he borrowed the loan of amount $1000 to rent a mini shop and buy foodstuff. 
Now, he applies for the loan $1500 to expand the area of his shop and to increase the food assortments.

loans.use: To expand the area of his shop

loans.name: Alice Fonjong

texts.en:
Alice is a mother of seven children. She has to work daily to provide medication to her child who is suffering with epilepsy and is almost rejected by society. Being there for her child is her motivation to work even harder. She took her first loan in 2005 and succeeded in providing her community with fresh raw food.

Given a loan of $500, she plans to buy piglets, 20 bags of feed, sticks, and nails to repair and expand her pig fence and pay for vet services for the pigs. She plans to repay her loan from sales of manure, vegetable and empty bags of feed. She plans to pay loan in 18 months. The first installment repayment shall be on the fourth month from the date of disbursement of loan.

loans.use: Pig Farming

loans.name: Kong

texts.en:
Kong was married in 1984, and she has 2 children, one son and one daughter. She learned to weave silk from her mother when she was 17 years old. She continued training her daughter in order to assist her in weaving silk at home after she came home from school.

Her husband is the construction mason in the village. Kong's son is studying, and is in his 9th year of school in the village. She has borrowed loans from MAXIMA for 2 cycles, and the current loan amount is $150. She uses this loans to buy silk materials and sewing thread. She plans to set up another loom for her daughter for the next loan, which will cost $177.70 in total. She has enough ability to repay the loan.

loans.use: Purchasing silk materials & sewing thread

loans.name: Chab

texts.en: Mrs. Chab Y. is 59 years old and lives in Kampong Cham with her husband and their 4 children.  Mrs. Chab works as a farmer, growing rice crops and fresh vegetables.  She will use this loan to purchase bean seeds for her family's farm.

loans.use: To purchase bean seeds to grow in her farm

loans.name: Janeth

texts.es:
"I have an unfinished work of construction since I lack money, but now I have recuperated a little and I want finish it so that I can live in those rooms. Also, I need to put in a floor, a door, and the windows. I am requesting $1,200 to finish the construction."

Translated from Spanish by Jay Osborne, Kiva volunteer

“Tengo una construcción sin terminar ya que me falto dinero pero ahora me he recuperado un poco y quisiera terminarla para poder habitar esos cuartos, también necesito poner el piso, una puerta y las ventanas. Solicito $ 1,200.00 dlls para terminar mi construcción.

loans.use: Finish construction and put in the floor.

loans.name: Ni Komang Swastini

texts.id:
Her husband’s income as a construction worker is often insufficient to cover the family’s expenses, thus Ni Komang Suastini contribute by working to generate additional income. Ni Komang Suastini’s effort of choice is to trade in produce, purchasing several varieties of farmers harvests like banana, mango, coconut, jackfruit, etc., depending on the season. Then transported to the state market to be sold. Daily, Ni Komang Suastini, generate income ranging from Rp. 30.000 to Rp. 35.000 (USD3 to USD4), - from a funding outlay of Rp. 500.000 (about USD50), - . The activities performed by Ni Komang Suastini commences from 10 in the morning using motorcycle used to seek produce to trade, after having collected sufficient produce, around 1600 hr., the produce were immediately taken to the state market to be sold to traders who have become her permanent customers. Such activity being carried out almost daily. Receiving this funding loan from Dinari enable Ni Komang Suastini to increase purchases and also maintain the motorcycle to carry out this effort smoothly.

Translated from Indonesian to English by Pheng Tan, Kiva volunteer.

Penghasilan suami yang pas-pasan sebagai tukang bangunan bahkan sering tidak cukup untuk biaya hidup keluarga, membuat Ni Komang Suastini turut bekerja keras untuk mendapatkan tambahan penghasilan . Usaha yang menjadi pilihan Ni Komang Suastini adalah sebagai pedagang hasil bumi, yaitu membeli berbagai jenis hasil panen petani seperti Pisang , mangga, kelapa, nangka ,kakau ,dan yang lainya tergantung musim. Kemudian di bawa ke pasar Negara untuk di jual kembali. Dalam sehari Ni Komang Suastini mendapat keuntungan sebesar Rp 30,000,- s/d 35.000,- dari modal yang hanya Rp 500.000,- . Aktifitas yang dilakukan Ni Komang Suastini mulai dari pukul 10.00 pagi berkeliling dengan menggunakan sepeda motor miliknya untuk mencari barang dagangan , setelah barang terkumpul dirasa cukup , kira-kira pukul 16.00 barang itu langsung di bawanya ke pasar Negara untuk di jual pada pedagang yang sudah menjadi pelanggan tetapnya . Demikian kegiatan ini dilakukan hampir setiap hari. Mendapat pinjaman modal dari Dinari oleh Ni Komang Suastini di gunakan untuk menambah modal dan juga untuk memperbaiki sepeda motor yang ada sehinga usahanya berjalan lebih lancar.

loans.use: Increase funding for purchasing more produce and maintain motorcycle (Menambah modal usaha untuk membeli dagangan lebih banyak lagi dan memperbaiki sepeda motor sebagai sarana untuk berjualan)

loans.name: Canasteras Group

texts.es:
The ladies of this group of basket makers are already experienced in the field of communal banks. They are requesting their fourteenth loan. This experience is shown in their capacity T. be organized and T. discuss among themselves when there are small objections. The fact that they already have shared more than 6 years of meetings shows that the dynamics of the group are incredible.

Mostly the ladies work embroidering blouses and traditional clothing that stem from the Guatemalan high plains. Also, there are many that invest their capital in the breeding of chickens, hogs and bulls. Another group works in the production of typical baskets of Santa Clara, while the remainder of the ladies work selling vegetables, notions and accessories in the market.

Juana E. commented that she was going T. invest her money in buying a bull in order T. fatten it and sell it for 50% more than the cost. Cristina A. is going T. utilize her loan T. buy dozens of already finished baskets and T. resell them in the market. A great portion of the ladies are going T. utilize their loans T. buy threads for their embroidery.

All these ladies dream of buying land T. be able T. expand their house, T. cultivate the land or T. offer a place T. their children so that they can build their houses in the future. These ladies, as the great majority of native women, think about the happiness of their children before their own happiness. It is for this reason that they want T. request more money than the loan that they had requested in the past: T. invest in the education of their children and daughters. Some of them dream of buying stalls inside the market so that they will not have T. walk around T. sell their products.

The dreams of these ladies are going T. be able T. come true if the necessary endorsement is given, since they have shown along the years that they can achieve incredible things with their lives. They only need T. continue receiving that support.

Translated from Spanish by B, Kiva Volunteer.

Las señoras del grupo Canasteras son personas ya experimentadas en el ámbiT. de bancos comunales. Ellas están solicitando su decimocuarT. préstamo. Esta experiencia se demuestra en su capacidad de organizarse y de dialogar cuando hay pequeños inconvenientes. El hecho de que ellas ya hayan compartido más de 6 años juntas, hace que la dinámica del grupo sea increíble.

En su mayoría las señoras trabajan bordando blusas y vestimentas tradicionales que provienen del altiplano Guatemalteco. También, hay muchas que invierten su capital en la crianza de pollos, cerdos y toros. Otro grupo trabaja en la producción de canastas típicas de Santa Clara. Mientras que el resT. de señoras trabajan vendiendo verduras y mercería en el mercado.

Juana E. comentó que iba a invertir su dinero en comprar un toro para luego engordarlo y venderlo a un 50% más del cosT.. Cristina A. va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar docenas de canastas ya hechas y revenderlas en el mercado. Una gran porción de las señoras va a utilizar su préstamo para comprar hilos para los bordados.

Todas estas señoras sueñan con comprar un terreno para poder ampliar su casa, para cultivar la tierra o para brindarles un lugar a sus hijos para que puedan construir sus casas en el futuro. Estas señoras, como la gran mayoría de mujeres indígenas, piensan en la felicidad de sus hijos primero que en su felicidad. Es por eso, que ellas quieren solicitar más dinero que el que ya han pedido para invertirlo en la educación de sus hijos e hijas. Algunas sueñan con comprar locales dentro del mercado para no tener que vender sus productos como ambulantes.

Los sueños de estas señoras se van a poder materializar si el respaldo necesario es dado, ya que ellas han demostrado a lo largo de los años que si pueden lograr cosas increíbles con sus vidas. Sólo necesitan seguir recibiendo ese apoyo.

loans.use: To buy and sell raw materials to embroider traditional weavings.  To buy animals for resale.  To buy baskets, raw materials to make baskets, buy vegetables and cosmetics for sale.

loans.name: Sofia's Group

texts.en:
Sofia and Zonia have been members of the community bank Kallpanchik, which means "our force" in Quechua, for one year. In their community bank they have learned business skills such as saving, discipline, punctuality, and responsibility. They have also learned how to care for their children, how to avoid getting sick, and how to have a positive relationship with their husbands.

Sofia is 36 years old and has four children. She knits beautiful sweaters, which she sells to the stores in the center of Ayacucho. She also sells them to friends and family. Sofia learned how to knit from her mother. Furthermore, Sofia has recently opened a bar.

Meanwhile, Zonia is 40; she is married and has five children. She buys cochinilla, an insect used to make red dye, and leather in the country and then sells it to intermediaries who take it to Lima. Sofia also buys animals, butchers them and sells them in the Nery Garcia market of Ayacucho.

Sofia and Zonia need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wool of various colors, knitting needles, cochinillia, and leather.

Each member of the community bank gets an interest-earning savings account. Sofia and Zonia hope to use their savings to buy furniture and decorations for their house, and to educate their children. Their dreams are to own a home, own a business where they can sell their own knit goods, start a new business, and that their children will be professionals.

loans.use: Sofia and Zonia need loans of 400 and 600 soles (3 soles = $1), which they will invest in buying wool of various colors, knitting needles, cochinillia, and leather.

loans.name: Chuth

texts.en: Mrs. Chuth M. is a 47 year old housewife with 3 children.  In addition to her child-raising and cooking responsibilities, she breeds pigs, which normally generates $1.33 a day. Her husband, Mr. Chren Chroe, 50, works recharging batteries and on average earns $5 a day of profit. To contribute to family income, her daughter earns $2.50  when selling groceries in front of the house. Raising pigs has become more popular and profitable in remote areas of Cambodia, so this family needs a loan of $500 to purchase more pigs to breed. Profits  will be spent  on the children's education.

loans.use: To purchase pigs to breed.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
Mrs. Bertha belongs to a communal bank named “Juntas Hasta el Final” (together until the end), located in Jr. Zarumilla 144, in the district of Calleria in the department of Ucayali. She is a 65 year-old married woman who has 4 children. Her husband is driver, but his daily income is not enough to cover for the daily expenses. That is why Bertha with the first loan of 300 Soles she decided to invest in the preparation and selling of candy and other goodies. At the moment she continues preparing her candies and selling her goodies at her house. Her children help her make the candies and she can she goes out and buys the other goodies to sell. In the afternoons she sells these candies and goodies. With the loan of 1,000 Soles, which she will pay back in 5 months, she will invest it in buying, 1 sack of flour, 1 sack of sugar, eggs, butter, baking powder, milk, vanilla, and other goodies in general. Bertha is a good example of a hard-working woman. Despite her age she says she still feels young and with a lot of energy to keep working, and thanks to Manuela Ramos she feels more independent and confident about herself.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela of San Roque High School, Kiva volunteer

La señora Bertha pertenece al Banco Comunal Juntas Hasta el Final, ubicado en el Jr. Zarumilla 144, del Distrito D. Calleria del Departamento D. Ucayali. Tiene 65 años es casada, tiene 4 hijos, su esposo es chofer, pero el ingreso que tiene no le alcanza para su economía diaria, es así que Bertha con el primer préstamo recibido D. Manuela Ramos S/. 300 decidió invertir en la preparación y venta D. dulces y golosinas. En la actualidad sigue preparando sus dulces y vendiendo sus golosinas en su casa, con la ayuda D. sus hijos prepara sus dulces y cuando pueD. sale a comprar sus golosinas, en las tardes se dedica a la venta D. sus productos. Con este préstamo recibido D. S/. 1,000, el cual será pagado en 5 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D.: 1 saco harina, 1 saco D. azúcar, huevos, mantequilla, polvo D. hornear, leche, vainilla, y golosinas en general. Bertha es un ejemplo D. mujer trabajadora, a pesar D. su edad ella dice que se siente joven y con muchas energías para seguir trabajando, y gracias a Manuela Ramos se siente una mujer mas independiente y segura D. sI misma.

loans.use: Buying products for her general goods store.

loans.name: Fortunato

texts.es:
Fortunato is a chauffeur of the public transportation system “Inter” at the City of La Paz, El Alto. He owns a taxi and works a specific route, “trufi”. This activity provides his economic income which covers food and education. He lives in the Zone of Tembladerani in the City of La Paz. The loan will be spend on converting gasoline fuel to compressed vehicle gas and thus increase his income as the cost of gas is less than the cost of gasoline and with the transformation he will be able to save 50% of the cost of fuel. This is his first loan from Impro and he has been approved to receive the loan requested.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck, Kiva volunteer.

Fortunato es chofer de servicio público Inter – Ciudad La Paz - El Alto; es dueño de una movilidad que trabaja de trufi (ES UN TAXI QUE TIENE UNA RUTA FIJA). Esta actividad es su fuente de ingreso económico con el que cubre la alimentación y educación, vive en la Zona de Tembladerani de la Ciudad de La Paz. El crédito es requerido para la conversión de combustible de gasolina a gas comprimido vehicular, para poder incrementar sus ingresos, pues el costo de gas es mucho menor que el de la gasolina; con la transformación podrá ahorrar un 50% de costo en carburante. Es el primer crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada permite aprobarle el préstamo solicitado.

loans.use: Costs related to conversion of gasoline to compressed vehicle gas in order to reduce expenses.

loans.name: Afua

texts.en:
Afua B. is a fifty-seven-year-old widowed mother of five children. She is a food vendor who sells Kenkey. Kenkey is one of the local dishes prepared from maize and eaten with hot pepper and fish. She has been selling Kenkey for the past fifteen years.

Afua said since her husband died ten years ago, this business has been the backbone to finance her children’s education. She wants to expand her production to serve additional customers and therefore wants to use the loan to buy more bags of maize, fish and vegetables. She believes this will fetch her increased income to support her last daughter in completing her apprenticeship.

Afua belongs to the community group called Christ Nti (meaning it is because of Christ). Members act as social collateral for one another to enable each other to access loans.

loans.use: To buy more bags of maize, fish and vegetables.

loans.name: Vuthy

texts.en:
Mr. Vuthy C., age 38, and his wife, Mrs. Rith Pich, age 38, who live in a small village across the Mekong River about 15 kilometers north of Phnom Penh, were married in 1993 and have 3 sons. All of them are in local school.

Mr. Vuthy has been a blacksmith for 7 years. He operates his business in Phnom Penh and the nearby province. Mrs. Rith has been a weaver for 23 years, but now she stopped her weaving business and created another business of selling food in the village.

Mr. Vuthy is requesting a loan of US$1000 to purchase blacksmith materials for expanding his business.

loans.use: To purchase blacksmith materials for expanding his business

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia has been selling mana, made from maize, noodles, wheat that she got from a factory 13 years ago, and she has a stall in the 15 de agosto market.

She is a member of the group Banco Comunal Estrellita del Sur where she had an initial loan of $300 soles which she invested in 2 and a half sacks of mana.

With the new credit of $500 soles which will be repaid in 4 months, she will buy 4 sacks of mana.

She tells us that the date when they meet to pay their quotas is a fun moment, they advise each other and are all very happy as she has her husband's support.

Translated from Spanish by Liz Harvey, Kiva Volunteer

La señora Antonia se dedica a la venta de mana, hechos de maíz, fideos, trigo que lo adquiere directamente de la fabrica desde hace 13 años atrás, teniendo un puesto de venta en la plataforma del mercado 15 de agosto. Ella es socia del Banco Comunal Estrellita del Sur donde tuvo un préstamo inicial de S/.300.00 nuevos soles, que lo invirtió en la compra de dos sacos y medio de mana. Con este crédito de S/ 500 nuevos soles, el cual será cancelado en 4 meses, comprará 4 sacos de mana. Ella nos cuenta que la fecha en que se reúnen para el pago de sus cuotas es un momento de distracción, se aconsejan entre ellas y se sienten muy feliz por que cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo .

loans.use: To buy mana (a type of cereal) in bulk/Compra al por mayor de mana (cereal)

loans.name: Maria Francisca

texts.es:
María is 63 years old and married. She studied until middle school, but left when she got engaged. María has five children who live on their own. She lives in Laredo District, Trujillo Province in La Libertad state.

To support herself financially, María started selling cosmetics. The company sales supervisor visited María and encouraged her to join the Esika group of consultants. Seeing she needed capital to purchase products on sale in the company catalogue – and seeing a woman from the consultants group had referred María to the Mercado Modelo Community Bank – she decided to attend a bank meeting and became a member of the bank at that time. María has been working with the bank for two years. She used her first loan of 300 soles [about US $100] to purchase cosmetic products to increase her stock.

With a loan of 800 soles [about US $ 275], which will be paid back in six months, María plans to purchase cosmetics on sale to get better prices. She is community bank treasurer and, as such, she is responsible for overseeing all the accounts. María hopes for a big business and for good health for her husband.

Translated from Spanish by Todd M. Anderson

La señora María Francisca, tiene 63 años, está casada, estudió hasta 5to grado D. primaria no continuó estudiando porque se comprometió, tiene 5 hijos, los cuales son independientes, vive en el Distrito D. Laredo en la Provincia D. Trujillo en el Departamento D. La Libertad.

Para ayudarse económicamente empezó a vender productos cosméticos, la socia recibió la visita D. la supervisora D. ventas y la animó a formar parte del grupo D. consultoras D. Esika, pero como necesitaba capital para comprar los productos cosméticos que están en oferta en el catalogo y como una compañera del grupo D. consultoras le comentó sobre el Banco Comunal “MERCADO MODELO” ella decidió asistir a una reunión D. este Banco, entonces es cuando deciD. incorporarse a Manuela Ramos, en esta ONG lleva trabajando 2 años y con el primer préstamo que recibió D. S/. 300.00 compró productos cosméticos para incrementar el stock.

Con el crédito D. S/. 800.00 que cancelará en 6 meses tiene pensado comprar productos cosméticos que están en oferta para obtener mejores precios. En el Banco Comunal la empresaria tiene el cargo D. tesorera cuya función es llevar el control D. todas las cuentas. La socia sueña con tener un negocio granD. y que su esposo este bien D. salud.

loans.use: Purchase of beauty products (cosmetics)

loans.name: Virginia

texts.es:
Virginia  vive en la calle San Bartolomé de la zona Villa Cooperativa  en la ciudad de El Alto. Es casada y tiene un hijo de 12 años.

Se dedica a la confección de polleras y venta de golosinas en la puerta de una escuela de la zona.

El crédito lo destinara en la compra de lmercaderias. 
 
Es su  segundo crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada la califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Virginia lives on San Bartolomé Street in the Villa Cooperativa zone in the city of El Alto. She is married and has a twelve-year-old son. She prepares poultry and sells sweets at the entrance of a school in the area. This loan will be used to buy merchandise. This is Virginia’s second loan with Impro. The assessment carried out qualifies her to be awarded the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Roberto

texts.es:
El Sr. Roberto B. no está solicitando un préstamo para poner el piso de concretó al frente de su casa ya que cuando llueve se le inunda el lugar y el agua se va para dentro de su casa y los muebles ya están algo dañados por la humedad.

Sr. Roberto trabaja en una compañía que se dedican a la construcción de casas el está en el aria de electricista esté es su ingreso familiar.

Roberto nos contó que el por el momento se esta haciendo cargo de sus 2 hijos porque se separa de su esposa.

El Sr. Roberto está solicitando un préstamo por $575.00 dlls para poner le piso al frente de su casa.
texts.en:
Roberto Baez is soliciting this loan in order to lay a cement patio in front of his home. This needs to be done in order to stop the flooding of his house when it rains, which ruins the furniture and the home itself. Roberto is an electrician and works for a home construction company for his primary source of income. He is currently the only care taker of his two children because he has separated from his wife. Roberto is soliciting this loan of $575 dollars to lay a cement patio in front of his home.

Translated from Spanish by James Lombardo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Put a cement patio in front of his home.

loans.name: Sreyleak

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreyleak C., 25, and her husband, Mr. Thoeun Phoeun, 22, lives along National Road Number Six about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh. They married in 2006 and have one daughter.  

Mrs. Sreyleak and her husband have been garment factory workers in Phnom Penh for three years. The couple needs to buy a motorbike to drive to work but lacks the funds to do so. Therefore, Sreyleak is requesting a loan of $1000 to purchase a motorbike.

loans.use: To purchase a motorcycle to drive to work.

loans.name: Nhanh Chhum's Group

texts.en:
Nhanh C. (the first from the right) was selected to be a group leader by members for a loan from Maxima. In the group there are three families including her family. The entire group members are living along National Road Number Two, which is about twenty kilometers from Phnom Penh.
1- Nhanh C., 38, and her husband, Sarim Tuy, were married in 1988 and have six children; five sons and one daughter. Two of their children are married and live outside the family home, three children attend school and the youngest one is still very young. Nhanh has been selling duck eggs for one year.
