Her husband has been a mason for seven years. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase a cow.
2-Sim H. (the second from the right), 26, is a widow with one son who is still very young. Sim has been selling second-hand clothes for four years. She bought them from a market in Phnom Penh to resell Ta Khmao market. She is requesting a loan in the amount of $300 to purchase more second-hand clothes for resale.
3-Soeun H., 29, and his wife, Sivorn Chorn, 29, were married in 1996 and have three children; two sons and one daughter. Two of them attend school and the other one is still young and stays at home. Soeurn has been a mason and fisherman for ten years. His wife has been fishing and selling for ten years as well. He is requesting a loan of $200 to purchase seine for fishing.

loans.use: To purchase cow for raising, buy clothes for resale, and for fishing.

loans.name: Sok

texts.en: Mrs. Sok K. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Ti Pie village in Kandal province. She is a farmer who has half a hectare to cultivate rice on to earn her living. Since her rice field is far from the irrigation system, Mrs. Sok K. decided to ask for a loan to purchase a pump and hose in order to water her field to make her crop more productive. Her husband, Mr. Pun Phorn, helps her in the plantation. Mrs. Sok K. is 58 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are car repairmen while the youngest one is attending the local school. Her husband is also in the photo.

loans.use: to purchase a pump and hose in order to water her field

loans.name: Lucena

texts.en:
Lucena P. is 54 years old, married, and has 7 children. She lives with her family in Danao, Plaridel, in Misamis Occidental. She helps with the family fishing business. By selling their seafood products, her family has been able to support itself and bring their catch to the closest local market.

Lucena has successfully completed her eighth loan, and is considered a Member in Good Standing. She hopes to expand her business once more with another loan. Faced with various challenges, she believes that your financial help can help her reach her goal.

Lucena never considers herself too old to strive for a better life. With her children and husband, she dreams of expanding her business and hopes to help her children find stable, consistent jobs.

loans.use: To build up additional capital for fishing

loans.name: Erasma

texts.es: Erasma tiene 55 años de edad, está felizmente casada desde 1969, ella es madre de un hijo, y actualmente viven en su casa propia, lugar donde fabrican y venden cajones de frutas. Desde su niñez Erasma se ha dedicado a la agricultura, y los 40 años de matrimonio los ha dedicado a la siembra y cultivo de plátanos, cítricos y paltas. En aquellos tiempos la cosecha era buena, pero ahora solo conservan unas cuantas chacras, las cuales cosechan cada 15 días y no les resultan rentables. Sus horas libres Erasma la dedica a  la fabricación de javas y cajas para el guardado de frutas, ella y su esposo jamás pensaron que este negocio les resultaría tan rentable, pero ahora tienen muchos pedidos, produciendo de 100 a 150 javas o cajones, que venden a un precio de de 90 céntimos y 1 sol dependiendo de la fruta que se empaque. Con esta actividad su esposo está muy feliz, ya que tiene el apoyo incondicional, de ella y la de su hijo, quien colabora con la fabricación, juntos buscan clientes, para ofrecer su mercadería a un precio considerable; este negocio les está dando muchas alegrías, además de permitirle ganar a la semana de 100 a 150 soles, dinero que cubre la alimentación diaria de su familia. Erasma en los ciclos pasados ocupaba el cargo de tesorera, y cumplió con mucha responsabilidad su trabajo realizando los cobros en cada fecha cronogramada, este es su 5to préstamo con MFP con el cual espera seguir dando todo de sí. Con la mayor parte del dinero solicitado, comprará materiales para la construcción de cajones, y otra menor cantidad la utilizará para la compra de fertilizantes para su chacra de plátanos. Erasma tiene mucha gratitud a todos los que hacen posible este préstamo, ya que le permite seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Erasma is 55 years old and has been happily married since 1969. She has one child and is currently living in a house she owns, where they prepare and sell crates of fruit. Since she was young, Erasma has been working in agriculture and for the 40 years she has been married she has raised and harvested plantain, citrus fruit and avocado. In those times the harvest was good but now they only have a limited number of fields which they harvest every 15 days and are not very profitable. In her free time, Erasma makes containers and crates to keep the fruit. She and her husband never thought this business would be as profitable as it has turned out to be and they now have good demand, creating between 100 to 150 containers or crates which they sell for 90 céntimos or 1 sol each depending on the fruit packed inside. Her husband is very pleased with this activity as he has her unconditional support and that of her child who also helps with preparations. Together, they go looking for customers, to offer they merchandise for a good price. This business is making them very happy and allows them to make between 100 and 150 soles a week, money which covers the daily food needs of the family. Erasma has in past loan cycles been the group treasurer and she accomplished this task with great responsibility, ensuring the repayments were always recorded correctly. This is her fifth loan with MFP with which she hopes to continue. She will use most of the loan to buy materials to build crates and a smaller portion to buy fertilizers for her plantain fields. Erasma is very grateful to all those who have made her loan possible as it will allow her to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to make crates to sell her fruit and vegetables

loans.name: Alaimalo

texts.en: Alaimalo F., 58, is married and has eight children. She has four years of experience planting, harvesting, and selling bananas and taro. She sells to the people of the village and in Fugalei market three days a week. She has had four previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 250 Tala ( about $104 USD). SPBD loans are Alaimalo’s only access to capital because she cannot qualify for a loan with traditional banks. Alaimalo will use this money to improve her business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals and equipment for her business.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Bancomunal Amigas Unidas. 
María es separada tiene 47 años, cuatro hijos de 27, 26,20 y 17 años, los mayores trabajan y los menores estudian. 
Antes María vendía gas en su casa, sus amigas la animaron a que vendiera ropa, ella vende ropa zapatos, lo que le pide  sus clientas. 
María necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles, para comprar mercadería ropa y zapatos, lo que le pidan sus clientas.
Desde que está en Finca, su negocio creció más, le gusta pertenecer al Bancomunal porque ve el apoyo entre compañeras ve solidaridad en el grupo. 
El sueño de María es tener un puesto  propio en el mercado.
texts.en:
Maria is an associate of the Communal Bank "Amigas Unidas" (United Friends). Maria is separated is 47 years old, four children of 27, 26, 20 and 17 years of age. Her older children work and her younger children go to school. Before Maria sold gas out of her house. Then her friends encouraged her to start to sell clothes. She sells clothes, shoes, or whatever her clients order. Maria needs a loan of $325 (1000 Soles), to buy merchandise. She says since she has been a member of Finca, her business has grown. She likes to belong to the bank communal because she sees the support among fellow members and there is a lot of solidarity in the group. Maria’s dream is to have an own spot in the marketplace. (Translated by Tucker of San Roque High School)

Translated from Spanish by San Roque School, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maria needs a loan of $325, to buy merchandise, clothes and shoes, and whatever her clients order.

loans.name: Kodjo Elinam

texts.fr: Monsieur A. est homme vend des produits pharmaceutiques chinois.Il a ouvert sa boutique qui s’appelle « YAN-XIANOHUA » en 2007.  Voulant agrandir son stock pour mieux, il sollicite de WAGES son premier crédit qui lui permettra d’acheter plus de produits pharmaceutiques chinois.  Monsieur A. habite avec sa femme qui est couturière à Wonyomé, un quartier périphérique de Lomé, la capitale du Togo.
texts.en:
Mr. A. sells Chinese pharmaceuticals. He opened his shop that he calls «YAN-XIANOHUA» in 2007. Wishing to expand his stock so as to make more sales, he is requesting his first loan from WAGES; the loan will permit him to buy more Chinese pharmaceutical products. Mr. A. lives with his wife, a seamstress, in Wonyomé, an outlying district of Lomé, the capital of Togo.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of Chinese pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Joi

texts.en:
Joi is a resident of Calamba, Mis. Occ. She is presently engaged in selling Ready-to-Wear items and is busy also attending to her mini grocery store. She is presently requesting a loan amounting to Php 7,000 for the purchase of additional grocery items such as food, soft drinks, toiletries and many others.

The family is praying that they can save, especially for the future education of their two children and to be able to expand their present business.

loans.use: purchase of additional grocery items such as rice, soft drinks, and other household items

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Раджабова Парвина проживаетв Гиссарском районе. Возраст 32 года. Одна воспитывает двоих детей. Муж уехал на заработки в Россию и пропал безвести. С того момента уже 4 года она работает на рынке Гиссара. Торгует одеждой. Получает прибыль в размере 700 сомони в месяц. Сейчас планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот.
texts.en:
Parvina R. lives in the Gissar district. She is 32 years and is raising two children. Her husband left to earn a living in Russia and disappeared. Since that moment, almost 4 years ago, Parvina has been working at the Gissar market, selling clothing. She receives a profit of 700 somoni per month. She currently plans to obtain a loan in order to increase her goods turnover.

Translated from Russian by Anna Sorokina-Hailey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase goods turnover

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia M. is from the city of Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro. She is 30 years old. Olivia is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Olivia owns & operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling fruits and vegetables. Olivia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Olivia joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Olivia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Olivia is requesting a new loan of 8000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Olivia from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

location.town: Lumbia, Cagayan de Oro, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Komla

texts.fr: Komla N. est propriétaire d’une boutique d’alimentation générale. Agé de 32 ans, il est marié et père de 2 enfants. komla désire avec ce crédit augmenter la capacité de son commerce en alimentant son magasin de nouveaux produits. Ce faisant il augmentera son chiffre d’affaire et par conséquents ses profits pour mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Komla N. is the owner of a general store. He is 32 years old, married, and the father of two. He would like to use this loan to increase his business capacity by supplying his store with new products. By doing this, he will increase his turnover and consequently his profits in order to provide for his family better.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To stock his shop

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Marisol, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Mujer Bellavista”, Distrito de Bellavista, Provincia de Bellavista, Departamento de San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 42 años y es madre de 02 hijos, quienes son quienes lo impulsan a seguir adelante.

Ante la necesidad de aportar al ingreso económico del hogar, motivada por su esposo emprendió su  propio negocio de venta de arroz al por mayor y con  el carisma y la buena atención que le caracteriza, tiene muy buena acogida. En la actualidad continua con el mismo negocio ubicada en su propia casa, donde sus principales clientes son clientes fijos que cuentan con sus propias bodegas.

Con este préstamo de S/. 2,000.00, comprará 45 sacos de arroz, para posteriormente venderlos. 

Hoy se siente muy feliz del  servicio que brinda y agradece al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, por apoyar mujeres como ella que quieren trabajar y salir adelante, espera que sigan así por mucho tiempo y ayuden a muchas mujeres emprendedoras.
texts.en:
Sra. Marisol belongs to the communal bank group “Mujer Bellavista”, which meets in the Bellavista District of Bellavista Province, Department of San Martín. She is 42 years old, married and the mother of 2 children, whom she urges to do their best.

Given the need to contribute to the household income, Marisol was encouraged by her husband to start her own business selling rice to wholesalers. Her charisma and attentiveness are qualities to be admired. She currently operates her business out of her home, where her regular customers come to restock their own shops.

With this loan of 2000 soles, she will buy 45 sacks of rice for later sale. She is very happy with the service she has received and thanks Manuela Ramos for supporting women who want to work to get ahead. She hopes to be in business for a long time and help other female entrepreneurs.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy 45 sacks of rice

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn M. sells feeding bottles, nursing equipment and soft drinks in Elmina. She is married with five dependents and has received senior high school education. Her husband is a trader.

Evelyn has been selling feeding bottles and nursing equipment since 1999 and is responsible for paying school fees and bills. Her loan will be used to buy more babies' items like feeding bottles, nursing equipment and other items to expand her business. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to save and to educate her children.

loans.use: To buy more babies' items like feeding bottles, nursing equipment and other items

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda G., 33 years old and  married, lives in Warri Delta State, Nigeria. She sells poly bags and is requesting the loan amount of N160,000 from Kiva lenders to purchase more bags to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more poly bags to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth V. business is a rice grower. She tills a hectare of farm so closely from their house. Aside from farm, she also raises pigs. She feeds and bathes them everyday to be able to grow her pigs healthy and heavy.  She has four children. Her eldest child is 24 years old and is still living with her.
Receiving a loan of Php 8,000 is truly worthwhile because she needs resources for farm financing. The seeds that she used in her farm are not yet paid , the loan will help paying the seeds. She also planned buying 2 piglets and feed. She said that CEVI gives the lowest interest rate, which is 2% a month, and is very affordable to repay

loans.use: rice seeds

loans.name: Flordeliza

texts.en:
Flordeliza G., 71, is a widow with nine adult children from the village of Brgy. Gargato, Hinigaran, Negros Occidental. She may be a senior citizen with children ranging in age from 30 to 50, but she is a strong independent woman.

Flordeliza joined NWTF-Project Dungganon 16 years ago with the objective of setting up her own business and helping her husband support their family. She also liked the idea of being a member of an organization that empowers women out of poverty, and she used her first cycle loan to open a coffee shop adjacent to their house. With the help of her husband and children, she was able to build her business, and her coffee shop became a favorite among the locals, earning enough to be a significant help in meeting their family's expenses.

When her husband died, she was not left bereft as she had the means to continue supporting herself and her family. It also helped when her adult children started earning their own living, easing her financial burden. As time passed, Flordeliza was able to buy a motorcycle with a sidecar for passengers which currently earns her additional income. Now that all of her children have their own families, Flordeliza is content that she is not a burden to them in her old age.

In the 16 years that she has been a member, she has maintained a good credit record with NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her last loan of PHP 15,000 was fully repaid on time without any delays in the weekly installments. Now she is requesting another PHP 15,000 to add to her revolving working capital for her coffee shop.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. has answered the calling of not just a few but thousands of women. Through the alleviation program, these women have progressed from earning less than a measly $1 a day to achieving realities beyond their dreams. They have learned to live a life where they can finally be called honorable. This is Project Dungganon.

loans.use: Additional capital for her business

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
Abdul is married to a nurse who works with a local hospital. He has 4 children all under 18 years of age. He is 36 years old and has been in the shoe-selling business for over 15 years. Abdul plans to use the loan to purchase more inventory. With the income generated at his store, Abdul hopes to complete the on-going construction of his house which still needs a roof, windows, and doors.

Abdul has successfully borrowed from ARD over 5 times as a participant in group loans. This is Abdul’s first individual loan.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en: Here is John S., a 35-year-old man, who sells a number of items including bars of soap, Vaseline, toothbrushes and toothpaste, slippers/flip-flops and many more. He has been a businessman for six years now. John is married to a businesswoman and they have one child who is in class one. John wants a loan of 1,000,000 leones to invest in his business.

loans.use: To invest in his business

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia L. is 43 years old, and she is married to Wilson L. who works as a carpenter within their village. They have been blessed with six children: Dina-20 years old who just finished high school; Wilmar-17 years old; Wilson Jr.-15 years old, an elementary pupil; Willie-12 years old; Widdie-five years old, and Christian-three years old. They are happily living in the village of Quezon, San Isidro.

Delia sells "Cindy’s breads" and other kinds of snacks in their village. She would like to buy additional bread so that she could generate bigger income. In this regard, she is requesting a loan amounting to PHP 5,000. She says she is able to generate PHP 1,500 weekly. With this income she still needs to seek additional capital for her to support her children in their schooling. She hopes that she will be given the loan by the KIVA lenders so she can achieve her goals in life.

loans.use: additional capital to buy more bread to sell

loans.name: Keith

texts.en:
Keith K. is a 58-year-old married father of four children. He lives in Mombasa's Mtopanga area where he is in the business of supplying firewood to residents and schools within Mtopanga and Shanzu. He has done this business for two years now. He also owns a hardware store in Shanzu, which supplements his daily income.

Keith learned of KADET through a marketing activity and was able to interact with the KADET officers. He is currently borrowing his first loan, which he intends to use to purchase firewood and for transport expenses. 

He hopes to own a truck to aid him in transportation of both the firewood and goods to his hardware store.


About KADET:
The Kenya Agency for the Development of Enterprise and Technology (KADET) is dedicated to economically empower her clients by providing financial services to improve living conditions of micro-entrepreneurs and their children across Kenya. KADET is the microfinance subsidiary of World Vision Kenya. Obtain more information on KADET from the website: www.kadet.co.ke

loans.use: To purchase firewood and pay for transport expenses.

loans.name: Pascaline

texts.fr: B. Pascaline est née en 1962 à Adjohoun dans le département de l'Ouémé au Bénin. Pascaline est mariée à MITCHAÏ Gregoire, un enseignant. Le couple a cinq enfants qui sont tous scolarisés. Il y a cinq ans que Pascaline vit à Dowa dans le cinquième arrondissement de Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Pascaline vit dans ce quartier Dowa avec son mari et ses enfants. Pascaline vient en aide à son mari dans les charges de la famille. Pascaline n'a pas été à l'école. C'est depuis quatre ans que Pascaline mène comme activité, la vente de farine de manioc, des habits et des chaussures sandalettes à son domicile. Pascaline s'approvisionne à Bonou et au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo au Bénin. Pascaline est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, ayant déjà obtenu deux crédits auprès de ALIDé, crédits qui ont été bien remboursés. C'est pour agrandir son activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de la clientèle que Pascaline sollicite un troisième crédit auprès de ALIDé.
texts.en:
Pascaline B. was born in 1962 in Adjohoun in the Ouémé department of Benin. Pascaline is married to Gregoire Mitchaï, a teacher. The couple have five children, all in school. For five years, Pascaline has lived in Dowa, in the fifth arrondissement of Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Benin. Pascaline lives in the Dowa area with her husband and children. Pascaline helps her husband provide for the family. Pascaline did not go to school. For four years, Pascaline has run a business selling manioc flour, clothes, and sandals at her home. Pascaline gets her supplies in Bonou and at the Ouando market in Porto-Novo, Benin. Pascaline is a longtime client of ALIDÉ (one of Kiva's field partners), having already obtained two loans through ALIDÉ, both of which were repaid properly. To enlarge her business in order to better meet the demands of her clientele, Pascaline is seeking a third loan through ALIDÉ.

Translated from French by Vilas Menon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy bags of manioc flour and clothing

loans.name: Lani

texts.en:
Lani, 48, is a farmer in Banga, South Cotabato. She owns a 2-and-a-half hectare corn field and 1 carabao. The income she receives from the farm supports her 4 children. She would like to supply her farm with farm necessities but she lacks capital.

She joined Community Economic Ventures, Inc. to be able to avail of a loan. She requested 8,000 Php to purchase farm inputs. With this, she can sustain her farm as well as her family.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Guadalupe G. D.  P. D. 39 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Apopa, vive junto a su familia la cual esta conformada por su esposo el cual trabaja como carpintero y su hijo D. 13 años D. edad el cual se dedica a estudiar. Guadalupe posee una tienda D. productos perecederos y así mismo un taller D. corte y confección en el cual se encarga D. realizar prendas D. vestir para hombres, mujeres y niños. Así mismo ella elabora ropa sin pedido previo los cuales los comercializa con las personas D. la zona, esto con el fin D. obtener otras fuentes D. ingresos. Guadalupe solicita un préstamo con el fin D. poder obtener el dinero necesario para poder comprar hilo, telas, botones y todo lo relacionado a la materia prima que ella utiliza para realizar su trabajo. Ella desea poder brindarle una mejor ayuda económica a su esposo, es por ello que trabaja tanto por obtener ganancias extras.
texts.en:
Guadalupe G. D. P. is 39 years old. She lives with her husband and her 13 year-old son in the municipality of Apopa. Her husband is a carpenter and her son is still in school. Guadalupe owns a store where she sells perishable products and a sewing shop where she makes clothes for men, women and children. She also makes clothes to sell around her neighborhood in order to earn additional income. Guadalupe is requesting a loan to buy sewing materials such as threads, fabric, and buttons. She hopes to be in a better position to help her husband financially; she works really hard to bring additional income.

Translated from Spanish by Rina Paguaga, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing material.

location.town: Apopa en el departamento de San Salvador

loans.name: Betzabeth

texts.es:
Betzabeth tiene 33 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa alquilada.
Desde hace 7 años se dedica al comercio, empezó vendiendo comida y en la actualidad tiene una tienda donde vende comestibles, útiles escolares y adornos, etc.
Su negocio está instalado en su vivienda y esto le permite atender a sus hijos y no descuidar las tareas de su hogar. 
Debido a la rentabilidad de su tienda Betzabeth está planificando incrementar la cantidad en mercadería que ofrece para atraer la atención de sus vecinos y otros clientes.

Esta es la séptima oportunidad en que tiene un crédito con MFP, por lo que tiene experiencia en el trabajo en equipo que se realiza en un banco comunal y está muy satisfecha al respecto. El dinero que ahora solicita lo utilizará para la compra de mercadería en abarrotes para su tienda.
texts.en:
Betzabeth is 33 years old, and lives with her husband and 3 children in a rented house. She has dedicated herself to commerce for the past 7 years, having started out selling food. She now has a store where she sells food items, school supplies and decorations, etc. Her business is in her home, which allows her to still care for her children and do the housework, therefore not neglecting her household responsibilities. Given the profitability of her store, Betzabeth has planned to increase the quantity of merchandise she offers in order to attract her neighbors and other customers. This is the seventh time she has an opportunity to access credit through MFP, given she has experience working with a team such as that in a cooperative bank, and she is very grateful for this. The funds that she is currently requesting would be used to buy groceries with which to supply her store.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase her merchandise.

loans.name: Mekhriniso

texts.ru: Муминова Мехринисо проживает в районе Хамадони. Возраст, 41 год. Замужем, имеет 3 детей. Муж, занимается животноводством. Дети, учатся. Сама Мехринисо торгует более 5 лет. У нее собственный магазин, где она в основном продает продукты питания и другие нужные для хозяйства вещи. Кредит берет для увеличения товараоборота. Мехринисо хочет расширить свой бизнес. Она намерена на втором этаже своего магазина открыт интернет кафе.
texts.en:
Mekhriniso M. lives in the Hamadoni region. She is 41 years old. She is married and has three children. Her husband does animal husbandry. Her children study. Mekhriniso has been in sales for more than five years. She has own store where she mostly sells food and other home necessities. She is taking out a loan to increase sales. Mekhriniso wants to expand her business. She plans to open an internet cafe on the second floor of her store.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase sales

loans.name: Luzvi

texts.en:
Luzvi P. has spent her entire life on the island of Nocnocan in Talibon, Bohol. She is 26 years old. She was married in 1998 and is the mother of four children with ages ranging from 7 to 1.

Fish selling and a sari-sari store (general store) became Luzvi’s businesses because she earns enough income from it. The income is what she uses to feed and clothe her family.

Luzvi desires to obtain a loan of 7,000 PHP from Community Economic Ventures Inc. She will use the loan to buy more merchandise for her store and more fish to sell.

loans.use: To buy additional merchandise for her sari-sari store and more fish to sell

loans.name: Thileung

texts.en: Mrs. Thileung B. is 32 years old and a villager who lives in Kbal Chrouy village in Kandal province. She and her husband are fishermen who can earn a small income to support their family. With this business, they do not have enough money to support their family. Thus, Mrs. Thileung B. decided to ask for a loan to buy fishnets for fishing. With this loan, she hopes to increase her income to improve the family's living conditions. This couple has two children who attend the local school. Her husband is on the right in the picture.

loans.use: To buy fishnets

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda F. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 56 years old. Luzminda is married and has one adult child. To make a living, Luzminda owns & operates a business selling snacks like rice cake, puto, suman and other Filipino native snacks in the local community. Luzminda has been engaged in her business for over 15 years and earns approximately 4,450 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Luzminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luzminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. Luzminda is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Luzminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

location.town: Kiwalan, Iligan City, Lanao del Norte

loans.name: Mujeres Capactiadas 5 Group

texts.en:
Carmen is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres Capacitadas (Capable Women), and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients generally (many of whom recently emigrated to the Dominican Republic from Haiti).

Carmen’s group is located in the areas surrounding Puerto Plata on the north coast of the Dominican Republic, an area famous for its natural beauty and its tourism industry, where (outside of the all-inclusive resorts) running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home there in a simple structure with her longterm partner and their three children.

Carmen is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business running a small fried food stand by purchasing the necessary flour, meat and cooking oil.

Carmen will use the profits to invest in her home by continuing to change her wooden walls to concrete block and purchasing a sewing machine to make adjustments to her and her children's clothing. She thanks you all for your support.

loans.use: To buy more flour, meat and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This entrepreneur is 45 years old. He is married and has two children. He graduated from high school. 

He sells spare parts and has been working in this occupation for a long time. His shop is in the industrial zone and lots of people buy from him. 

He will use this loan to purchase spare parts for large vehicles and vans. As a result of this loan, his income will rise and he will gain a lot of customers.

loans.use: Purchase spare parts

loans.name: Mariya

texts.en:
Mariya is divorced with two grown daughters. She is an entrepreneur from Berdyansk where she sells men's footwear in one of the local marketplaces of her hometown. Mariya has been in this trade for 10 years. Currently, she has about 6,500 Grivnyas in working capital. Her net profit amounts to 2,000 Grivnyas a month.

Mariya is requesting a loan of 6,000 Grivnyas to reconstruct her vending facility and increase assorted merchandise for the summer season. She is hoping to buy seasonal inventory in bulk for further retail sale at reasonable prices. Mariya is known as a vendor of integrity and respect. Despite all financial challenges many Ukrainian entrepreneurs are facing these days, she has secured a good reputation among her customers and fellow businessmen.

loans.use: To reconstruct her vending kiosk and increase assorted merchandise

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam Al A. is a single woman from Deir el Balah in the Gaza Strip. Mariam is 35 years old and lives with her parents. Two years ago, her father had to retire due to illness, so Mariam decided to start her own business to cover the family's expenses. 

Mariam rented a small shop and started a supermarket in the neighborhood where she lives. The supermarket is doing very well, due to Mariam's good manners and neighbors who are willing to help her by buying from her small store.

Mariam came to FATEN and took a $1,000 loan to purchase additional goods. This will attract more customers and result in more returns.

In the photograph, Mariam stands in her store.

loans.use: Purchase goods for a supermarket

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina O. is from the village of Galas, Dipolog City. She is 32 years old. Paulina is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Paulina owns & operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Paulina is just starting this business.

In 2009, Paulina joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Paulina has successfully repaid a previous loan of 4,000.00 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to invest in expanding the business. Paulina is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used as start up capital for fresh and dried fish vending. This will be the 3rd loan taken out by Paulina from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.
About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To use as start up capital for fresh and dried fish vending.

loans.name: Mary

texts.es: Mary, de 39 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora, vive con su madre e hijo, en su casa que es propia.Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a las manualidades en corrospum (material micro poroso parecido al  plástico). Es experta en trazar y cortar siluetas didácticas, cada una muy distinta de las otras creaciones, y todos sus modelos los realiza sin ningún apoyo visual, solo deja volar su imaginación. Tiene convenios con algunas profesoras de escuelas y madres de familia, a quienes les vende sus trabajos. Recuerda como años atrás trabajaba sola, y  actualmente sus familiares la apoyan para lograr acabar con los pedidos pendientes, durante las fechas celebres. Se siente satisfecha con su trabajo, pues lo realiza en la tranquilidad de su casa, sin descuidar sus labores, aunque dice que lo más difícil fue abrirse mercado inicialmente. Para el futuro tiene pensado crecer empresarialmente y ampliar su negocio, para hacerse conocida en su zona y captar mayor cantidad de clientes.Este es su onceavo préstamo  con MFP, y sabe que le será de mucha utilidad para aumentar el capital de su negocio, por ello se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas oportunamente.Mary tiene planeado invertir el dinero solicitado en la  compra de corrospum, al por mayor,  de diversos colores, además de plumones acrílicos y pegamentos, que necesita para los acabados de sus materiales didácticos.
texts.en:
Mary is 39 years old. She is a hardworking woman who lives with her mother and son in her own home. For 10 years, she has been working in handicrafts made of corrospum (a micro-porous material similar to plastic). She is an expert in tracing and cutting didactic shapes, each one different from other creations. She makes all of her models without any visual aid; she just lets her imagination go. She has contracts with some school teachers and mothers, to whom she sells her work. She remembers how years ago she worked alone and now her relatives help her to be able to finish her orders around holidays. She feels satisfied with her work because she does it in the calm of her own home without neglecting her housework- although she says it was more difficult to get a client base at first. For the future she plans to grow commercially and expand her business so that she becomes known in the area and can attract more customers. This is the eleventh loan with MFP and she knows it will be very useful to increase her business' capital. She is committed to making all of her payments on time. Mary plans on investing the money she has asked for in buying corrospum wholesale in different colors, in addition to acrylic feathers and glue, which she needs to finish her didactic material.

Translated from Spanish by Ellen Donohue, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy materials to continue her business.

loans.name: Blanca Judith

texts.es:
Blanca Judith de 31 años de edad es soltera, habita en el barrio linda Vista de Nueva Guinea,  labora como docente desde hace 12 años en el turno matutino y los fines de semana trabaja en un colegio de computación brindando el servicio de docente. 

Esta solicitando su  9no  credito con el objetivo de repellar  una habitacion y comprar zinc y de esta manera mejorar sus condiciones de vida.  

Expresa sentirse muy agradecida con AFODENIC por el apoyo que se le ha brindado, pues gracias a los creditos concedidos ha podido ir mejorando su casa poco a poco.  El mayor sueño que tiene es poder su casita con las condiciones necesarias para vivir comodamente.
texts.en:
Blanca Judith is 31 years old and single. She lives in the scenic neighborhood of Vista de Nueva Guinea. For the past 12 years, she has worked as a teacher during the morning shift. On weekends, she works in a mathematics school providing teaching services. She is requesting her 9th loan with the goal of plastering a room in her home and buying corrugated metal sheets, which will help improve her standard of living. She reports that she feels very grateful to AFODENIC for the support provided to her, since thanks to the loans offered to her, she has been able to improve her home little by little. Her greatest dream is to equip her little house with the necessary conditions so that she can live comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Patricia Linderman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plastering a room and buying metal sheets.

loans.name: Star Eagle Development-Lugazi Group

texts.en: Three years operating a retail shop is a relatively short period of time, but 30 year old K. Farouk is enjoying every minute of it, given the good profit spells she has been enjoying in that period. This business got off its feet with the assistance of a close friend who talked him out of the idea of only banking on profits from farming. This happy faced married father of 1 makes 100,000 shillings in weekly profits. With this loan, he wants to buy an array of retail items such as sugar and maize flour in bulk to resell in his shop.

loans.use: To purchase an array of retail items such as sugar and maize flour for resale.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en: Joice S. is currently in the business of selling beans, rice and tomatoes at the market and is requesting a loan to stock bags of maize flour and onions to sell.  Joice is 40 years old and is married to a peasant. She has eight children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a proper shop for keeping her goods saved from rains.

loans.use: Stock bags of maize flour and onions to sell

loans.name: Bdec Hec Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the B.D.E.C Home Economics school in Makeni. B.D.E.C Home Economics was established in 1978 to help fight gender disparity. The school is staffed with thirteen teachers and children between the classes of five and six from all primary schools in Makeni attend the school on alternate days of the week. 

These hardworking and dedicated teachers have come to SMT, to seek a loan of SLL 3,000,000. This is not the first SMT loan that these teachers have benefited from: previous loans have made a lot of improvements in the lives of these borrowers. 

Helen F. (pictured second from the right) is the headmistresses and leader of this group of teachers. She is age forty-nine and has been in the teaching profession for twenty-four years now. She is married to a lecturer and they have four children, all of whom are in college. With the help of this loan, Helen and her colleague teachers will be able to pay school and college fees for their children.

Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo.

loans.use: To pay college fees for her children

loans.name: Surayo

texts.ru: Мамажанова Сурайё проживает в районе Джиликул. Возраст, 33 года. Замужем, имеет 5 детей. Образование среднее. Более 17 лет занимается растениеводством. Она в основном сеет пшеницу и рис. Кредит берет для закупа минеральных удобрений.
texts.en:
Surayo M. lives in Jilikul. She is 33 years old, married, and has five children. She has a high school education. She has been farming for more than seventeen years. She sows mainly wheat and rice. She is taking out a loan to buy mineral fertilizers.

Translated from Russian by Melissa Kniazeva, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buying mineral fertilizers

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah G. is from the village of Kinura, Kalilangan, Bukidnon. She is 34 years old. Leah is married and has five school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling clothing and shoe products in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately $250 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Leah joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. 

Leah is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. This will be her 2nd loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory and as working capital

loans.name: Laureano

texts.es:
Laureano tiene 55 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y a sus hijos en el sector Sialupe Baca del distrito de Lambayeque. Una zona situada aproximadamente a media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores. El cría ovejas y aves de corral en diversos ambientes situados cerca a su domicilio, los engorda y cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Esta actividad es su principal fuente ingreso por lo que trata de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

Laureano desea adquirir mas animales para ampliar su negocio y aumentar el número de ventas. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.

El es una persona tranquila y bastante emprendedora. Su mayor anhelo es seguir creciendo como empresario para mejorar gradualmente la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Laureano is 55 years old, he is married and he lives together with his wife and their children in the community of Sialupe Baca in the district of Lambayeque. It is a region located about half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

He raises livestock for a living. He has sheep and poultry in various corrals located near his home. He raises the livestock and when they have reached a certain level in their development he sells them to merchants who visit the region where he lives. This is his primary source of income and so he tries to do his very best.

Laureano wants to acquire more livestock to expand his business and see an increase in his ales.  He has requested a first time loan of Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 1200 nuevos soles to reach his goal. 

He is a very calm and entrepreneurial person. His goal is to keep growing as a small business owner and to improve the quality of life for his family.

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Pensamientos Group

texts.es:
Pensamientos es un grupo conformado por 13 mujeres quienes aparte de ser amas de casa son mujeres trabajadoras para salir adelante y ayudar a sus familias. Sus reuniones son muy divertidas ya que siempre se la pasan riendo y son muy unidas. La comunidad en donde viven se llama Santa C., Valle de Chalco, Estado de México. 

María de Lourdes O. S. de 39 años de edad es madre de tres hijas y uno más que viene en camino motivo por el cual está muy contenta ya que nacerá aproximadamente el 24 de Diciembre y será su regalo de navidad. Ella se dedica a la venta de postres como: gelatinas, flanes, etc., desde hace dos años ya que es una persona a la cual le gusta ganarse su propio dinero y poder ayudar en su hogar. El trato que le ofrece a la gente es muy amable y respetuoso, sus ventas son diario y sale desde muy temprano ya que es cuando hay más ventas, ofrece con los vecinos y en ocasiones a la escuela donde asisten sus hijas. Durante su tiempo libre también se dedica al bordado de servilletas, manteles ya que hay gente que le hace pedidos para fechas especiales como día de las madres, navidad, cumpleaños, etc.,  Con el crédito solicitado va a comprar: grenetina, leche, moldes, cucharas, etc., para poder surtir un pedido que tiene para el siguiente mes. Mari agradece el apoyo que recibe ya que si les es de gran ayuda. Sus planes son poder iniciar una nueva actividad como venta de ropa para el próximo año.

Las demás integrantes de Pensamientos son: 
María Elena Dámaso Jiménez (Venta de Cosméticos por Catalogo), 
María del Socorro R. S. (Refaccionaria), 
Raquel O. S. (Estética)
Reyna S. C. (Industria Bordadora), 
Norma Zenón M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres), 
María del Roció C. M. (Venta de Frutas y Legumbres)
Maricela C. Ramírez (Venta de Música), 
Concepción González C. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo)
Paulina Ramírez González (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo), 
Rose lía García Cuandòn (Venta de Videojuegos),
María Esther Pérez H. (Venta de Zapatos por Catalogo),
Sara Zenón M. (Venta de Ropa Interior por Catalogo)
texts.en:
“Thoughts” is a group made up of 13 women that, in addition to being housewives, are workingwomen that want to progress and help their families. Their meetings are very entertaining. They laugh a lot and are a very cohesive group. They live in a community called Santa C. in the Chalco Valley in the state of Mexico.
Maria is 39 years old. She is the mother of three daughters and has one on the way that will be born around the 24th of December and will be her Christmas present. For the past two years she has been selling deserts such as jellies and flans. She is a person that likes to earn her own money in order to help with the home. She is very respectful and friendly to her customers. She sells her products daily in the mornings, as that is when there are the most sales. She sells to her neighbors and sometimes at her children’s school. In her free time she embroiders napkins and tablecloths. There are people who request these items for special occasions such as Mother’s Day, Christmas, Birthdays, etc. With the loan that she is requesting she will buy gelatin, molds, spoons, etc. in order to prepare an order she has received for the coming month. Mari is appreciative of the support that she receives. It is a great help. Her plan is to start a new business, selling clothes, next year.
The other members of the group called “Thoughts” are Maria Elena (sells cosmetics from catalogues), Maria Socorro (repair shop), Raquel O. (cosmetician), Reyna (embroidery industry), Norma (sells fruits and vegetables), Marcela (sells music), Concepción (sells shoes from a catalogue), Rose (sells videogames), and Sara (sells underwear from a catalogue).

loans.use: They will buy cosmetics, perfumes, shoes, thread, napkins, earrings, etc.

location.town: Valle De Chalco Solidaridad  Estado De Mexico

loans.name: Hyginus

texts.en:
N. Hyginus is an individual client from Ibanda. He is 41 years old and married with four children, three of whom are in school.
Hyginus is a businessman who buys and sells cattle from Mahega. He is helped by casual laborers in order to manage his business. His customers are mostly people in his locality. From his sales, he is able to make 220,000 UGX as monthly profits. Before the cattle sales business, Hyginus used to sell bananas, and it is savings from his salary and business that he moved to his current business ten years ago. He is requesting a loan to purchase two cows and a plot of land. Hyginus is a hardworking man with the aim of growing his business further.

loans.use: To purchase two cows and a plot of land

loans.name: Rosario De Los Ángeles

texts.es: Rosario D. Los Ángeles C. D. C. D. 50 años D. edad, resiD. en el municipio D. Soyapango, en donD. vive junto a su esposo el cual es empleado D. una empresa privada y así mismo vive junto a dos hijos D. 10 y 11 años D. edad.  Rosario posee su propio negocio en el cual comercializa tostadas D. yuca y D. plátano, dulces, galletas, agua, jugos, popcorn y otros más. Su negocio esta ubicado frente a una D. las iglesias más grandes D. San Salvador y la cual posee mayor cantidad D. feligreses, por lo que sus ventas son bastante estables. Rosario solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda surtir sus productos comprando mayor cantidad D. estos y D. esta forma atender a más clientes, los cuales en su mayoría conocen  muy bien a Rosario y son muy fieles con ella.
texts.en:
Rosario D. Los Ángeles C. D. C., age 50, resides in the town of Soyapango. She lives with her husband, who is employed at a private company, and their two children (ages 10 and 11). Rosario has a business selling cassava and plantain chips, candy, cookies, water, juices, popcorn, and other items. Her business is located in front of one of the largest churches in San Salvador. Since there are many parishioners who come here, her sales are quite stable.

Rosario is requesting a loan so that she can buy a large quantity of products in order serve more customers. They know her very well and are very loyal to her.

loans.use: Purchase juices, cookies, and candy to sell

loans.name: Juana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Juana es una señora avanzada de edad, hoy en día es pensionada de su trabajo que desempeño como maestra todos estos años. Cuenta con el apoyo económico de sus hijos también.

Su objetivo todos estos años ha sido el mejoramiento de su vivienda que ha venido mejorando durante estos once ciclos en Afodenic atreves de sus préstamos. Con este nuevo financiamiento terminara de levantar paredes ya que tiene gran parte avanzada lo que comprara materiales de construcción para seguir la construcción de la obra.
texts.en:
Juana is a lady who is advanced in years.  She receives a pension from her former job as a teacher, a job which she carried out for many years.  She also has financial support from her children.

Juana's goal all these years has been to improve her home and she has been doing this through eleven loan cycles with Afodenic.  She will use this new loan to finish building some walls since she is a long way into the work.  She will buy building materials to continue with her building job.

loans.use: To buy building materials to continue building walls in her home

loans.name: Mrs. Thoeun Rang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nine people living in Tuol Sang Kha village in Takeo province.  The group has selected Mrs. Thoeun R. as the village bank president.  The members will use their portion of the loan for different purposes to improve their family living. 

Mrs. Thoeun R. is a farmer who owns a half-hectare plot of land to grow rice to sell to support her family. It is now time to grow rice, but she does  not have enough money to cultivate her crops.  Mrs. Thoeun R. is asking for a loan to do farming this current year. Her husband, Mr. Ean Nob, is a construction worker and farm laborer. 

This couple supports three children – two are attending public school while the youngest one is three years old.

loans.use: To farm rice

loans.name: Martha Irene

texts.es: Martha Irene tiene 48 años, ella se dedica es una comedor y bar pues con el tiempo es que ha logrado salir adelante y mejorar los ingresos de su hogar. Tiene más de 8 años en este negocio, la buena administración de su negocio y los clientes que siempre llegan a comprar los diferentes productos que ofrece.   Se levanta temprano todos los días para realizar sus labores del hogar y al mismo tiempo empezar a ofrecer sus servicios en su local. El financiamiento es para la compra de granos básicos, licor, frutas, verduras y carnes en general.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old and she is dedicated to her restaurant-bar.  Over time, Martha has forged ahead and improved her household income.  She has operated this business for more than eight years, due to her good administration and customers who always return to purchase the different products she offers.

Martha rises early every morning to carry out household chores and, at the same time, to begin to offer services at her stall.  The financing is for buying basic grains, liquor, fruit, vegetables and meat in general.

loans.use: BUYING FOOD AND BEVERAGE SUPPLIES FOR HER RESTAURANT-BAR

loans.name: Julio Venjamin

texts.es: Julio es un hombre trabajador y luchador que goza de tener a su esposa y 6 hijos pero 3 no viven con él. Su actividad es la venta de plantas, negocio que inicio hace 4 años por iniciativa propia ya que necesitaba un medio para generar ingresos a su hogar y mantener a sus hijos, a pesar de que su mayor desafío ha sido organizar su tiempo, pues tiene que atender el negocio y realizar ciertas tareas del hogar para ayudar a su esposa. Es por eso que solicita este crédito con el fin de comprar una gran variedad de plantas pues tiene ciertos encargos de clientes que le realizan.
texts.en: Julio is a hardworking and persistent man who enjoys having a wife and 6 children.  Three of his children do not live with him.  He has a business selling plants which he started 4 years ago on his own initiative, since he needed to have a means to generate income for his household and to support his children.  His main challenge has been to organize his time, since he has to attend to the business and carry out certain household tasks to help out his wife.  He requests a loan to use to buy a large variety of plants, as he has some orders from customers that he needs to fulfill.

loans.use: working capital - to buy plants

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: A. Mavjuda is 38 years old. She is a widow with three children. For more than six years, Mavjuda has run her own business. She has a small shop where she sells and rents traditional wedding dresses and national wedding dresses. Traditionally families in Tajikistan are large; consequently, there are lots of marriages and Mavjuda has a lot of clients. The stability of her business allows her to make a considerable contribution to her family’s income. Today Mavjuda requests $2000 which she is going to use to purchase more new wedding dresses. Mavjuda has earned a reputation for taking responsibility for her financial obligations and for keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International: Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history which includes its place as a key post along the Silk Road and events at the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has produced famous thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged an already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural productivity and the manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent viable business prospects. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj.

loans.use: To purchase new wedding dresses

loans.name: Virgen Del Rosario Group

texts.es: El Grupo Solidario esta conformado por 4 integrantes 2 varones y dos mujeres, El  representante del grupo es la Sra. Bertha, las Sras. Viven en la localidad D. Colomi  a unos 45 minutos D. Sacaba sus puestos D. venta son céntricos, la Sra. Bertha se dedica a la venta D. chicharrón, es un plato elaborado con carne D. cerdo muy típico D. la ciudad D. Cochabamba, con el dinero del crédito la Sra. Bertha comprara Carne para la elaboración D. su rico Chicharrón,  es un grupo D. amigos se conocen  D.  hace muchos años, son muy conocidos en la zona   por ser personas muy responsables y trabajadoras, el préstamo lo destinaran para su mercadería y aumentar capital .
texts.en:
This Solidarity Group is composed of 4 members, 2 men and 2 women.  The representative of the group is Bertha.  The members live in the locality of Colomi, some 4 minutes from Sacaba.  Their sales stalls are centrally located.

Bertha sells pork cracklings, a pork-meat plate very typical of the city of Cochabamba.  With the loan, Bertha will buy meat to make her rich pork cracklings.  This is a group of friends who have known each other for many years and are well known in this zone as very responsible and hard-working people.

The loan is intended for buying merchandise and augmenting capital.

loans.use: BUYING PORK TO MAKE PORK CRACKLINGS TO SELL

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
Eduardo is 58 years old, single and has an adult son. He lives with his elderly mother in the district of Pacora, a rural area, and has recently acquired access to electricity and drinking water. His community is small with approximately 200 families. Eduardo earns a living providing show repair services. His business is situated within his house. He has more than 20 years of experience in this trade, which he learned from his father, meaning he knows it perfectly. He is very well-known in the area and has an established clientele. He has continued to invest in his business, which has shown continual growth over the years. 

Eduardo has requested a loan of 1,500 PEN to invest in the purchase of materials and equipment that he uses to repair shoes. He would also like to use a part of his credit to make some repairs to the floors, walls and door in the part of his house where he attends to clients. With this investment, he can provide a more professional service to his customers. Eduardo has very good personal and work references. He is a hard-worker and responsible. He has managed other loans from Edpyme Alternativa in the past and has paid punctually. His greatest wish is to continue earning a respectable income so that he can continue caring for his elderly mother.

loans.use: to purchase materials for use in his shoe repair business

loans.name: Ma. Shella

texts.en:
Ma. Shella works hard to support her family. Ma. Shella is married and has a firewood sales business in the Philippines.

Ma. Shella is borrowing PHP 1,500  through NWTF to buy an ENVIROFIT COOKSTOVE.

She is getting the Envirofit cookstove because she wants to make the firewood that she buys last longer because the Envirofit stove needs less fuel to cook food.

Ma. Shella is aware that by using the Envirofit cookstove,she is saving money, helping the environment, and reducing health and hazard risks to her family.

loans.use: To buy an Envirofit cookstove.

loans.name: Silvestre

texts.es:
En el estado de Oaxaca existe una comunidad llamada San Miguel Soyaltepec esta comunidad tiene una laguna muy grande que da mucha pesca y trabajo cada año, tambien es conocida porque ahi se ubica la presa hidroelectrica Cerro de Oro.En esta comunidad vive el señor Silvestre S., el tiene la edad de 32 años, estudio hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, esta casado y tiene 3 hijos los cuales asiten a la escuela en la cominidad.

Don Silvestre nos dice " yo siempre he trabajado pero la situacion economica cada dia es mas dificil y ningun dinero alcanza y menos cuando se tiene hijos en la escuela, yo platique con mi esposa y decidimos que cuando saliera del trabajo venderia ropa de dama y caballero para ayudarnos un poco mas con los gastos del hogar  y la escuela de mis hijos", Don Silvestre tiene un poco mas de dos años vendiendo ropa y nos platica que la vende en la comunidad con sus amigos y vecinos, nos dice que al principio fue dificil hacer clientes pero ahora ya la gente lo conose y en algunas ocasiones va a su casa a buscar una blusa o un short para regalar en las fiesta. el necesita esta este credito para invertirlo en la compra de blusas, faldas, short,ropa interior,pantalones, playeras, calcetines y vestidos para venderlos posteriormente.

el espera que con esta invesion su negocio cresca y deje buenas ganancias ya que desea que sus hijos tengan una mejor calidad de vida y estudien una profesion en un futuro, tambien manda muchos saludos en agradeciemiento a la fundacion por el apoyo que le da al brindarle el prestamo
texts.en:
There is a community in the state of Oaxaca called San Miguel Soyaltepec.   It has a very large lagoon that produces a lot of fish and work every year.  It is also known because the Cerro de Oro Hydroelectric Dam is located there.  Mr. Silvestre Sánchez, 32, lives in this community.  He studied up to 9th grade.  He’s married and has three children who attend the local school in the community.

Silvestre tells us: “I have always worked but the economic situation is more and more difficult every day and money is never enough especially when one has children in school.  I talked to my wife and we decided that I’d sell women’s and men’s clothes when I got off work in order to help ourselves out a bit more with household expenses and my children’s schooling.” 

Silvestre has been selling clothes for a little more than two years and he tells us that he sells them among his friends and neighbors in the community.  He says that it was difficult to acquire customers at first but now people know him and sometimes even come by his house looking for a blouse or a pair of shorts to give as presents at parties.  He needs this loan to invest in the purchase of blouses, skirts, shorts, underwear, pants, 
t-shirts, socks and dresses to sell later.

He hopes that with this investment his business will grow and produce good profits because he wants his children to have a better quality of life and study a profession in the future.  He also sends many greetings and thanks to the Fundación for the support it’s given him in granting the loan.

loans.use: to buy women's and men's clothes.

loans.name: Alindor

texts.es:
Alindor es un hombre soltero de 56 años de edad, vive en casa de unos familiares, la cual  es propia y cuenta con todos los servicio ( agua, luz y desagüe) en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortíz, que pertenece a la provincia de Chiclayo.  Los pobladores de éste distrito se dedican al comercio y la mayoría son conductores de transporte público.

Alindor  maneja su mototaxi (transporte que se utiliza para movilizarse en distancias cortas, con un cupo máximo de 3 personas), esta actividad lo realiza en el mismo distrito donde vive, especialmente en la zona del mercado que es donde hay mayor demanda de clientela y con los ingresos que obtenga puede solventar todas sus necesidades.

El crédito que ha solicitado a Edpyme Alternativa es de 500 nuevos soles y su destino será darle mantenimiento a su mototaxi, para poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes que dejará mejores ingresos, para mejorar  la calidad de vida de él y seguir ayudando a los familiares con los que vive. Alindor es un hombre muy  conocido  por ser trabajador, responsable que a punta de esfuerzo y empeño a sabido salir adelante.
texts.en:
Alindor is a single, 56 year old man. He lives in house owned by relatives that has all utilities (running water, electricity and sewer) in the district of  José Leonardo Ortíz that belongs to the province of Chiclayo. The inhabitants of this district work as merchants and many are public transportation drivers.  

Alindor drives his motorcycle taxi (a mode of transportation that is used for short distance travel, with a 3 passenger maximum). He does this activity in the district where he lives, especially in the market area where there is a higher demand. With the income he makes, he is able to pay for all of his needs.

The loan he has asked Edpyme Alternativa for is for 500 nuevos soles, and it will be used to do maintenance on his motorcyle taxi in order to offer his customers a better service. This will improve his quality of life and enable him to keep helping the relatives he lives with. Alindor is man who is known to be a hard worker and responsible n his efforts. He knows how to get ahead.

loans.use: to do maintenance on his motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Cometas Group

texts.es:
Las cometas es un grupo al norte de la ciudad de Monterrey,  está compuesto por 8 señoras que tienen siempre un propósito para sobresalir, les gusta el nombre Cometas porque siempre  miran hacia arriba.

Entre ellas tenemos el ejemplo de la Sra. Ma Juana con 64 años de vida, viuda, con tres hijos de 28, 30 y 32 años los cuales son su orgullo por los buenos valores que les enseñó. Ma Juana saco adelante a sus hijos planchando y cosiendo (sewing). Oficios que a ido mejorando día a día; ahora ella tiene un pequeño taller donde maquila blusas. 

Con su préstamo planea seguir mejorando su taller ya que siempre lucha por lo que quiere y nunca se da por vencida.
texts.en:
“Las Cometas” (The Comets) is a group in the north of the city of Monterrey; it has 8 members whose purpose is to always excel.  They like the name ‘Cometas’ because they always are looking upwards.

Among them we have the example of María Juana, 64.  She’s a widow with three children who are 28, 30 and 32 years of age who are her pride for the good values she taught them.  María Juana raised her children taking in ironing and sewing, occupations that she’s improved daily.  Now, she has a small workshop where she assembles blouses. 

She plans to use the loan to continue improving her workshop because she always fights for what she wants and never gives up.

loans.use: to remodel her workspace and buy new sewing machines.

loans.name: Celerino

texts.en:
Celerina is 61 years old and married with seven children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase items like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items to sell.

She has borrowed and repaid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running her store for 3 years and also earns an income from E-loading.  Celerina aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase items like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other miscellaneous items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This borrower is 38 years old.  She is married, and has 3 children aged 14,10 and 7 years. She has 4 additional dependents - her mother and three nephews of her husband.  In 2000, she established her plastic shoes business. She began her business because she inherited it along with her business skill, and to be independent. Working 7 days a week and 11 hours a day, she earns about 900,000 SLL (~$208) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of 4,000,000 SLL. She requires a loan in order to buy more plastic slippers. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately 300,000 SLL (~$70). 

In the future, she plans to own a bigger shop and build a house. She wants to become an international businesswoman. The persistent increase in the general price level is her major challenge.  She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more plastic slippers.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 54 años de edad y es casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende chompas, pantalones, polos, camisas y casacas, ella vende en forma independiente, por medio de este pequeño la socia  saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar polos, pantalones, chompas y camisas al por mayor.
                                                                                                                
                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This woman is a member of the Mujeres Emprendedoras Community Bank which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

She is 54 years old, married, and has five children. As well as doing all her household tasks, she has a business selling clothing such as sweaters, pants, t-shirts, shirts, and jackets. She runs her business independently and through it she manages to help her children get ahead. She is seeking a loan to expand her clothing business and buy t-shirts, pants, sweaters, and shirts at wholesale prices.

She is happy to get a loan and promises to pay it back.

loans.use: to buy t-shirts, pants, sweaters, and shirts at wholesale prices

loans.name: Mchekondo

texts.en:
Mchekondo is a widow with three children. All her children graduated from school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Mchekondo has operated a vegetable stall for four years, selling at the market to her neighbors and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her business. She dreams of becoming a wholesale supplier of vegetables in the future.

With the KSHS 60,000, she wants to purchase bundles of vegetables for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of vegetables to sell

loans.name: Ángel Oswaldo

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 26 años vive en Ambato con su hijo que tiene 2 años 4 meses, es separado, se considera una persona amable, trabajadora y tranquila.

Trabaja solo en la crianza de cuyes para mejorar la raza, es la primera vez que trabaja con FODEMI y el préstamo que ha solicitado es para la compra de mas cuyes y lograr mejorar la raza y tener más clientela y con esto mejorar su calidad de vida juno a su hijo; Su sueño es seguir trabajando con FODEMI para poder tener un galpón de cuyes propio.
texts.en:
Ángel, 26, lives in Ambato with his son who is 2 years and four months old; he’s separated.  He considers himself to be a kind, hardworking, calm person.

He works alone raising guinea pigs to improve the breed.  This is the first time he’s worked with FODEMI and the loan he’s requested is to buy more guinea pigs to improve the breed and have more customers to improve his and his son’s quality of life.  His dream is to continue working with FODEMI to eventually to have a guinea pig shed of his own.

loans.use: to buy guinea pigs.

loans.name: Hope To God Ii Group

texts.en:
Mahawa is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Mahawa was born in Kono city, 29 years ago. She is married to a trader and the couple has two children, one of whom is attending primary school. Mahawa sells food items like milk, sugar, flour, etc.

With the help of this loan, Mahawa and her group members will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Mahawa will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy the above-mentioned items in bulk to add to her business inventory.

loans.use: to buy items like milk, sugar, flour, etc. in bulk.

loans.name: Juanita Candelaria

texts.es: Juanita Candelaria tiene 60 años, ella es una mujer que no se deja abatir por las circunstancias. Ella tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad. Ella se dedica a brindar los servicios fúnebres, ella empezó el negocio siguiendo los pasos de su mama ya que anteriormente era su Mama quien tenía el negocio, fue con el paso del tiempo que Juanita se hizo cargo de esta actividad. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de candelas, cortinas, crucifijos, flores, entre otros. A pesar de tener esta edad es una persona muy activa y que brinda los mejores servicios.
texts.en:
Juanita Candelaria, age 60, is a woman who does not let circumstances overwhelm her. She has two grown children. Juanita provides funeral services. She started in this business by following in her mother’s footsteps. Her mother previously owned this business and then as time passed Juanita took charge of it.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy candles, curtains, crucifixes, flowers, and other items. Despite her age, Juana remains a very active person so that she can provide the best service.

loans.use: to buy candles, curtains, crucifixes, flowers, and other items for providing funeral services.

loans.name: Eric Lester

texts.en:
Eric is still single, but he works hard to help his parents meet their needs. Eric’s goal in life is to have a stable source of income before he gets married. Eric runs a hog raising business. He also operates a tricycle for passenger transportation to make additional income. 

Eric had difficulties in buying feed for the maintenance of his pigs. His daily earnings from the tricycle business could not buy his pigs feed. For this reason, he decided to request a loan of 30,000 Philippine pesos to buy feed for his hogs. He is hoping for the growth of his business in order to support his parents and have savings for his future.

loans.use: to buy feed for the maintenance of his hogs.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is a 35-year-old married woman with 7 children. The oldest child is 17 years old. Her husband works as a farmer and a baker.

Marilyn has been in the business of rice farming for quite some time now. She earns about 8000 PHP per month doing this type of farming. Marilyn works hard to ensure that her family eats 3 times a day and to send her children to school. She has requested this loan to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and other farm inputs. Marilyn hopes that her family’s living situation will improve.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon is 43 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is widowed with 2 children. 

Corazon has a retail shop that sells bananas, food seasoning, noodles and salt per packs.  She has had this business for 10 years and requests a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy noodles, salt, foods seasonings and bananas for sell.

Corazon is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, she hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy noodles, salt, foods seasonings & bananas for sell.

loans.name: Zainabu
