His advantage is that he’s a very friendly person so his workshop is very well attended by neighbors.  One of the difficulties he faces, however, is that he doesn’t have any other source of income and sometimes he only has a few jobs to do.

He is asking for funding to buy more work tools so that he can provide better customer service.  His dream is to expand his business offering his customers a variety of vehicle replacement parts so that his income will be greater thus providing his family with better quality of life.

He has been in FAMA for several cycles and has been very responsible with his payments.

loans.use: To buy hand tools.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El Sr. Miguel tiene la  edad de 26 años vive en la Localidad  de el  Torno,  Barrio Naciones Unidas vive en la zona hace 20 años el señor oriundo de  Santa Cruz Andrés Ibáñez. Su Actividad es la venta de medicina natural hace 12 años actualmente trabaja en el Torno, su estado civil soltero  cuentan actualmente con 1 hijo a su cargo,  el señor vive en la casa de su madre la Sra. Zenobia   que también se dedica a al venta  de medicina natural, el Sr. miguel solicito el crédito para aumentar capital de trabajo en compra de frascos y sobres para etiquetar y llenar el producto.  Al mismo tiempo ellos están agradecidos con nuestra entidad por apoyarlos y depositarles la confianza para adquirir su crédito.
texts.en:
Miguel, 26, has lived in El Torno’s Naciones Unidas neighborhood for 20 years.  He is from Andrés Ibáñez province, Santa Cruz department.

He has sold natural remedies for 12 years; he currently works in El Torno.  He is single and has a son in his care.  He lives in his mother, Zenobia’s, house who also sells natural remedies.

Miguel requested the loan to increase his working capital to buy jars and envelopes to label and fill with product.

They are grateful with our entity for supporting them and trusting them enough to grant the loan.

loans.use: To buy jars and envelopes.

loans.name: Bokoli Plus Group

texts.en:
Mado T., is the President of the Community Bank named “Bokoli Plus” which is composed of 17 micro-entrepreneurs. These members are united for the same goal: to grow their businesses with loans received from Kiva through IMF HOPE RDC. 

Mado is 43 years old; her activity is to sell soft drinks. She buys crates of soft drinks and resells them by the piece at a profit. She sells her products daily in her area.

Mado started her business in 2000. She is a trustworthy client of the MFI HOPE RDC, having ten times obtained and correctly repaid loans. Her next loan will allow her to buy crates of soft drinks and women’s clothing in larger quantities to increase her sales in order to make a better profit. 

Mado makes a profit of about US$13 per day. The aims of this loan are mainly to generate income for food and school fees for her children. She is married and the mother of four children. She also is responsible for nine others (children and grandchildren).

loans.use: buying crates of soft drinks and women’s clothing in large quantities

loans.name: Santa Rosita Group

texts.es:
Margarita G. C., 40 años D. edad, viuda, 2 hijos, socia del grupo comunal "Santa Rosita" (En la foto Margarita es la cuarta señora D. la izquierda, viste D. pantalon negro y un mandil color blanco).
Margarita pertenece al comedor popular en el Asentamiento Humano Juan Parra del Riego en El Tambo, y este comedor funciona en su domicilio que ella misma atienD., cocinando y sirviendo a los comensales y cuenta con ayuda D. su mamà. Luego D. esta actividad que termina por las tardes, Margarita a partir D. las 4pm se dedica a la venta D. "anticuchos" en la puerta D. su casa. 
La tensiòn D. estos dos trabajos hacen que Margarita siempre este agitaba y con dolores D. cabeza; pues ella es consiente que debe cumplir con estas obligaciones; puesto que ella es papà y mamà para sus hijos.
Margarita quedò viuda cuando sus hijos eran aùn muy pequeños, y tuvo que desempeñar màs D. un trabajo a la vez; hasta que tuvo la decisiòn D. generar sus propios ingresos con la venta D. comida en su hogar. 
La idea D. atender las 2 jornadas D. trabajo en su casa, fue a raìz D. que uno D. sus hijos tenìa problemas D. aprendizaje en la escuela; pues con los anteriores trabajos que Margarita desempeñaba la ausentaban D. casa por casi todo el dìa. Hoy en dìa Margarita està con sus hijos el mayor tiempo posible, para apoyarlos con sus tareas, para atenderlos y alimentarlos.
El prèstamo serà para aumento D. capital D. trabajo.
texts.en:
Margarita G. C., 40 years old, widowed, with two children, is a member of the community group "Santa Rosita" (in the picture Margarita is the fourth lady on the left, dressed in black pants and a white apron).
Margarita belongs to the soup kitchen in the settlement Juan Parra del Riego in El Tambo. She runs this kitchen at home and she takes care of it herself, cooking and serving the guests with the help of her mother. After closing the kitchen in the afternoon, she sells brochettes from the door of her house.  The stress of running two activities makes that Margarita is always nervous and suffers of headache, as she is aware that this is her obbligation as single parent. 
Margarita lost the father of her children when they were still very young, and had to have more than one job at a time, until she decided to create her own business to sell food at home.
The idea of having these two activities at home came when one of her children had learning problems at school, because with her previous jobs she was not at home almost the entire day.  Today Margarita can spend a lot ot time with her children, she can help them with their homeworks, take care of them and prepare their meals. She requests this loan to increase her operating funds.

loans.use: Operating funds

loans.name: El Sol De Cupiche Group

texts.es:
L. alcancía comunal “El Sol D. Cupiche” consta D. 10 integrantes y el nombre D. esta alcancía se debe al barrio donD. viven todos ellos (Cupiche).
Yolanda es una integrante D. esta alcancía es L.  mayor del grupo, tiene 50 años D. edad. ElL. se dedica a vender en L.  pequeña bodega que tiene en su casa productos como: leche, arroz, pollo, verduras, dulces y gaseosas. Lleva tres años en este negocio. El préstamo solicitado a EDAPROSPO lo invertirá en comprar más mercadería para su pequeña bodega, especialmente leche, vino y tortas para venderlos aprovechando L. campaña naviD.ña. Tiene planes D. vender lo necesario para L. cena naviD.ña.
texts.en:
The “El Sol D. Cupiche” (Cupiche’s Sun) communal bank has 10 members.   The name of the bank comes from the neighborhood all the members live in: Cupiche.

Yolanda is one of the members of this communal bank.  She is the oldest, she’s 50 years old.  She has a small grocery store in her house where she sells such products as: milk, rice, chicken, vegetables, candy and soft drinks.  She’s been in business for three years.

She will use the loan she requested from EDAPROSPO to buy merchandise for her small store especially milk, wine and cakes to sell taking advantage of the Christmas season.  Her plan is to sell everything needed for Christmas dinner.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her store.

loans.name: María Magdalena

texts.es: María Magdalena C. F. de 47 años de edad, reside en el municipio de Puerto el Triunfo en el departamento de Usulután. Ella es madre soltera de una hija de 14 años de edad, quien se dedica a estudiar. María es una persona muy esforzada quien se dedica a atender una tienda en la cual comercializa productos de primera necesidad y así mismo de uso domésticos, entre los cuales están: especias, carne de pollo y de res. Su negocio está ubicado en su casa de habitación lo cual es muy bueno para ella debido a que se encuentra en una zona muy populosa en donde no hay otra tienda en los alrededores, por lo que sus ventas diarias son muy aceptables. María con el deseo de ver en mejores condiciones su hogar, solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar: huevos, carne de res y de pollo, entre otros más los cuales le permitan brindar un mejor servicio y de esta forma contar con más ganancias.
texts.en: María Magdalena C. F., 47, lives in Puerto el Triunfo, Usulután Department.  She is the single mother of a daughter, 14, who is in school.  María is a hard-working person taking care of her shop where she sells household and domestic products such as spices, chicken, and beef.  Her business is located in her home, which works well for her because she is in a populous area with no other shops nearby, making her daily sales quite acceptable.  María, wanting to see her household situation improved, is requesting a loan in order to purchase eggs, beef, and chicken among other things, allowing her to provide better service and providing greater profits.

loans.use: Purchase of chicken and beef for sale

location.town: Puerto el Triunfo, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol D. is from the village of Malipayon, Pangantucan, Bukidnon. She is 35 years old, married and has 2 school-aged children. Mirasol owns and operates a specialized retail store, buying and selling seafood products, including milkfish and salmon, in the local community. Mirasol has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month from it.

In 2008, Mirasol joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mirasol has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from HSPFI, which was used to to purchase additional inventory and increase working capital. Mirasol is requesting a new loan of 23,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish, such as mackerel and sardines. This will be the 6th loan taken out by Mirasol from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase mackerel and sardines

loans.name: Teodora

texts.es: Teodora, de 60 años, es una mujer responsable y muy amorosa. Hace algún tiempo se separó de su esposo con el que tiene un hijo; que junto a su nieta viven en su casa propia ubicada en Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Todas las mañanas, desde las primeras horas del día, los pobladores de su localidad salen a comprar los alimentos que expende en su bodega, negocio que acondicionó en su casa desde hace algunos años. Pero la actividad que más disfruta Teodora, es la agricultura, siendo sus principales cultivos el café y el plátano. Ya tiene 40 años dedicándose a ello, y según afirma es una buena terapia, “descanso en la tranquilidad del campo”, afirma. Sus planes son adquirir sus propios terrenos de cultivo, para poder minimizar los gastos de alquiler. Ella pertenece al banco comunal “Prestarios de la Unión”, y este es el primer crédito que tiene con MFP, donde está segura saldrá adelante. Teodora cada semana surte su tienda de comestibles, por ello con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprar sacos de azúcar, arroz, fideos y demás productos comestibles para vender en su localidad.
texts.en: Teodora, at 60 years of age, is a responsible and loving woman.  For some time she has been separated from her husband with whom she had a son.  Along with her granddaughter they live in their own house located in Unión Palomar (Peruvian central forest).  Every morning, from the first hours of the day, the people of their leave to buy food that she offers in her store; a business that she has run from her home for several years. But the activity that Teodora enjoys most is agriculture, with coffee and bananas being her main crops.  She has already been dedicated to this for 40 years and affirms that it is good therapy. "Rest in the tranquility of the field", she says.  Her plans are to acquire her own lands for cultivation, to be able to minimize the expenses of rent.  She belongs to the “Prestarios de la Unión” communal bank and this is the first loan that she has had with MFP, where she is sure she will do well.  Teodora supplies her store with food each week.  With the loan that she requests she plans to buy bags of sugar, rice, noodles and other edible products to sell in her location.

loans.use: To buy products such as rice, sugar, and noodles to supply her convenience store

loans.name: Fatou

texts.fr: Madame Fatou S. est âgée  de 63 ans. Elle habite à Baye Laye. Elle est mariée et s’active dans le commerce depuis plus de 5 ans. Elle a démarré par la  vente d’huile de palme mais actuellement elle commercialise l’encens. Par soucis de ne pas rester inactive elle a choisi cette activité qui pourra lui générer des revenus. Elle  est mère de famille et a  à sa charge des orphelins. La vente de thiouraye lui procure beaucoup de bénéfices surtout en période de froid. Elle est sociétaire de la caisse de Baye Laye depuis aout 2000 et sollicite un crédit de 250 000 frs. Son intention est de se procurer de l’encens avec l’intégralité de la somme financée  en vue de renforcer son stock et aussi de mieux développer son commerce. Madame S. souhaite accroitre ses revenus, renforcer son épargne pour mieux entretenir sa famille. Ses financements lui permettent d’éviter la dépendance financière.
texts.en:
Mrs Fatou S. is 63 years old.
She lives in Baye Laye. 
She is married and has been in retail trade for more than 5 years. 
She started by the sale of palm oil but currently she markets incense. 
She decided to remain active and chose this activity which will be able to generate income. 
She is a mother and cares for orphans. 
The sale of thiouraye (an aromatic herbal based incense oil) especially gets her many benefit in periods of cold.
She is member of the credit unioon of Baye Laye since August 2000 and requests a credit of 250.000 frs. 
The intent is to get incense with the entirety of the sum financed in order to increase her stock and also to better develop her trade.
 Mrs S. wishes to increase her income, to reinforce her saving for better maintaining her family. 
Her financings will enable her to avoid financial dependence.

loans.use: augmentation fond

loans.name: Marling Ivette

texts.es: La señora Marling Ivette, tiene 31 años, es madre de un hijo, de 7 años que está a su cargo. Marling tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos, Este negocio empezó hace 2 años con muy poco capital  de trabajo, como una búsqueda de fuente de ingresos alternativos. Ella empezó vendiendo muy pocos cosméticos, después fue que empezó a invertir un poco más,  El crédito será invertido en la compra de lápiz labial, brillo, estuches de sombra y estuches de vanidad. Por lo que se acerca la época de verano y la señora desea invertir y comprar ahora que están un poco bajos los precios. Su meta es llegar a tener un una tienda de artículos variados que pueda estar ubicada en el mercado, que brinde las facilidades económicas a ella y a su hijo.
texts.en:
Sra. Marling Ivette is 31 years old and the mother of a seven year old child in her care. She has been selling cosmetics for two years and started her business with very little operating capital. At the time, she was looking for an alternative source of income. After she started selling a few cosmetics, she invested a little bit more.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of lipsticks, lip gloss, eye shadows, and vanity cases. As the summer season approaches, Sra. Marling wants to invest and buy now while the prices are low. Her goal is to open a variety store in the market that can generate financial income for herself and her son.

loans.use: Operating capital to buy lipsticks, lip gloss, eye shadows, and vanity cases

loans.name: Rosa Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” COMUZONE III”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Rosa Victoria; la socia tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera; la socia estudio la carrera de zootecnista (estudio de animales), ella desea ahora poder acceder a un curso de diplomado llamado SNIFF, espera poder encontrar un mejor trabajo para poder dar a conocer todos su conocimientos más adelante, la socia es una persona bien alegre, responsable y con muchas ganas de seguir adelante por ella misma.

La socia solicita el préstamo para  poder pagar el curso de diplomado.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the communal bank "Comuzone III", located in the Cusco district, which is part of the province of Cusco, department of Cusco.

Señora Rosa Victoria is 29 years old, single, and is studying zootechnics (the study of animals).  She now wishes to take a course to gain a special certification known as SNIFF.  She hopes to find a better job, so she can make use of all the knowledge she has gained.

She is a very happy person, responsible, and with a great desire to improve her self.  She is requesting the loan to pay for the certification course.

She is very pleased to be receiving the loan, and promises to make all her payments.

loans.use: to pay for a certification course.

loans.name: Florelita

texts.en:
Florelita is 59 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Florelita is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed, vitamins and piglets.

Florelita has been in this business for 15 years. Florelita also earns additional income from fish vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and piglets

loans.name: Priscillah Wambui

texts.en:
Priscillah has practised farming in Ndunyu Njeru town for the last 15 years. She is 48 years old, married to Stephen M.. and they have four children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD by her friend and this will be her second loan. She repaid for her previous loan of Kshs 14,000 well and in good time.  She plans to use the loan amount to buy seeds and fertilizer.

In future, Priscillah hopes to become a leading farmer in the Ndunyu Njeru area.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin W. is a licensed residential and commercial electrician.  Kevin inspects buildings for safety and regulation compliance, installs wiring for new construction, and repairs power outages due to on-site malfunction, in addition to installing and repairing solar panels and generators.  He started his business, Spark Electric, AC heating & Gas, in 2006.

Kevin’s first job as a teenager was in the construction industry, though he later took jobs in other fields.  After overcoming personal struggles, Kevin returned to construction to open his own business.  For Kevin, small business ownership is more than a living.  He says that his success as a small business owner has given him confidence in what he can achieve professionally.  He is proud to be an integral part in his local economy, and feels connected to his community.  Kevin is also the proud father of three daughters.

Kevin wants his business to be more competitive in winning subcontracted commissions from commercial contractors.  Currently, Kevin estimates that 25% of his revenues come from work done on large commercial jobs, a number he hopes to improve upon this year.  Because subcontractors must wait to be compensated until the general contractor is paid, it is essential that they be able to front all of the costs and materials for a job.  This loan from ACCION Texas-Louisiana helps Kevin meet upfront business costs, building his credibility with commercial contractors.  In addition, this loan helps Kevin build his business credit so that he can qualify for more financing in the future.

loans.use: to pay for materials and operating expenses and to build credit

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La Sra Bertha de 37 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pimampiro, es casada y tiene un hijo que estudia en el colegio. Su nivel de educación es secundario.

Bertha y su esposo se dedican a la agricultura especialmente al cultivo de mora. La producción es entregada a una fábrica que se llama ‘Jugo Fácil’. Los recursos económicos generados a través de esta actividad agrícola, ha permitido educar a su hijo, hacer mejoras en su hogar y adquirir herramientas de trabajo. Ahora solicita un nuevo préstamo para incrementar la producción de mora y en un futuro seguir apoyando a su hijo y darle una buena educación.
texts.en:
Sra. Bertha is 37 years old and lives in the city of Pimampiro.  She is married and has a son who is a high school student.  Bertha completed her secondary education.

She and her husband engage in agriculture, especially the cultivation of mulberries.  Their harvest is delivered to a factory called “Jugo Fácil” (Easy Juice).  The income generated through their farming activities has enabled them to provide an education for their son, make improvements to their home, and acquire equipment for their work.  

Bertha is now requesting a new loan so that she can increase her mulberry production.  In the future, she wants to continue supporting her son and provide him with a good education.

loans.use: to purchase supplies needed to increase mulberry production.

loans.name: Shamim's Group

texts.en:
Shamim is a widow who lost her husband a few years ago. It was a very difficult time but she never lost hope and worked very hard to raise her only son who is now 25 years old. Her son is involved in a livestock business. He purchases goats and sheep when they are young, raises them and sells them to butchers. Shamim is 56 years old and performs her daily routine tasks by staying at home.
 
Shamim has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her son because he wants to buy some goats to expand his business. This will help him increase his sales by fulfilling the demand of the clients and earn a better income. Shamim is very hopeful that his business will be improved further after investing loan money into it. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.

loans.use: To buy goats

loans.name: Marapa

texts.en:
Married to Simato, Marapa is a 37-year-old father of three children aged 12 years, 9 years, and 6 months. He has been a livestock trader for four years, earning a profit of KES.18,500 per month.

Introduced to KADET LTD by a KADET officer, this will be his first loan with which he plans to purchase livestock including four goats and ten sheep to rear and sell later at a profit.

In the future Marapa, a hardworking and focused man, hopes to acquire supply contracts at Kenya Meat Commission to supply the factory and eventually have a big cattle ranch.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock.

loans.name: Sofik

texts.en:
Sofik was born in 1952 in Yerevan. She is a widow and lives with her daughter, son-in-low and four grandchildren. 

For more than 35 years, Sofik has engaged in garment making. For more than 20 years she worked at the manufacturer Metax as a seamstress. Then she worked at Ayas, a knitted goods factory, as a weaver.

After the Soviet Union period, Sofik and her husband decided to run their own business, so at first they started to sew for customers in their house. As demand grew, they decided to organize a little workshop in front of their house. Sofik and her husband produced various clothes for different organizations and individuals. 

Five years ago, Sofik became a widow, and she could not cope with her business alone, so she asked her daughter’s family to move to her house and to help her with the business. 

Thanks to their joint effort, they are able to continue the business and to keep it in their family.
 
Sofik needs a loan of 1,200 US dollars to buy a new sewing machine and different patterns and materials for her business.

loans.use: To buy a new sewing machine and different patterns and materials for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “MUJERES EMPRENDEDORAS”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco,  y departamento de Cusco.

La socia tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el trabajo en una discoteca en el área de ropería, ella trabaja desde las 7:00 p.m hasta las 6:00 a.m, por medio de este trabajo la socia saca adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere terminar de construir su terreno y hacer arreglar el terreno. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción y para pagar a los maestros de construcción.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 
 La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “Mujeres Emprendedoras” (Enterprising Women) communal bank located in Cusco District that belongs to Cusco Province and Department.

She is 34 years old and has a spouse and two children.  She alternates her daily chores with working in the coat check service at a discotheque; she works from 7pm until 6am.  She is able to support her children with this job.  She’d like to finish building her property and do some improvements to it.  She’s asking for the loan to buy building materials and to pay labor costs for the builders.

She is happy about the loan and commits to make her installment payments.

loans.use: to buy building materials and supplies and to pay labor costs.

loans.name: Elise

texts.fr:
Cliente de Hope Congo âgée de 47 ans; célibataire avec deux (2) enfants  a  sa charge. Il y a bientôt 9 ans qu'elle s'est lancée dans le commerce de poisson sale a l'arrêt de ses études. Ses ventes journalières varient de 20.000f à 30.000frs. 

Avec le prêt elle veut élargir son activité en achetant des cartons de poissons sales comme la morue, le thon, la sole, capitaine, et ses intentions c'est commencer déjà à faire la vente en demi gros et détails. 


A la longue, elle veut ouvrir un dépôt de poisson sale pour être grossiste et avec ses bénéfices elle compte améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille et aussi amener ses enfants à faire des études universitaires.
texts.en:
This borrower is a client of Hope Congo, 47 years old and single, raising two children. She has been selling salted fish for almost nine years, ever since she left school. Her daily sales total between 20,000 and 20,000 frs. 

With the loan she wants to expand her business by buying cartons of salted fish such as cod, tuna, flounder and sword fish and her intention is to begin already to do intermediate trade as well as retail. 

In the long run, she wants to open a warehouse for salted fish in order to be a wholesaler and with her profit she intends to improve living conditions for her family and also send her children to university.

loans.use: to buy salted fish, tuna, flounder, and sword fish.

loans.name: Sergio Nilson

texts.es:
En municipio de Managua, el señor Sergio Nilson  se dedica   a laborar como Operador de planta de tratamiento de agua residuales en una institución del estado, dedicándose a esta labor desde hace ocho años. Es soltero y con dos personas a su cargo que le proporciona las condiciones necesarias a su familia. 

El señor Sergio Nilson ha acudido a ceprodel con el fin de solicitar un crédito para mejorar la condición de su vivienda en la compra de materiales de construcción tale como bloque, cemento, arena, y pago de mano de obra, para hacer un anexo de un cuarto para darle seguridad a su vivienda, por medio de esta obra brindarle mejor condición de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
In the municipality of Managua, Sergio Nilson has been employed for the past eight years as an operator at a state-run water treatment facility. He is single and he has two individuals in his care. He provides his family with the necessary living conditions.

Sergio Nilson has approached Ceprodel (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan to improve the condition of his house. He will purchase construction materials such as construction blocks, cement, sand, and to cover the labor expenses. He intends on building an additional room to give his house added security, and therefore providing his family with improved living conditions.

loans.use: to make home improvements.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 36 years old and lives in West Point. She is single and has three children between 3 and 15 years old. Rebecca stopped her education in the 6th grade.

For the past five years, Rebecca has been selling oil, rice and pepper. She is requesting a loan to purchase more of these items. She likes her business because of the way she exchanges money and because it helps her to feel at home. Rebecca plans to build a house and send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase rice, oil and pepper

loans.name: Olga Maria

texts.es: Olga María tiene 29 años su actividad es un kiosco, que tiene cinco años de poseerlo, con un hijo d cuatro años bajo su cargo. La ubicación de su negocio es en un colegio público en donde ofrece sopa, pan, galletas, tajaditas, golosinas, bolsitas, churritos, jugos. Es por eso que solicita este crédito para la compra d materia prima. Olga no ha terminado de estudiar su carrera universitaria  y con este kiosco ella esta logrando obtener ciertas ganancias para pagar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Olga Maria is 29 years old and she has had her own kiosk for the last 5 years. Olga has a 4-year-old son under her charge.  Her business is located in a public school where she offers soup, bread, cookies, fried plantain chips, sweets, stuffed pockets, Spanish-style deep fried dough, and fruit juices.

The reason for her loan request is to buy primary materials for her kiosk. Olga has not completed her university education as yet and with this kiosk, she is acquiring the earnings she needs to pay for her studies.

loans.use: to make soup, cookies, fried plantain chips, sweets, stuffed pockets, deep fried dough, and juices to sell.

loans.name: Mayrambubu

texts.ru: Майрамбубу 58 лет. Она вдова и имеет 10 детей. В 2002 году Майрамбубу начала заниматься откормом и перепродажей скота, использовав в качестве стартового капитала 30,000 сом (KGS). На сегодняшний день, благодаря упорному труду и инициативности Майрамбубу, ее хозяйство насчитывает 2 коровы, 2 теленка, 1 лошадь и 32 овцы. Дополнительно, она возделывает 1,8 га земли , где выращивает кормовые культуры. В целях дальнейшего расширения своего бизнеса, Майрамбубу обратилась в компанию «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) для покупки коровы и бычков для откорма. В будущем, Майрамбубу , при помощи доходов от кредита, планирует женить младшего сына.
texts.en: Mayrambubu is 58 years old.  She is a widow and has ten children.  In 2002, Mayrambubu became involved in fattening up and reselling livestock, using a starting capital of 30,000 som (KGS).  Today, thanks to Mayrambubu's hard work and initiative, her farm has two cows, two calves, one horse and 32 sheep.  In addition, she tills 1.8 hectares of land, where she grows fodder crops.  In order to further expand her business, Mayrambubu requested a loan in the sum of 100,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum and Partners" company to buy cows and bulls for fattening up.  In the future, she plans to use the profits from this loan to marry off her youngest son.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en: Eduardo is 52 years old and is a married man with five children. He has been in the business of raising hogs for 11 years. Eduardo earns about 8000 PHP from this business. He plans to use his loan to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins. Eduardo hopes to become a successful businessman someday. He also hopes to sustain his children's education.

loans.use: to purchase piglets, feed and vitamins.

loans.name: Pandaleon

texts.en:
Pandaleon is 36 years old and lives in the Philippines. He is married with three children. 

Pandaleon has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks & beverages. He has had this business for five years. He requested a loan for PHP 5,000 to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages.

Pandaleon is a new member of HSPFI.  In the future, Pandaleon hopes to improve his business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks & beverages

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 33-year-old married man, father of four children. Three years ago, Mahmoud opened a grocery store, hoping to improve his family’s social and financial situation. He used to work in construction and specialized in pasting tiles, but unfortunately he dealt with bad constructors that made his financial situation very bad, which made him turn to a more requested product for human beings which is food. 

Mahmoud is a hard-working man; he is working hard to improve his newly established business, through a first-time loan he applied for from Al Majmoua, to purchase new merchandise for his business requested by most of his customers. These products will help in increasing his income and attracting new customers.

Mahmoud hopes to make necessary changes to his shop, especially to his walls, shelves and many necessary decorations in the future.

loans.use: To purchase new merchandise for his business.

loans.name: Pedro Vicente

texts.es:
Pedro Vicente tiene 28 años de edad es soltero no tiene hijos vive con los padres en el Catón Chillanes provincia de bolívar.

Pedro  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, abonos  para los cultivos. 
Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la calidad del producto, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas a los cultivos.

El sueño es llegar a comprar una casa para vivir tranquilo con la familia.

En los tiempos libres le gusta practicar el deporte en especial el futbol.
texts.en: Pedro Vicente is 28 years old.  He is unmarried and has no children.  He lives with his parents in Chillanes canton, in Bolivar province.  Pedro works in farming, growing corn, soy beans, and cacao.  He makes purchases and sells his produce in San José del Tambo each weekend.  He is requesting the loan to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, supplies, and manure for the crops.  This loan will help him improve the quality of his produce. The most frequent challenges he faces are competition and blight.  His dream is buy a house where he can live peacefully with his family.  In his free time, he likes to play sports, especially soccer.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, compost, fertilizer, supplies, and manure for the crops.

loans.name: Celestin

texts.en:
Celestin is 49 years old and is married with five children between the ages of 9 and 16 years old. Celestin has three years' experience selling use clothing in the market. He currently employs one person to help him and his business is open from 6 am to 6 pm each week except on Saturdays.

Celestin has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more used clothing to sell. With any profits, Celestin would like to satisfy his basic needs and start saving for his future and build a house for his family.

loans.use: to purchase more second hand to sell.

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith owns a boutique in Kyenjojo, Uganda. She is 55 and is a single mother of three children. 

She has owned the boutique for two years and dreams of a modern one that caters to all people. She wants another loan to buy clothes for resale ahead of the festive season.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Cecil

texts.en:
Cecil is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married and has 2 children. 

Cecil has a vegetable garden where she grows vegetables, like eggplants & string-beans, that she will sell when it's harvest time. She has had this business for 5 years. She has requested a loan for PHP 8,000 to buy fertilizers for her vegetable garden.

Cecil has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Cecil hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for vegetable garden.

loans.name: Mwanatumu

texts.en:
Mwanatumu is a married woman with three children, one of whom attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past ten years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passerby. She faces a major challenge of low sales in her business. Her major dream is to expand the business to meet her customer demand. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar and tea leaves.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 32-year-old married man.  He has been the owner of a cow farm since 1997. His agriculture business is very important to him, it's his only income source.

Mohamad is a hard worker, it's his first time to experience dealing with Kiva partner Al Majmoua.  He has done so in order to increase his cattle through buying extra cows, which will definitely increase his income through their increased production.

Mohamad hopes to keep on expanding his business through introducing new animals to his farm in order to increase future production.

loans.use: to buy new cows to increase his cattle production.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en: Joshua lives in Changamwe and is employed. He is married and has four children; one of whom is in school. Joshua learned of Milango from his friends. He is applying for a loan of 40,000 Kenya shillings to pay for his children's school fees. His main goal is to provide education to his children.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school fees

loans.name: Dzendere Karisa

texts.en:
Dzendere Karisa is a 70 year old retail shop proprietor in Mariakani. She is married. She has been running her retail business for the past five years with great success. 

This is Dzendere’s first business loan from KADET. She plans to use the loan to purchase more sugar, rice, tea leaves, cooking oil and cooking flour to sell in her retail shop. She will use the proceeds from her business to repay her loan. She hopes to have a more profitable business.

loans.use: to purchase more sugar, rice, tea leaves, cooking oil and cooking flour to sell in her retail shop.

loans.name: Rodrigo De Jesus

texts.es:
Rodrigo se encuentra casado y tiene 4 hijos a quienes siempre les ha querido brindar una buena calidad de vida, es por esto que buscando mejores oportunidades económicas decidió montar su propio negocio el cual es una producción y distribución de panes y así tiene unos ingresos que le permiten tener en su hogar mejores condiciones económicas para progresar. Su negocio lo tiene hace cerca de 4 años y gracias a la buena calidad de sus productos logra distribuirlos a diferentes municipios cercanos, para lo cual cuenta con una moto que le permite hacerlo eficientemente. Gracias a que sus ventas vienen en aumento, Rodrigo busca un préstamo para comprar materia prima e insumos para la preparación de los panes y así responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

Su sueño es llegar a tener un gran negocio y por esto trabaja fuertemente todos los días, buscando que su negocio crezca y así en un futuro poder generar empleo. Además, espera sacar su familia adelante brindándole una buena calidad de vida y unas mejores condiciones económicas.

loans.use: Comprar materia prima e insumos para la preparación de los panes y así responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.

loans.name: Ulukman

texts.ru: Улукману 55 лет, женат и имеет 5 детей. Супруга домохозяйка помогает ему по хозяйству. В поисках  источника дохода для своей семьи, в 2007 году Улукман начал заниматься полеводством и животноводством. Стартовав с 50,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день его хозяйство приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 5,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве содержит: 1 дойную корову, 20 овец. В основном занимается выращиванием овощей и фруктов, таких как: виноград, яблоки, помидоры, клубнику для продажи, имеет земельный надел размером 2,10 ГА. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Улукман обратился в Микрофинансовый банк «Бай – Тушум и Партнеры» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Улукман планирует использовать для увеличения поголовья скота, а также на проведение свадьбы своего сына.
texts.en: Ulukman is 55 years old, married, and has 5 children. His spouse is a housewife and helps around the farm. In search of the source of income for his family, Ulukman started farming and raising livestock in 2007. Starting from 50,000 somons (KGS), today his farm brings a monthly profit of 5,000 somons (KGS). On his farm, he keeps one dairy cow and 20 sheep. Mainly, he grows vegetables and fruit, such as: grapes, apples, tomatoes, and strawberries for sale.  He has a 2.10 hectare plot of land. In order to further grow his business, Ulukman has turned to Microfinance bank "Bai-Tushum and Partners" to request a loan in the amount of 70,000 somons (KGS) in order to purchase cattle to increase his herd. Ulukman plans to use the income from the loan to increase the number of livestock, as well as to pay for his son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Giang's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Giang is 29 years old and she is married with 2 children.
 
She has a mechanical store for 4 years.
Giang lives in Thieu Hoa district, a semi-urban town in Thanh Hoa province.
Her family is a low-income household in village, moreover the market need is low in this region. 
In 2015, Giang joined Thanh Hoa microfinance institution to improve her  business. Giang has successfully repaid 5 loans from Thanh Hoa microfinance institution.
Giang is a reputable person in the community. 
She is the leader of her solidarity group. 
The main hardship that Giang faces is lack of capital.  She is requesting a loan to purchase material and supplies to maintain the mechanical store.
With her business profit, Giang hopes for her business to do well, to maintain  a successful business, and to make enough money to provide for her kids.

loans.use: to purchase material and supplies to maintain the mechanical store.

loans.name: Afi

texts.en:
Afi G. was born on August 13, 1965 in Tabligbo. She did not have the opportunity to go to school because her parents were slow to understand the necessity of educating a girl. She currently sells basic daily necessities (groceries). Married and the mother of three, she is also the guardian of two other children. Household expenses became more burdensome, and her meager income was insufficient. The family now lives in poverty. Her husband lacks a steady job and does not help with the bills very much. Ms. GAGA finds herself trapped by these responsibilities and does not know what to do anymore. Despite her courage and will, her family falls prey to daily problems. She had benefited from a $450 loan that she handled and repaid in a satisfactory manner. A very energetic woman brimming with confidence, she is in need of financial support to bolster and grow her small business. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of $850 as capital to acquire fish and grocery items to sell. Financing this business means contributing to the struggle against poverty in deprived areas.

Translated from French by Farron Blanc and Daniel Kuey, Kiva volunteers.

Madame G. Afi est née le 14 août 1965 à Tabligbo. Elle n’a pas eu la chance d’aller à l’école car ses parents n’ont pas vite compris la nécessite de la scolarisation d’une fille. Elle a aujourd’hui comme activité le petit commerce de vente des produits de première nécessité (épicerie). Mariée et mère de trois (03) enfants, elle a à sa charge deux (02) autres enfants. Les charges du ménage devenant plus lourdes que le maigre revenu de Mme GAGA, la misère s’est installée dans la famille. Son mari qui n’a pas un emploi fixe ne contribue pas efficacement aux charges du ménage. Elle se trouve écrasée par les charges et ne sait plus à quel saint se vouer. Malgré son courage et sa volonté, son ménage est en proie à des difficultés quotidiennes. Elle bénéficia alors d’un crédit de $450 qu’elle avait su bien gérer et rembourser sans incident. Très dynamique et pleine de confiance, elle a besoin d’un appui financier pour renforcer et accroître son petit commerce. Elle sollicite, pour ce faire, un crédit de $850 qui servira de fonds de commerce pour l’achat et la revente du poisson et des produits d’épicerie. Financer cette activité, c’est contribuer à la lutte contre la pauvreté des milieux démunis.

loans.use: Buy and sell fish and food products.

loans.name: Fermin

texts.en:
Fermin is a very hard-working rice farmer from Santa Lucia. Despite his elementary education and old age, Fermin has been able to and continues to run his farm very effectively. It has always provided for him and his 5 children. Although they are all grown up now, his kids still help in the farm and some even still live at home. To them, the "hacienda" is more than a home, as it has been in the family for over 40 years and it also puts food on the table. He hopes he can invest in seeds and fertilizer for the next planting season.

The Santa Lucia Communal Bank

Fermin is part of the newest Communal Banks in the recently developed Mifex Rural Finance Program. All of the members of the Centro Agricola de Santa Lucia Communal Bank are part of an Association of Rice Farmers in Santa Lucia. Their association works cooperatively to help in the commercialization of the product after it has grown. They will use the micro-loans to prepare their lands and cultivate rice on their farms. Because they form part of a communal bank, they are all each others' guarantors for the loan. This means that if for some reason one person in the group cannot fully repay the loan, the other borrowers and the Primero de Agosto Association are responsible for the amount in default. The members of the bank also participate in a program designed to teach and encourage savings among the group. Promoting savings is often forgotten in many micro-finance programs, but Mifex believes that is imperative for the communities we works with to have capital reserved for future investments or unexpected difficulties.

Below is more information about Santa Lucia compiled by Luis Crespo and Robert Edgar of the Mifex team when evaluating the potential of the sector for the Rural Finance Program. Special thanks to Mario Balazantegui who provided expert insight and contributed to the development of the alliances with the local organizations.

Economy of Santa Lucia

Santa Lucia County has a population of about 33,000 people. The sector is fit for rice cultivating because it is not in the lowlands and therefore it is not at risk of flooding. There is also great access to water because of the Daule River, which is accessible to many of the farmers in the area. About 70% of the farmers have basic infrastructure for watering their crops.

Rice production is the main economic activity of the area as about 80% of the people are rice farmers. Almost everyone is either directly or indirectly involved with rice production, as they produce, commercialize or participate in activities that add value to the product. Within the county, there is a small town also named Santa Lucia. The town is filled with many small businesses and it serves as the social and commercial hub of the area.

Rice Farming in Santa Lucia

Most of the people in the Santa Lucia area are small farmers. They produce about 100 sacks of rice per hectare of land. In order to farm they first must prepare the lands by removing weeds and plowing. The farmers then fill an area with water to form what is known as a paddy field, because rice is a very water intensive crop. The rice seeds are either dispersed freely (the process is known as boleo in Spanish) or hand sowed. Once the rice has grown, most farmers rent machinery that helps them gather their production. A risk factor does exist in rice farming because of drought, but in Santa Lucia this is somewhat mitigated by the access to water form the nearby river.

Access to Credit

The biggest struggle in the area has been the lack of credit. Because people do not count on formal financial services, they have turned to loan sharks for financing. They have been affected by expensive lines of credit that exceed 100% interest a year and can be as expensive as 240%. Intermediaries also exploit the farmers because of their outstanding debt. Farmers also lack skills and knowledge to commercialize their products and pay fair prices for their crops.

Loan Use

The loans in this sector will be used to to buy soil, seeds, fertilizer and insecticides. They will also be used to prepare the land prior to farming, to plant the seeds and purchase other materials. The loan repayment schedule is also different from the typical micro-entrepreneur. Because farmers see the profits from their investments 5 or 6 months after making their initial expenditures, Mifex asks them only to pay 50% of the capital in the first 6 months of the loan. The rest of the debt must be paid in the seventh and final month.

loans.use: Rice Farming

loans.name: Metleb

texts.en: Metleb B. owns and operates a general housing goods store in the town of Khachmaz on the North Eastern coast of Azerbaijan. Metleb is looking for funding so that he can increase the quantity and variety of his inventory.

loans.use: To increase the quantity and variety of his inventory

loans.name: Romer

texts.es:
Mr. Romer Alarcón lives with his parents in their home in the Pasankeri district on the western side of the City of La Paz with his wife and 3 and 1 y.o. sons. Mr. Romel works for a security business in our city and his wife is a housewife. The family currently occupies a room borrowed from his parents that can be uncomfortable. The requested loan will be used to construct a room in the rear of the home that will be more comfortable and will be the start of future loans that will allow them to build a small, seperate home. This is their first request for a loan and the socioeconomic analysis conducted favorably qualifies them and allows them to achieve greater credit worthiness.

Translated from Christian Garcia by Christian Garcia, Kiva Volunteer.

El señor Romer Alarcón vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Pasankeri ladera oeste de la Ciudad de La Paz con su esposa y sus hijos de 3 y 1 año de edad; el señor Romel trabaja como empleado en una empresa de seguridad de nuestra ciudad y su esposa es ama de casa. Actualmente ocupan una habitación cedida por sus padres que ocasionan cierta incomodidad a la pareja como a sus progenitores. El crédito solicitado será destinado a la construcción completa de una habitación en la parte posterior de la vivienda que les dará mayor comodidad y será el inicio para con futuros créditos puedan edificar una pequeña vivienda independiente. Esta es la primera vez que solicitan un préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado los califica favorablemente y puede acceder un nuevo crédito.

loans.use:
Construction of a room

Construccion de una habitacion

loans.name: Ali

texts.en:
Ali, 57 years old, lives with his wife -next to him on the picture- in the area of Ain El Mraysseh in Beirut. Ali has been concierge in the same school for the past 24 years. 8 years ago, he had the opportunity to buy 2 school buses for a very good price and used his life savings to do so. Ali heard of Al Majmoua through a friend who is a borrower. With the 4 consecutive loans Ali took from the Institution in the 5 last years, he was able to buy extra buses - he now owns 5 of them- and to purchase accessories and spare parts. Ali employs 4 drivers and has a yearly contract with the school to transport the students. This contract is being renewed every year. Ali is now trying to convince his elder son, who lives abroad, to come back to Lebanon and take over the business.
Ali needs a loan of USD 1,200 to buy spare parts for 2 of the buses, paint one of them and do the mechanical check up of the buses before school starts.

loans.use: Purchase of spare parts and mechanical check-up of the 5 school buses he owns

loans.name: Elmira

texts.en:
Elmira M. is from Sumgayit city in the Azerbaijan republic. She is 44 years old, married, and the mother of four children. She is the only breadwinner in her family. She began her business with $200 in 2005, dealing in mobile industry goods and retail trade. She also started selling a small variety of baby clothes. With this small business and only $200 in working capital, she can hardly earn enough money to meet the family's food and important consumption needs.

Elmira needs $600 to expand her business. She wants to increase her assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of baby goods. She will repay the loan within 12 months. She hopes that this will help her expand her business and further improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To increase her assortment of industry goods and to buy additional kinds of baby goods

loans.name: Talani

texts.en: Talani is a hard-working woman of 40 years of age. She puts in hard labor on the farm that supports her family. She has five children. She repays her debt well and is always trying to better her small business. She is an upstanding client and an asset to the local economy.

loans.use: To buy a lawn mower and pesticides for her small farm

loans.name: Erisa C(Iii) Group

texts.en: Racheal is 40 years old and married with three children. She makes a living for herself and her family selling charcoal on a retail basis. She and four her associates have applied for a loan to buy more charcoal to sell, and to open up a wholesale business. Racheal will pay her children's school fees.with the extra profits made possible by this loan.

loans.use: To expand a charcoal-selling business and become a wholesaler

loans.name: Suubi Kinawa C Group

texts.en:
The group leader of this small group is Erina N.. She is currently in the business of selling clothes and is requesting a loan to boost business. Erina is 29 years old and is single. She has two children aged 2 and 4. Each week, Erina makes approximately UGX 30000 in profits and with the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to start a piggery business.

Erina is joined in her small group by Rehema M., Betty Kayemba, Birabwa Namuga, and Getrude N.. Rehema M. has a business in poultry keeping and wants to buy chicken mash. Betty Kayemba is currently operating a hotel business and wants a loan to buy more hotel equipment. Birabwa Namuga operates a business of poultry farming and wants to add capital. Getrude N. is currently in the business of running a retail shop and is requesting a loan to purchase more shop items.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell

loans.name: Hour

texts.en: Mrs. Hour C., 39, is a garment worker. On average, she earns $2 a day of profit. Her husband, who is a logger, makes approximately  $3 a day of profit. This couple has three children, one of who is a logger as his father and earns around $2 a day. The other two children are students. To reduce expenses,  this family requests a loan from Kiva to purchase a motorbike to commute to work. This will allow the family to save for the future.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike to commute to work.

loans.name: Vida

texts.en:
Vida is a married woman. She is thirty-nine years old and prepares and sells rice with vegetable sauce, banku, and rice balls in her village.

Vida says that prices of her products, like spices, vegetables, beans and rice, have increased, and she wants use her new loan to buy her products in larger quantities to avoid price hikes.

She is a member of the group called “Mpaebo Tiefo" (meaning Prayer Listening God). The group members exert peer pressure on themselves as social collateral to repay the loan.

In the photo, Vida is busy selling her food.

loans.use: To buy rice, maize, vegetables and spices

loans.name: Trinidad De Jesus

texts.es:
Mr. Trinidad Acuna's economic activity is agriculture which he has dedicated himself to for several years. He learned this business from a young age and now has a lot of experience.

It is very important to point out that his business requires a lot of effort which is why he dedicates himself to growing basic grains such as corn and beans. This requires a lot of exposure to the sun as well as moving the product long distances. The reason why he is requesting a loan from Ceprodel is to invest in technological assistance in cultivation. With this loan he will be able to succeed and have better opportunities for the sale of his products after the harvest.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy M., Kiva Volunteer.

La actividad económica del caballero Trinidad A. es la agricultura dedicándose a esta labor desde hace varios años habiendo aprendido a desempeñarse en el campo desde muy jovencito lo que hasta hoy ha ocasionado de que tenga basta experiencia con esta labor.

Es de suma importancia destacar que su negocio requiere de mucho esfuerzo por lo que se dedica fuertemente al cultivo de granos básicos como maíz y frijoles y esto requiere de mucha exposición al sol y traslado del producto desde largas distancias. La razón por la cual hoy en día solicita un crédito en Ceprodel es para la inversión en asistencia técnica para el cultivo. Con este crédito logrará salir adelante y tener mejores oportunidades para la venta de los productos una vez que se lleve a cabo la cosecha.

loans.use: Purchase of products for cultivation

loans.name: Veronica

texts.en:
Veronica B. is forty-five years old. She is married and has given birth to five children. She is a petty trader who sells tomatoes, palm oil, yams, plantain, vegetables, beans, and maize from a table in the local market. She sells multiple commodities with the hope that when the sale of one goes down the others will sell to give her good profit. She is however convinced that her business can grow better with increased capital and therefore wants the loan to buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes and onions, bags of maize and beans. Iincreasing her stock will provide a bigger income to finance her children’s education. Currently, three of them have completed senior high school.

She belongs to the community group called Timothy Trust Group. In this group, members guarantee for one another as social collateral to access loan.

loans.use: To buy more tubers of yams, baskets of tomatoes and onions, and bags of maize and beans.

loans.name: Asia's Group

texts.en:
Asia baji is the wife of M. M.Yaqoob, and they live in the city of Chichawatni in Pakistan. She is the mother of four children: one son and three daughters. All of her children are enrolled in a school near her neighborhood. Asia baji and her husband have a dream to provide each of their children with a good education. Her husband is a mason, but he also has a business whereby he sells masonry tools. Now, she is applying for a loan for her husband so that he can expand and improve his business enterprise.

She is joined in her loan group by the following individuals: (1) Kosar baji, who seeks a loan to buy seeds and fertilizer; (2) Shafqat baji, who requests a loan for her garment business; and (3) Zareena baji, who is in need of a loan for her scrap work.

This is a group loan. As such, the loan proceeds will be distributed among the group members, each of whom will invest in her own business. Further, the members mutually guarantee each other's loans; therefore, if one member does not repay her loan, the other members are responsible for the arrears.

loans.use: To improve and expand their respective businesses (e.g., by purchasing seeds, fertilizer, materials for a garment business, etc.)

loans.name: Valentina Felicia

texts.es:
Felicia, 19, is a young woman from Juliaca in Peru. She has little money so she's had to apply herself to different kinds of work to cover her basic needs. She's a happy and enterprising woman despite having had to work from a very young age. She buys and sells craft products and operates a small stand selling ceviche (a traditional Peruvian dish made with fish and lemon) in a city market. Thanks to this business, she hopes to improve her quality of life and be able to shape her own future and that of her beloved parents. For now, with great hope, she's applying for a loan of 800 soles, money that she will invest in the purchase of products for resale and for supplies to make ceviche. She promises to repay the loan in a period not to exceed 6 months.

Translated from Spanish by Jere Wiseman, Kiva Volunteer

Felicia es una joven de 19 años de edad, natural de la ciudad de Juliaca, sus bajos recursos económicos la obligaron a trabajar en diferentes actividades y así cubrir sus necesidades más urgentes.Esta emprendedora y alegre joven, desde muy pequeña se dedicó a la compra y venta de artesanía, comercio por campaña y además tiene un pequeño puesto de venta de ceviche (plato típico peruano a base de pescado y limón) en un concurrido mercado de su ciudad, gracias a este negocio tiene la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida y ser protagonista de su propio desarrollo y el de sus queridos padres.En estos momentos, con mucha ilusión, solicita un préstamo por el monto de 800 soles, dinero que invertirá en la compra de los productos que vende y de insumos para la elaboración del ceviche, se compromete a rembolsar éste, en un lapso no mayor de 6 meses.

loans.use: Buy supplies for food business.

loans.name: Petty-Traders Group

texts.en:
These are Jariatu K., Aiafu K. and Isatu S.. They named their group Petty Traders. They want a loan of Le 1,500,000.00.

Jariatu, who is the leader of this group, was born in Sanda about 30 miles from Makeni. But she now lives with her husband here in Makeni where she also does her business. She is 32 and has 4 children. She sells slippers and has been in this business for the past 10 years now. Previous loans have helped Jariatu a lot. They have helped her business grow. She was able to pay her children's school fees and also handles most of her numerous problems. With a new loan, Jariatu's stock of slippers will increase from 6 cartons to 12 cartons.

Aiafu also sells slippers. Previous loans have now helped him get a total of 4 cartons of slippers. He used to have only 2 cartons. With a new loan, he is expecting to get 6 cartons.

Isatu sells items like gum, biscuits, batteries, mints, lollipops etc. She thanks God for the previous loans she got with SMT. Such loans have helped her business grow and out of the proceeds, she is able to make a livelihood.

loans.use: Buy more cartons of slippers for re-sale

loans.name: Tatu

texts.en:
Mambo from Tanzania! This is 33 year old Tatu M. from Dar es Salaam. She is married with four children, between the ages of one and fifteen. She is also responsible for supporting one dependent child whose parents do not take care of her.

Tatu has been running a charcoal business since 2007. Charcoal is a type of fuel that is used locally to prepare food and boil water. Tatu's business is doing well. She works at it for twelve hours per day, six days per week, and currently earns about $100 from her business. She is requesting a loan of $675 to purchase additional stock of charcoal. In the future, she plans to expand her business. Tatu thanks you for your support!

SELFINA has taken a lead role as a pioneer of micro-credit in Tanzania through Micro-Leasing. The organization is engaged in the economic empowerment of women in Tanzania through the provision of a leasing and leaseback microfinance facility. Customs and traditions in Tanzania make it difficult for women to own land and assets, thus they are termed non-creditworthy by financial institutions. This leads to poor financial support and poor access to basic needs and services for women with low incomes. One of the primary advantages of microleasing is that is allows clients to use the equipment as collateral for future loans with SELFINA, thus enabling them to borrow larger sums in the future.

loans.use: To purchase additional stock of charcoal.

loans.name: María Castillejo

texts.es:
Maria es socia D. Banco Comunal El Pino. Maria es casada, tiene 51 años y 3 hijos D. 28, 26 y 19 años. El ultimo D. sus hijos esta en la universidad, los otros dos trabajan.       
Maria tiene su negocio desD. hace un año ella venD. abarrotes, golosinas, ella tiene una pequeña tienda en su casa.
Maria necesita un préstamo D. 1200 soles, dinero que será invertido en la compra D. abarrotes,(arroz, azúcar, dulces, etc.)   
María desD. que recibe los prestamos empezó a comprar mas mercadería, abarrotes, comenzó a surtir su tienda. Maria sueña con ampliar su negocio tener una tienda bien surtida y granD..
texts.en:
María is a member of El Pino Communal Bank. She is married, 51 years old and has three children ages 28, 26 and 19. Her youngest child attends university and the other two work. María has had a business for a year selling groceries and candy. She has a small store in her home. She needs a loan for 1,200 soles, money that will be used to purchase groceries (rice, sugar, candy, etc.). When she began to receive the loans, María started to purchase more merchandise and began to stock her store. She dreams of growing her business and having a store that is large and well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Hugh Yarbrough, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase merchandise for a grocery store

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Mrs. Chan L. is a villager in Ang village in Kandal Province. She and her husband, Mr. Ky Lok, are farmers who own a piece of land where they grow rice. There field has several problems. The soil is infertile because it has been worked so much, and they need money for rice and to hire a laborer to plow. Mrs. Chan L. is requesting a loan to buy rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire a labor with an electric cow to plow the field. She hopes to increase income and improve her family's living conditions.She is 44 years old and the mother of three, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To purchase rice seed, fertilizer, pesticides, and to hire a labor with an electric cow to plow the field.

loans.name: Loem

texts.en:
Loem P., 28, is a local rice farmer as well as raising pigs outside her house. She is the mother of two children, both of whom are still young and are pupils in primary school. Her husband, Lim Sokvoeun, age 28, sells carving wood, currently earning about US$ 4 a day to help feed the family.

To enlarge her business, P. needs to ask for a loan to buy more piglets for breeding and two buffalo to hitch to a cart for her husband to transport carving wood to sell. The loan will help increase their income to cover this family’s living expenses sufficiently. P.'s husband is in the picture because she was not available.

loans.use: to buy more piglets for breeding and two buffalo to pull the cart

loans.name: Woevi

texts.fr: A. Woevi est âgée de 37 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est maintenancière informatique de formation et a monté un centre de traitement d’informations et de photocopie  à Lomé, la capitale togolaise .Elle est tout entière à ce qu’elle faisait et elle ne fait pas de doute qu’avec ce second crédit de FECECAV, elle peut acquérir de nouveaux équipements  et tirer rapidement profit  de l’exploitation.
texts.en:
Woevi A. is 37 years old, married, and the mother of three. She is a computer services worker by training and has set up a center for word-processing and photocopies in Lomé, the Togolese captial. She is fully up to what she has been doing and has no doubt that, with this second FECECAV loan, she can acquire new equipment and derive a profit quickly from her business.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip her center with new machines and supplies

loans.name: Marcos

texts.es:
El señor Marcos L. tiene ya más de 12 años con su taller de herrero, el cual elabora, (puertas y ventanas), esté negocio es la fuente de ingresos de su familia. En esté momento le está haciendo falta material  para poder realizar los pedido que tiene, pero no cuenta con el capital necesario. Es por eso que solicita un préstamo para poder comprar el material y así  realizar los pedidos y entregarlos a tiempo. Para que sus clientes estén más satisfechos con su trabajo y lo puedan recomendar con otras personas, y así su negocio crezca más. 
Don Marcos planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias de su negocio.
texts.en:
Marcos L. has had his blacksmith's shop where he makes doors and windows for 12 years. This business is the source of income for his family. At this moment he is lacking materials to fill the orders he has but he does not have the necessary capital to purchase them. This is why he is asking for a loan to purchase materials and be able to fill his orders deliver them on time so that his clients can be satisfied with his work and recommend him to other people. Marcos plans on paying this loan with the profits from his business.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Manzo, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials to make doors and windows.

loans.name: Meaaisi

texts.en: Meaaisi A. Y., 35, is married with six children.  She has 0 years of experience in the BBQ business. She sells to the general public and villagers 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Meaaisi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her business is running well.

loans.use: To purchase mutton flaps, chickens, sausages, soya sauce, onions, garlic, charcoal, and foam plates and cups

loans.name: Danelia Del Carmen

texts.es:
La Sra. Danelia M. se dedica hace 7 años a la venta de especias y condimentos, ella quiere comprar enchape de oro para vender ya que como ella vende su producto ambulante tiene la certeza de que el enchape lo puede vender muy bien en diferentes oficinas gubernamentales y privadas, los fines de semana se trasladas a diferentes comunidades, aldeas y caserios para vender su producto.
ella necesita el credito para poderlo invertir en este producto ya que ella el mes anterior tenia el dinero para comprar dicha mercaderia pero cuando viajo a Tegucigalpa la asaltaron y perdio todo el dinero que iba a invertir, ella es soltera y es madre de una hija la cual con su negocio le pudo dar estudios y alimentacion, su hija ahora es maestra y le ayuda economicamente.
texts.en:
Danelia M. has been selling spices and seasonings for 7 years. She wishes to buy gold plated products to sell. She already sells products in a mobile manner and is certain that the gold items will sell very well in different government and private offices.

On weekends she goes to other communities, villages, and small towns to sell her products. She needs this loan to buy these products. Last month she had the money to buy this merchandise, but when she traveled to Tegucigalpa she was robbed and lost all the money she was going to invest.

She is single and has one daughter. With her business she was able to provide education and food for her daughter. Now her daughter is a teacher and she helps her economically.

Translated from Spanish by Rebecca Morey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy gold plated products

loans.name: Nguyen Thi

texts.en:
Nguyễn S. is a 55-year-old female living in the town of Thanh Hoá.  She is married and has 4 adult-aged children.  To making a living, S. works in a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for sale.  S. has been engaged in this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 3,000,000 VND a month from these activities.

In 2007, S. joined TYM Fund to gain access to financial services to help improve  her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  S. has successfully repaid a previous loan from TYM Fund.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  S. is now requesting a new loan of 9,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase breeding livestock.  The loan will be the 5th loan taken out by the borrower from TYM Fund.  S. plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: Raising livestock.

loans.name: Angella's Group

texts.en:
N. Angella is the leader of Twekozese group in Kyebando. She is a devoted young lady and married with 3 children, aged 1 to 6 years. She has a business selling foodstuffs from Kyebando and in most cases supplying them to her customers in their residences. She has enough business experience and she would like to expand her business more. Her food stuffs include matooke (plantains), cassava, sweet potatoes, and greens.

Angella has a dream of buying a house and having a rich and God-fearing family. She needs a loan to be able to pay school fees for her children come next term as well as buying more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.use: Buying more foodstuffs for sale.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.es:
La señora Cynthia tiene 25 años de edad, vive en concubinato con el señor Cándido, tienen 2 hijos aun menores de edad y uno en camino.
Vive en un barrio muy cercano al centro de la ciudad de Ita, tiene casa propia, hasta hace poco tiempo vivían en casa de su madre, pero gracias al fruto de su trabajo como  vendedora de tabacos  consiguió construir 2 piezas y un baño. 
La actividad de comerciante lo heredó de su madre quien también se dedicaba a esa actividad, la elaboración de los tabacos las realiza en su domicilio y por las mañanas los vende en el mercado municipal de la ciudad municipal de la ciudad al por mayor y menor. El préstamo que solicita es para la compra de más fardos de materia prima debido a que tiene bastantes pedidos.
texts.en:
Cynthia is 25 years old and lives with a man named Cándido. They have 2 young children, one who can already walk. She lives in an area very close to the center of the city of Ita. She now has her own house, recently having lived in the house of her mother. However, thanks to the fruits of her labor as a seller of tobacco, she was able to construct two rooms and a bathroom. She inherited this type of work from her mother who also worked performing the same job. The tobacco production is done at her house and she sells the products during the mornings at the local market in the city. The loan she is requesting is for the purchase of more bundles of raw materials because she has a lot of incoming orders.

Translated from Spanish by Josh Wilcox, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The purchase of raw materials for tobacco production

loans.name: 32 - Nam Ngạn Group

texts.en:
Quyên Ngô Thị is a 34 year-old woman living in the town of T. Hóa.  Quyên is the leader of a 4-member group which is accepting a loan offered by T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 32 - Nam Ngạn.

Quyên is married and has 2 school-aged children.  To making a living, Quyên owns and operates a business venture in the service sector operating a service-based business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing hairdressing & beauty services to local members of the community.  Quyên has run this business for over 10 years and earns approximately 1,500,000 Vietnamese dong (or about $84 US) a month from these activities.

In 2009, Quyên joined T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve both her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities.  Quyên is requesting a loan of 1,626,900 dong (or about $91) from T. Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  She will use the loan, her first, to purchase materials needed to provide service.  Quyên plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees of her children.


About the other borrowers in the group:

1.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to provide service

loans.name: Jumoke

texts.en: Jumoke sells drinks and pepper soup. Jumoke is 40 years old and married with three children. Jumoke hopes for a loan of 50,000 nairas to purchase more drinks and pepper soup ingredients. She says thank you!

loans.use: To purchase more drinks and pepper soup ingredients

loans.name: Jose Felipe

texts.es: Jose Felipe A. S. de 46 años de edad  vive en el departamento de San Vicente con su esposa y sus dos hijos Rafael de 7 años y Alicia de 4 años de edad. Felipe se dedica a la compra y venta de maíz, el cual el obtiene por grandes cantidades y para comercializarlo después por libras en el cual obtiene un porcentaje de ganancia, Felipe distribuye el maíz en el mercado dejándolo en los puestos del mercado de San Vicente. El crédito Felipe solicita es para incrementar su inventario en maíz ya que no logra cubrir todas sus ventas con la cantidad existente.
texts.en:
Jose Felipe A. S. is 46 years old and lives in the San Vicente departement with his wife and his two children, Rafael who is 7 years old and Alicia who is 4 years old. Felipe buys and sells corn, which he gets in large quantities to later market by the pound, from which he receives a percentage of the profits. Felipe distributes the corn in the market, leaving it in the stalls of the San Vincente market. The loan that Felipe is requesting is to increase his corn inventory as he does not manage to cover all of his sales with his current quantities.

Translated from Spanish by Heather Nicholson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of corn

loans.name: Cruz Vicente

texts.es: Don Cruz Vicente B. T.
