Cuanta con 64 años de edad casado vive conjuntamente con sus 4 hijos es actualmente su dirección es 8 Avenida D-27 Zona 1 del municipio y departamento de Totonicapán Guatemala, se dedica al comercio  en venta de productos de alfarería donde comercializa fuera de la ciudad donde reside debido al poco capital de trabajo que tiene, sus clientes han aumentado debido al crecimiento que ha obtenido se acercó a la Asociación ASDIR para Solicitar un préstamo para poder cubrir la demanda de sus clientes que va en aumento ya que el producto que tiene es muy bueno por tal razón necesita mejorar su calidad de mercadería y así con la ampliación de su negocio pueda adquirir más clientes, y entregar calidad de su producto a su clientela.
texts.en:
Cruz Vicente B. T. Cuanta, 64 years of age and married, lives with his wife and 4 children in Totonicapán, Guatemala. He dedicates himself to commerce, selling pottery products that he markets outside the city where he lives. He has used the small amount of working capital he has to expand his customer base. Given the growth he has managed to obtain, he approached the ASDIR Association to solicit a loan to help him meet his customers’ demand. It continues to grow, as he has a good product, and he needs to further improve the quality of his merchandise. By expanding, he can attract more clientele and provide them with a quality product.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Bertha Luz

texts.es:
La señora Bertha, pertenece al Banco Comunal “Honestidad y trabajo, Distrito D. Juanjui, Provincia D. Mariscal Cáceres, Departamento D. San Martín. Es Casada, tiene 47 años y 04 hijos, 02 que aun dependen D. ella..

Bertha, anteriormente vendía abarrotes y mercería, viendo que no generaba muchos ingresos decidió implementar su propio taller D. costura, trabajo que en la actualidad sigue ejerciendo.
Lleva años dedicándose a la confección D. vestidos y poco a poco fue generando sus propios ingresos y ahorrando su dinero. Como tenia la habilidad  para la costura, no dudo en hacerlo y con el apoyo del Movimiento Manuela Ramos decidió implementar su propio Taller D. Costura, ubicado en su misma casa. Nos cuenta que le va muy en sus costuras, trabaja con pedidos que con anticipación sus clientes le solicitan. A quienes les atienD.  con la amabilidad y el carisma  que le caracteriza. 

 Uno D. sus sueños y meta por lograr, es implementar su propio taller D. confección, con nuevas maquinas, cambiando lo antiguo por lo nuevo.

Con el préstamo D. S/. 3,000.00, comprará telas en metros, D. diferentes especies y colores, instrumentos que utiliza como tijeras, hilos en carretes granD. y D. variados colores, agujas D. coser y D. maquina, alfileres, botones. 

Hoy en día se siente una mujer muy realizada, con más ganas D. alcanzar y hacer realidad sus demás sueños. Agradece a Manuela Ramos por ayudarla a iniciar su negocio y también a muchas mujeres que  quieren crecer empresarialmente.

loans.use: Comprará telas en metros, de diferentes especies y colores.

loans.name: Melba

texts.en: General store is the business of Melba M.. She is a resident of Barangay Rizal West San Isidro, Isabela. She is thankful to have Rolando M., who is a very responsible and a loving husband. Melba wanted to expand her store and buy additional stock of merchandise because their place is far to the marketplace that’s why she is requesting a loan amounting PHP15, 000 for her additional business capital. Somehow, by having the added capital, she could also minimize her fare in going to the marketplace where she bought different kinds of merchandise. She is blessed with six children and she hopes that she could sustain all their needs especially their educational needs.

loans.use: additional capital

loans.name: Mahinou

texts.fr: D. Mahinou est née vers les années 1970. Mahinou est Mariée à AKPOVO Houinsavi, menuisier. Ce couple a à sa charge trois enfants dont deux scolarisés et le troisième en formation chez son papa. La famille réside depuis huit ans à ENAGNON, un quartier de Cotonou, Capitale Économique de la République du Bénin. Mahinou mène comme activité principale la vente de poissons fumés. Mahinou a diversifié son activité à la vente de bijoux. Mahinou a déjà eu quatre crédits d’ALIDé, crédits qu’elle a bien remboursés et avec lesquels elle a pu élever le niveau de son activité. Pour  continuer à développer son activité, Mahinou demande un cinquième crédit pour renforcer son fonds de roulement.
texts.en:
D. Mahinou was born around 1970 and is married to AKPOVO Houinsavi, a furniture maker. This couple has three children to support. Two of them are in school, and the third one is in training with dad. For eight years, the family has been residing in ENAGNON, a district of Cotonou, the economic capital of the Republic of Benin. Mahinou's main business is in selling smoked fish. She has diversified her business by selling jewelry. Mahinou has already had ALIDé loans that she has repaid. She was able to use the loans to raise her level of business. To continue to develop her business, she’s asking for a fifth loan to bolster her working capital.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 13 boxes of fresh fish, firewood, and some jewelry

loans.name: Mujeres Maravilla Group

texts.en:
Adelaida G. contacted her friends and neighbors to start Mujeres Maravilla, a committee in the neighborhood Mburucuja. The committee is made of 21 women who are very active in their area. They all sell different things- pants, shoes, tomatoes, lettuce, butter, bananas, apples, sodas, caramels, melons, watermelon, sugar, milk, etc. 
The women took out a credit of 300,000 to 500,000 Gs and they are in their second cycle. They have 950,053 Gs in savings. 
The loan is used to buy merchandise necessary to sell in their neighborhood.
Francisca S. wants to use her loan to be a hair-dresser. 
Adelaida G. wants to use her loan to buy and sell cosmetics. 
María A. wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Graciela V. wants to use her loan to buy and sell shoes.
Dora D. wants to use her loan to buy and sell groceries for her store.
Elsa G. wants to use her loan for a mini market.
Teresa A. wants to use her loan to buy and sell groceries for her store.
Reina G. wants to use her loan for sewing.
Ermelinda L. wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Felisa S. wants to use her loan for sewing.
María N. wants to use her loan to buy and sell aperitifs. 
Blanca N. wants to use her loan for sewing.
Jeorgina  R. wants to use her loan for baking confectionaries.
María N. wants to use her loan to buy and sell jewelry.
Hilda C. wants to use her loan to buy and sell jewelry.
Tomasa M. wants to use her loan for baking confectionaries.
Mariana A. wants to use her loan to buy and sell groceries for her store. 
María V. wants to use her loan to buy and sell plastics.
Ignacia V. wants to use her loan to buy and sell clothes.
Elva A. wants to use her loan to buy and sell aperitifs.
Cecilia V. wants to use her loan to buy and sell groceries for her store.

loans.use: Clothes, Food, Produce

loans.name: Rokhaya

texts.fr: Rokhaya S. est une femme de 39 ans elle est divorcée et vit avec ses 5 enfants dont elle a l'entière charge. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de KAMBENG DOUMASSOU depuis 2 ans et demi. Elle développe une activité de vente de tissu teinté et de chaussures. C'est avec les bénéfices générés par son petit commerce qu'elle assure la prise en charge de ses enfants
texts.en:
Rokhaya S. is a 39-year-old divorced woman who lives with her five children whom she alone supports.  She has been a member of Banc Villageois de KAMBENG DOUMASSOU for 2½ years.  Rokhaya is developing a business selling shoes and dyed cloth.  With the profits generated from her small business, she ensures that her children are cared for.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To further her business

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes S. is from the village of Kiwalan, Iligan City. She is 43 years old. Lourdes is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Lourdes operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from making and selling "longganiza" (ground pork wrapped with pork skin) in the local community. Lourdes has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 6,000 Philippine pesos a month for these activities.

In 2009, Lourdes joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Lourdes has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional products to sell. Lourdes is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This will be the second loan taken out by Lourdes from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase crops in bulk  for resale

loans.name: Lesbia Del Socorro

texts.es: La señora Lesbia Del Socorro de 46 años, se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general, las cuales vende ciertos lugares en los que tiene suficiente clientes. Hace más de 6 años de trabajar este negocio, por lo que Lesbia ha luchado para sacar adelante su negocio por lo que tiene que proporcionarles a sus hijos estudios y alimentos. Ella disfruta mucho de su trabajo pues siempre recuerda que este el medio de vida que le genera los ingresos necesario del pan de cada día ella aparece al lado izquierdo de la fotografia mostrando sus productos.  La señora está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para la compra de pantalones, camisas, faldas y vestidos. ya que tiene variedad de pedidos y necesita el crédito para cubrir la demanda. Su deseo es seguir con este negocio.
texts.en:
Ms. Lesbia Del Socorro sells various products in places where she has enough customers. She has had her business for more than six years and has worked hard to make it succeed so that she can feed and cover the academic expenses of her children. She enjoys her work very much and always remembers this business gives her the income she needs to survive every day. Lesbia appears on the left in the photograph showing her products. Lesbia is once again requesting a loan to buy pants, shirts, skirts, and dresses, as she has many orders and needs the working capital to fulfill her clientele's demand. Her wish is to continue in this business.

Translated from Spanish by Violeta Rubiani, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un padre de familia de 50 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y dos de sus cinco hijos en el sector Mocce, ubicado en la ciudad de Lambayeque, a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Desde hace más de 20 años se dedica a la panadería, el fabrica sus productos en un horno  instalado en un ambiente de su casa. Este negocio constituye la única fuente de ingreso familiar con la que ha sustentado a su familia durante todos estos años. Los panes que produce los distribuye el mismo a algunas tiendas y hogares de la zona. Su labor es diaria y demanda de mucho esfuerzo, dedicación y responsabilidad.

Debido a la cercanía de la temporada navideña, Juan se encuentra elaborando panetones, la calidad con la que elabora sus productos ha hecho que la demanda por ellos crezca pero el ya no cuenta con el capital suficiente para seguir comprando más ingredientes e insumos por lo que se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles que piensa utilizar en la compra de harina especial, pasas, frutillas, huevos y envases de plastico con los cuales pueda seguir elaborando este producto típico de la temporada.

Su más grande anhelo es terminar de construir su casa por lo que se esfuerza a diario para reunir el dinero suficiente. El ya ha trabajado anteriormente con nuestra Institución demostrando responsabilidad y puntualidad al momento de asumir sus cuotas.
texts.en:
Juan is a 50 years old family man, who lives with her wife and their five children in the Mocce district, in the city of Lambayeque, twenty minutes away from the city of Chiclayo. For over 20 years he has owned a bakery business and he has a baking space in his house. This business has been the only source of revenue for his family for all these years. He delivers bread to stores and families of his neighborhood. He works very hard, every day, with dedication and responsibility. For the Christmas season, Juan is baking panettone (traditional Christmas cake) and the good quality of his products has pushed up the demand. As he does not have enough operating funds to buy more baking materials and ingredients, he has requested a loan of 1500 PEN, that he will use to buy special flour, raisins, candied fruit, eggs and plastic bowls, so that he can keep baking this season typical product. He is eager for finishing to build his house and for this reason he works daily very hard so that he can make enough money. He obtained previous loans, that he fully and rensponsibly repaid.

Translated from Spanish by MONICA URBAN, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy baking materials and ingredients to prepare panettone.

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Ven Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan consists of nineteen members who are located in Liek village in Kandal province. Each member will use the loan for a different purpose.

Mrs. Touch V. is the village bank president. She is 49 years old and the mother of three children, one of whom is a policeman and the other two are studying at the local school.

Mrs. Touch V. and her husband, Mr. Phan Sam, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice. In this plantation, she has a problem because it is the harvesting season and she does not have enough money to hire laborers to harvest her rice. Thus, Mrs. Touch V. decided to ask for a second loan to hire laborers for this purpose.

loans.use: To hire laborers to harvest her rice

loans.name: Martin De Jesus

texts.es:
El Señor Martin de Jesús García V., Labora como Higienista en el Mercado Israel Lewites de Managua, el tiene cuatro  hijos a su cargo, y dos de ellos se encuentran en edad escolar, esta Casado, ha trabajado ocho créditos con CEPRODEL durante seis años, en este periodo de tiempo ha invertido tres créditos en la mejoramiento de la vivienda en la que habita, gracias a los financiamiento otorgados por CEPRODEL,  el es un cliente excelente.

El crédito solicitado es para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción como: zinc y perlines, para terminar de  entechar la casa donde vive.
Con el objetivo de Brindarles mayor seguridad y  una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos. 

Martin dijo que gracias a los préstamos otorgados por ceprodel le han ayudado mucho por lo que ahora cuenta con una vivienda más segura.
texts.en:
Martin de Jesús García V. works a hygienist in the Israel Lewites market in Managua. He is married and has four children, two of whom are school-aged. He has taken out eight loans with CEPRODEL over six years, three of which were used for improvements on his house. Thanks to the financing provided by CEPRODEL, he is an excellent client. This loan is for the purchase of construction materials, such as rafters and metal roofing, to complete the roof on his house. Martin says that thanks to the loans from CEPRODEL, his home is much more secure.

Translated from Spanish by jeffrey hersk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Roofing materials

loans.name: Abigail

texts.en: Abigail sells notebooks, textbooks, pens and pencils in her shop, and she has been in this business for five years. Abigail is very happy with her business growth and she hopes to grow her business into a world-class book store in the future. Abigail is happily married with four children, all boys. Her children are still dependent on her and attend school. Her husband is a businessman who also supports the home. She is 43 years old and very determined to increase the prosperity of her business and that of her family. She hopes for a loan of NGN 100,000 to purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell. She says thank you to all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase more notebooks and textbooks to sell.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en: Elsa R. has five children with her husband Aniceto. Both of them work hard to supply the needs of their household. Elsa is thankful for her farm because aside from getting income from it, she also doesn’t need to buy rice for her family to eat. She said that it lessens their expenses. Elsa is now preparing her farm for planting. She needs farm supplies so she has applied for a loan of PHP6,000 from CEVI. With this amount, Elsa will be able to buy seeds, fertilizer and other farm supplies that she needs.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies

loans.name: Janankan Jumaeva Group

texts.ru:
Жананкан 45 лет. Она замужем и воспитывает 4 детей. Старший сын находится в России на заработках. Она вместе с мужем занимается строительными работами. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 200 долларов. За счет собственного труда они смогли построить себе дом. Кредит будет использован для закупа одной коровы, который позволит увеличить их семейный доход. 

Абидахан 44 года. Она вдова, ее супруг умер в прошлом году. У нее 5 детей. Из за смерти супруга ей пришлось на время приостановить бизнес: торговлю продуктами питания с собственного дома. Кредит будет направлен на возобновление бизнеса. 

Альфира, 48, змужем. Она мать 7 детей. Ее супруг работает трактористом, сама же занимается реализацией продуктов питания. Кредит будет использован для расширения ассортимента продукции в ларьке. 

Мелисбеку 34 года. Все 4 сына клиента учатся в школе. Он совместно с супругой арендует буфет и торгует там товарами повседневного спроса. Все 4 сына клиента учатся в школе. Кредит будет использован для увеличения ассортимента товаров. 

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan.

Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of 3-Ps concept - People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and the society as well), Profit (to be profitable to grow further) and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan who delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan - at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and Mol Bulak staff.
texts.en:
Janankan is 45 years old. She is married and is raising four children. Her oldest son is now working in Russia. She does construction work together with her husband. Their monthly income is around $200US. They were able to build their own house by working hard. They will use the loan to buy one cow which will help to increase their family income. Abidahan is 44 years old. She is a widow, her husband died last year. She has five children. Because of her spouse's death she had to put her business on hold which is selling food products from her home. The loan will be used towards starting the business over. Alfira is 48, she is married. She is a mother of seven children. Her husband works as a tractor driver and she sells food products. She will use the loan towards expanding the variety of the merchandise in her stall. Melisbek is 34 years old. All his four sons go to school. They rent a buffet together with his wife where they sell every day necessities. The loan will be used to increase the variety of products.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a cow, expand business and variety of merchandise

loans.name: Sean

texts.en: Mrs. Sean K. is a rice farmer in Andoung Samretth village in Takeo province. She faces a problem because she does not have enough money to buy more rice seeds so is asking for a loan to do so. She would use the money to buy seeds, fertilizer and pesticides. Her husband, Mr. Heng Lou, is a teacher who makes only a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sean K. is 51 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is a government official while the other is a laborer.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds, fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Ma. Luisa

texts.en:
Ma. Luisa T., 53, is making sure that her family has enough provision for their daily needs. She is married to Dante T. and they are blessed with three children. She makes sure that she helps her husband earn so that their family can have a better life.

Ma. Luisa manages her own variety store while also maintaining a hamburger stand, a mami (beef noodle) stand and a halo-halo (shaved ice dessert, similar to Singapore’s Ice Kechang) stall.

Ma. Luisa has been a regular member of Center for Community Transformation (CCT) for more than a year now. She regularly attends its weekly fellowship meetings* and pays her weekly dues consistently. Because of her good repayment performance with her previous loans, she was able to borrow quite a few times in CCT’s cooperative. She is consistent in paying her dues because she used the money she borrowed to expand and improve her businesses.

To ensure the success of her businesses, Ma. Luisa would like to apply for a PHP 30,000 loan. This amount will be used as a source of added capital for her expanding businesses by buying raw ingredients needed to continue production of her hamburgers, noodles and halo-halo. She will also invest some of the loan in buying groceries for her variety store.

Ma. Luisa dreams that her businesses will continue to grow so that she can have more patrons and thus ensure herself and her family of a comfortable future.


* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of fifteen to thirty community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To buy raw ingredients for more hamburgers, noodles and halo-halo, and to buy more groceries for her variety store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more paints and painting brushes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy wool, string, and raw materials for weaving

loans.name: Entesar

texts.en:
Entesar T. is a 41-year-old woman from Gaza City in the Gaza Strip. She is married to Mazen T. and is the mother of two daughters and two sons. Mazen used to own a poultry shop where he prepared poultry for sale. He is now an employee of the Palestinian National Authority.

Entesar decided to restore their poultry shop and urged her husband to start working there again in the afternoons. Entesar came to FATEN and took a $2,000 loan to purchase a machine that cleans the poultry automatically. Entesar believes that this machine will make the work faster and increase the number of customers they can serve.

Mazen appears in the picture working in the shop because his wife is not comfortable having her picture published and he is the one who works in the shop.

loans.use: Poultry sales

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita T. is from the village of Gingoog City. She is 46 years old. Teresita is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, Teresita owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food and daily use products in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to invest in expanding the business. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To invest in expanding the business

loans.name: 08.1.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Tien L. T. (7) is a 33-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa.  Tien is the group leader of a 5-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.  The official name of this borrowing group is 08.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.08.1.2 Nam Ngan).


Tien is married and has 1 school-aged child.  To make a living, Tien owns & operates a tailoring business.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from providing general  alteration & tailoring services to local community members.  Tien has been engaged in this business for over 5 years and earns approximately 2,000,000 VND a month from these activities.


In 2008, Tien joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Tien has successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,079,800 VND from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  This previous loan was used to purchase a new sewing machine.  She is now requesting a new loan of 6,000,000 VND which will be used to purchase additional fabrics & materials.  This will be the 4th loan taken out by the borrower from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Tien plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.


About the Other Borrowers in the Group:


1.  P. T. Hao (8) is a 46-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


2.  N. T. Cuc (9) is a 39-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business in the agriculture sector raising livestock.


3.  M. T. Yen (10) is a 32-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support service-based business.


4.  L. T. Ha (11) is a 33-year-old woman who is requesting a 6,000,000 VND loan to support her business making & selling food.


About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainable financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.


*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


Tien L. T. (7) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.  Tien là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 5 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 08.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.08.1.2 Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên T. nhập, mà nguồn T. nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ cung cấp các dịch vụ may vá quần áo thông thường cho người dân trong cộng đồng địa phương.  Tien thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 5 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này, Tien kiếm được khoảng 2.000.000 VND.  Vào 2008, Tien đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.  Tien đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây là 3.079.800 VND từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.  Khoản vay trước đây được sử dụng mua máy may mới.  Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 6.000.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 4th khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  P. T. Hao (8) là 46 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


2.  N. T. Cuc (9) là 39 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực nông nghiệp.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là chăn nuôi gia súc.


3.  M. T. Yen (10) là 32 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực dịch vụ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh trên cơ sở dịch vụ.


4.  L. T. Ha (11) là 33 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 6.000.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics & materials

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en: This group loan has four members who have been selected Mrs. Hun B. is a group leader who is 33-year-old located in Sdok Prei village, Takeo province. All the members will use portion of their loan for varied ways in which it can improve their businesses. Mrs. Hun B. owns a general store in local village where she can sell groceries to earn large profit to support her family while her husband, Mr. Chav Phan, is a sugar palm seller who is also able to earn money to support his family. Since her husband’s is going well she wants to expand. So to improve this business, Mrs. Hun B. is asking for a loan to buy more sugar palm to resale. She is a mother of four children, two of whom are attending in local public school, while the others are too young to work or study.

loans.use: To buy more sugar palm to resale

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes K. is currently in the business of selling bags of beans and groundnuts at the market. She is requesting a loan to stock dried fish to sell.  

Agnes is 41 years old and married to a peasant. She has four children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build up a shop.

loans.use: Stock dried fish to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is married and has ten children, four of whom are not in school. She also takes care of additional family members. 

She is a tailor of school uniforms and other garments and works from her home. She has been in this tailoring business for eight years. She wants to use this loan to buy more school uniform materials. She buys fabric from Kiyembe shops in Kampala and uses public transport to and from shopping.

Besides this clothing business she owns a public pay phone which brings in additional income. She sells her uniforms to all categories of people at retail prices. She works six days a week and depends on this job for a living.  Her business challenge is the seasonality.  She is hoping to see her business grow big so that she can get enough profit to buy a plot of land to build rental rooms. 

She decided to join MCDT because she wanted additional capital for her business. She owns and resides in a three-room house and the family has access to electricity and piped water.  Her monthly expenses include school fees, food and medication.

loans.use: To buy more bolts of school uniform materials

loans.name: Bayi

texts.fr: bayi est une femme de 44 ans qui est très dynamique, elle exerce comme activité génératrice de revenu le commerce de charbons de bois, grâce à ce commerce elle subvient à ses charges et à ceux de son enfant. Elle s'approvisionne à l'intérieur du pays dans la ville d'anié. elle a une ancienneté de 6 ans dans ce commerce. elle a constaté une baisse de son stock de marchandises. elle sollicite de WAGES un crédit pour l'achat d'une trentaine de sacs de charbons de bois et assurer le transport de la marchandise.
texts.en:
Bayi is a very energetic 44 year-old woman. Her line of business is selling charcoal. Thanks to this business she supports herself and her child. She gets her stock in the interior of the country, in the town of Anié. She has six years of experience in this business and has noticed that her stock of merchandise is low. She is requesting a loan from WAGES to buy about thirty bags of charcoal and provide for the transport of the merchandise.

Translated from French by Connie Archea, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy charcoal

loans.name: Glorina

texts.en:
Glorina D. is from the village of Villa Coloma, Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya. She is 37 years old, married, and has six school-aged children. To make a living, she operates a motorcycle transport service. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $115 a month for these activities.

In 2009, Glorina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. 

Glorina is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to repair her existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 3rd loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Ugul

texts.en:
Ugul, an entrepreneur from Isfara, Tajikistan, sells fabric merchandise in the central mall of her hometown. In this business for 19 years, Ugul is seeking a loan of $3000 USD to purchase additional inventory for further retail sale in her little store. She is hoping to buy new, trendy fabrics that sell well among numerous mall customers.

Ugul can be characterized as a solvent borrower quite capable of loan repayment. She has gained a reputation for responsibility both in her financial obligations and in keeping her word. We are happy to have another opportunity to assist her with the operation of her business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes its role as a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for the business

loans.name: Esther Efua Atta

texts.en:
Esther Efua Atta A. is married and has three children. She has been through senior high school.  Her husband is a prison officer. Esther smokes fish (herring) at Elmina for sale. She has been in this trade for some time now. She is asking for a loan to purchase larger quantities of fish to smoke (process) for resale. 

Esther uses her income to assist her husband in the payment of school fees and utility bills. Esther plans to reinvest her additional income.

Esther has, in her traditionally built oven, fish being smoked, and has just removed a few to display.

loans.use: To purchase larger quantities of fish to smoke (process) for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase ceramic tiling for her home.

loans.name: Miraga

texts.en: Miraga S. is a 47-year-old farmer who raise cattle. He has five years of experience in this field. Currently Miraga has three cows. He usually purchases small calves, raises them and sells them in the livestock bazaar once every 6 months. His main income is from selling milk and milk products. He is married with a son and daughter. His son helps Miraga to look after his cows. Miraga applied for a loan of 1000 AZN to buy an additional cow.

loans.use: To purchase one dairy cow and fodder.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To remodel his living room.

loans.name: Sunilda

texts.es:
La Sra Sunilda D. de 63 años de edad esta felizmente casada con el Sr. Francisco Almada de 68 año.
 Viven en la Ciudad de Repatriación donde tienen local de ventas de artículos de primera necesidad y bebidas en general. El negocio se inicio de un capital que tenian ahorrado y han ido aumentando el negocio con un poco de dinero que le envian sus hijos que se encuentran trabajando en España.
   Solicito el crédito para la compra de Sidra y pan dulce, por que en esta época del año es tradicional su consumo y tiene gran demanda.
   Doña Sunilda desea ver a toda su familia reunida en las fiestas de fin de año y que el país ofrezca mayores puestos de trabajo para los jóvenes y de ese modo no tengan que viajar al exterior en busca de un futuro asegurado.
texts.en: Sunilda D. is 63 years old and is happily married to Francisco Almada, 68. They live in the city of Repartriación, where they have a store selling articles of primary necessity and general beverages. They started it with money they had saved, and they have been expanding the business a little with money sent to them from their children who are working in Spain. Sunilda is requesting the loan to purchase cider and sweet breads since are traditional items during this time of year and are in high demand. Sunilda wants to see her whole family reunited for the end of the year celebrations since the country has good job openings for young people and in this way her children don't have to travel abroad in search of job security.

loans.use: Purchase merchandise such as drinks, candy and other items

loans.name: María Delia

texts.es: María Delia T. F. de 46 años de edad, es una mujer soltera, quien vive junto a dos hermanas y dos hijos, junto a quienes reside en el barrio La Merced en departamento de Usulután. Ella trabaja en su propio negocio, el cual es una tienda en la que se comercializan productos de primera necesidad como pan, agua, gas propano, medicinas y algunas golosinas, su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. María desea mucho el poder surtir en gran medida su negocio, ya que de esta forma podrá vender más y obtener más ganancias, es por esto que solicita un préstamo a través del cual pueda comprar todos los productos necesarios para brindarles todo lo que sus clientes buscan, de esta forma ella podrá brindar un mejor servicio el cual se vea recompensado con más clientes. Para María su negocio es muy importante ya que cuenta con la ventaja de poseerlo en su hogar lo cual le permite atenderlo y así mismo estar junto a sus hijos a las cuales al mismo tiempo les puede brindar todo lo que necesiten.
texts.en:
María Delia T. F. is 46 years old.  She is single and lives with two sisters and two children in La Merced neighborhood, in Usulután department.

María works in her own business.  She owns a store in which she sells essentials such as bread, water, propane gas, medicines and some candy.  Her business is located in her home.  María would very much like to be able to stock her business well since in that way she will be able to sell more and make more profits.  For this reason, she is requesting a loan which will allow her to buy all the products she needs to provide her customers with everything they are looking for.  In this way, she will be able to provide a better service which means she will be rewarded with more customers.

María's business is very important to her since she has the advantage of it being located in her home which means she can serve in her store and, at the same time, be together with her children and be able to provide them with everything they need.

loans.use: To buy essentials for her store

location.town: Barrio La Merced, departamento de Usulután

loans.name: Tunh

texts.en: Tunh W., 35, is married and resides with her husband and four children in Siem Reap province, Cambodia, an area known for angkorean temples. W. is a farmer, earning an income of USD 3 per day. Her husband is a construction worker, earning an income of USD 5 per day to help cover the family expenses. Each month, the family has to spend USD 50 on food and USD 80 on the other necessary expenses. W. is requesting a loan of USD 1,200 to purchase buffaloes to help plow the rice fields. In the future, she would like to use the additional income to repair her house. This will be her third loan from CREDIT, a long standing Kiva partner.

loans.use: To buy buffaloes to help plow the rice fields

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa S. is from the village of Calaca-an. She is 66 years old. Elsa is married and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Elsa cultivates rice to sell. Elsa has been engaged in her farming business for over 6 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2000, Elsa joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. 

Elsa is requesting a new loan of 10000 PHP, which will be used to pay for services to increase her crop yield. This loan will be the 15th loan taken out by Elsa from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions for her family. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To pay for services to increase crop yield

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es: Isabel, de 42 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo German de 45 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. En el mercado de la ciudad de La Merced, se encuentra el puesto de frutas de Isabel, sus principales productos son las naranjas y mandarinas, las cuales trae desde el poblado de Kimiri. Todas las mañanas abre su puesto para atender con mucho cariño y respeto a todas las personas que desean comprar sus sabrosos productos, ya que sabe que si les brinda una buena atención, volverán. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es conversar con sus compañeras de venta y así informarse de las cosas que pasan en el mercado, lleva 10 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, puesto que el viaje es muy largo y cansado. En adelante, espera contratar una persona para que le ayude en la atención hacía los clientes. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, siente que tiene la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente. En su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, es por eso que es muy respetada por el resto de sus socias. Con los mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más naranjas, para implementar mejor su puesto de ventas.
texts.en:
Isabel is 42 years old.  She is a very kind and hard-working woman who lives in her own home together with her husband, 45 year-old German, and her three beloved children who she would like to provide with a better quality of life.

Isabel's fruit stall is located in La Merced town market.  The main products she sells are oranges and mandarins which she transports from the town of Kimiri.  Every morning she opens her stall to serve all the people who would like to buy her tasty products.  She serves her customers with a lot of affection and respect as she knows that if she provides good customer service they will come back.

What Isabel most likes about her work is chatting with her fellow saleswomen.  This is how she finds out what is happening in the market.  She has been in this business for 10 years and she considers the most difficult part of her work to be transporting her products since the journey is very long and tiring.  In the future, she hopes to hire somebody to help her serve her customers.

This is Isabel's first loan with MFP and she feels that she must make all her repayments punctually.  She is a very responsible member of her community bank and, for this reason, she is very well respected by the her fellow group members.  Isabel will use the 1,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting to buy more oranges to better stock her sales stall.

loans.use: To buy more oranges to better stock her business

loans.name: Gema Lizbeth

texts.es:
Gema,27 años de edad, soltera ,originaria de Pueblo Nuevo municipio de Esteli, es hija de Milda  quien es humilde comerciante , y la ha ayudado desde sus inicios con su carrera.Gema estudio ingenieria en sistemas pero aun no ha tramitado el titulo.Comenzo a trabajar a la edad de 22 años,en una clinica de asegurados en el area administrativa,despues empezo a trabajar en un ciber cafe donde trabajo como empleada del local, pero con sus esfuerzos y algunos ahorros sobre todo actitud de superacion compro el ciber cafe a su jefa ,para ello tambien conto con ayuda de un hermano que vive en lo Estados Unidos y asi logro convertirse en la dueña de su primer negocio el cual ella atiende por si misma. Hoy en dia ya tiene un año de establecido su negocio y desea ampliarlo para brindar un mejor servicio.
Solicita el prestamo para comprar dos computadoras con sus respectivos muebles, ya que de esta manera ayudara a incrementar sus ganancias y ofrecer un mejor servicio a la gente de su pueblo, ademas esta por venir la temporada escolar ,donde espera recibir mas clientes en su negocio.Dentro sus planes esta tener otro ciber cafe en el centro de Esteli.
Su proxima meta es de tramitar su titulo, ya que no ha podido hacerlo por problemas economicos, pero aun asi no pierde la esperanza de conseguirlo.
texts.en:
Gema is 27 years old, single, and from Pueblo Nuevo in Esteli. Her mother is Milda, a humble saleswoman, and she has helped her since she started her career. Gema studied systems engineering but still has not finished and earned her degree. At the age of 22 she began to work for an insurance agency in the administrative sector. She then began to work at an internet cafe as an employee, but with hard work, some savings, and most importantly, her great attitude, she bought the internet cafe from her boss. Her brother who lives in the United States helped her with this and she became the owner of her first business. She runs this business all by herself. It has been a year since she started her business and she wishes to expand it to provide better service.

She is asking for a loan to buy two computers and the furniture that accompanies them. This will help increase her earnings and offer better service to the people in her town. Furthermore, students are about to return to school and she hopes to attract more customers to her business. Her plans are to open another internet cafe in downtown Esteli.

Her next goal is to graduate, as she has not been able to do so for economic reasons, but she still has not lost the hope of graduating.

loans.use: To buy two computers and furniture for them

loans.name: Yelitza

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal” EL AMANECER”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco,  perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Yelitza; la socia tiene 24 años de edad, conviviente; la socia tiene un carrito que compro conjuntamente con su pareja el cual brinda el servicio de taxi siendo su pareja quien maneja el carro, la socia a la vez trabaja en un restaurante de lunes a sábado, siendo esta la manera que tiene para salir adelante, la socia es una persona bien alegre y con todas la ganas de seguir progresando cada día mas.

La socia solicita el préstamo para el mantenimiento de su carrito y para comprar algunos accesorios que le hacen falta.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Sra. Yelitza is a member of the Communal Bank “El Amancer” (The Dawn) which is located in the District, Province, and Department of Cusco.

She is 24 years old and in a common law marriage. Yelitza and her husband own a compact car for providing taxi services. Her husband drives the vehicle while she works at restaurant Monday through Saturday as a means of getting ahead. Yelitza is a happy person who intends to continue progressing each day.

The loan she is requesting will be used to maintain her car and purchase a few accessories that are missing. Yelitza is happy with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: To pay for vehicle maintenance and purchase auto accessories.

loans.name: Rosalyn

texts.en:
Rosalyn B. is from the village of Sta. Filomena, Dipolog City, Misamis Occidental. She is 33 years old, married, and has one school-aged child. Rosalyn operates a family member's business in the services sector, operating a PUJ (small bus) in the local community. She has been engaged in this business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8,500 PHP a month.

In 2010, Rosalyn joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase piglets for her hog raising business. Rosalyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase accessories for vehicle repair. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Rosalyn from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase accessories for vehicle repair

loans.name: Uzokjon

texts.ru: Хакимов Узокчон проживает в городе Турсунзаде. Ему 41 год. Он женат, имеет двоих детей. У него среднее образование. Уже три года как он занимается растениеводством. При доме он имеет участок земли, где выращивает овощи. Целью кредита является покупка земли и семян. Он хочет расширить свою деятельность для того чтобы получить больше прибыли.
texts.en: Uzokjon H. lives in the city of Tursun-zoda. He is 41 years old, married, and has two children. He has a secondary education. He has been working in agriculture for three years. He has a plot of land at home where he grows vegetables. He is taking out a loan to buy land and seeds. He plans on expanding his business to bring in a greater profit.

loans.use: to buy land and seeds

loans.name: Vilma Teresa

texts.es: Vilma Teresa se dedica a la elaboración y venta de refrescos. Hace más de 4 años que tiene este negocio, ya que fue por la necesidad de obtener un trabajo que le generara ingresos diariamente para su hogar. Tiene 4 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo, Vilma le enseña a ser personas muy luchadoras y trabajadoras. Este financiamiento es para la compra de jugos, frutas, bolsas, azúcar, hielo y gaseosas. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer que le gusta trabajar y que disfruta de hablar con sus clientes y de proporcionarles lo que les solicitan.
texts.en:
Vilma Teresa makes and sells refreshments.  She’s had this business for over 4 years.  It arose from the need to have work that would produce daily family income.  She has four children but only one still in her care.  Vilma teaches them to be hard working, tenacious people.

This loan is to buy juices, fruit, bags, sugar, ice and soft drinks.  She has always been noted for being a woman who likes to work and enjoys chatting with her customers and providing them with what they ask for.

loans.use: to buy juices, fruit, bags, sugar, ice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Luna

texts.en:
Luna is from the village of Balbagon, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 38 years old. Luna is married and has three adult children. She has a business  selling seafood products, including fish like milk fish, sardines & mackerel. Luna has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 8000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it. 

In 2009, Luna joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. She has successfully repaid her last loan from HSPFI, which was for 10,000 PHP and was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. 

This loan will be her fourth from HSPFI. Luna is requesting 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it. 

About HSPFI: 

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish like sardines & mackerel

loans.name: Hamis

texts.en:
Hamis is 45 years old and a father of seven children aged 2-15 years. Being the only breadwinner of his family of 10 people, Hamis works hard to provide for them. He lives in a small village in Hoima District in western Uganda. He lives in his own house with his family, and his family goal is to educate his children. 

Hamis is a produce dealer and has been in this trade for five years now; however, it has not been a smooth road for him because of the frequently fluctuating prices. He needs a loan to buy beans and maize for resale.

loans.use: to purchase maize and beans for resale.

loans.name: Ramona

texts.en: Ramona is 64 years old and married with seven children. Ramona works very hard to provide for them. Ramona runs a variety store in the Philippines and requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through NWTF to buy items to sell in her variety store. She has been in this business for 10 years and sells a variety of items such as eggs, biscuits, canned goods, curls, candies and other groceries. In the future, Ramona would like to save enough to buy a rice farm.

loans.use: to buy items like eggs, biscuits, groceries, etc., to sell in her variety store.

loans.name: Carine

texts.en:
Carine is 24 years old. She has a 4-year-old child in school. Her husband works in a hotel. 

She sells second-hand clothes and she has been selling clothes for the past two years. Her business is going well. the profits enabled her to build a house. 

She needs a loan to buy more clothes and make more profits. With the profits she plans to make some more savings.

loans.use: to buy clothes for resale.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.es: Doña Valeria desde hace 4 años tiene establecida su pequeña Pulperia donde ofrece productos basicos y necesarios en todo hogar, necesita este financiamiento para ampliar la venta de productos y poder sastifacer la demanda de sus clientes permitiendole mejorar las fuentes de ingreso a nivel familiar, su familia es muy unida los que en conjunto trabajan para al bienestar comun, colaboran en los quehaceres de su pulperia, es importante mencionar que tambien trabaja en su unidad de produccion atendiendo su pequeño inventario ganadero, sus vecinos la recomiendan como una persona responsable, honesta y de buenas costunbres.
texts.en: Ms. Valeria started her small pulpería [grocery store] four years ago, where she offers basic products that are necessary in every home. She needs this loan to increase her sales and to be able to satisfy her customers' demands. This will allow her to improve her family's level of income. Her family is very close and they work together for their common good. For instance, they work together on the tasks at her pulpería. It is important to mention that they also work together to tend to their small herd of cattle. Valeria's neighbors recommend her as a responsible and honest person with good habits.

loans.use: to buy more products for her store

loans.name: Julo

texts.en:
Julo is a married man with four children; two attend school while two are adults. He owns a house that has no electricity nor piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past 10 years, Julo has operated a business buying and selling livestock at the market to butcher operators. He faces the challenge of rising livestock prices at the market. His dream is to establish a retail shop in the future.

Julo plans to use this KES 30,000 loan to purchase a cow and a goat for resale. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: To purchase a cow and a goat for resale.

loans.name: Yury Antonio

texts.es:
El Sr. Yury Antonio es originario del municipio de El Sauce, es un padre de familia de tres hijos a los que ha tratado de darles una vida digna y una buena educación, se desempeña como operador de un proyecto en una Institución de la localidad por más de cinco años.
Actualmente la vivienda donde habita con su familia es alquilada, por lo que todos los créditos que le ha otorgado Ceprodel han sido para adquirir materiales de construcción para iniciar a construir su propia vivienda y darle una vida digna a sus hijos, una de las necesidades que tiene en estos momentos es adquirir un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como ladrillos, hierro y zinc, por tal razón decidió solicitar su quinto crédito en Ceprodel con el objetivo de cumplir con su necesidad.
texts.en:
Señor Yury Antonio is originally from the town of El Sauce.  He is a father of three children, for whom he has tried to provide a decent life and a good education.  He has served as project manager for a local Institution for more than five years.

At the moment, the house where he lives with his family is a rental. This is why all the loans offered to him by Ceprodel have been to acquire construction materials to begin building his own home and to provide a decent life for his children.  

One of his current needs is to take out a loan to buy construction materials such as bricks, iron, and zinc roofing.  For this reason, he has decided to request his fifth loan with Ceprodel, with the goal of filling this need.

loans.use: to buy bricks, iron, and zinc roofing.

loans.name: Alfredo

texts.es:
El Joven Alfredo tiene 33 años de edad, es propietario de un Taller Mecánico con Lavadero y gomería. Él es soltero, vive en casa propia, cuenta con la ayuda de su hermano que se encarga de administrar el Lavadero.
El se considera un hombre muy trabajador y luchador, día a día trabaja para poder tener un futuro mejor, ya que desea expandirse en el mercado. Uno de sus sueños es poder ampliarse y seguir creciendo. Comenta que ya tiene un buen tiempo en este trabajo, por lo que ya tiene una clientela bien definida.
Solicita el crédito para la compra de neumáticos y cámaras, con lo cual podrá cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Desde ya agradece a la Fundación por la oportunidad que esta le da, ya que de obtener el crédito, este le será de gran ayuda.
texts.en:
Alfredo, 33, owns a mechanic's workshop with a car wash and a tire shop.  He is single and lives in his own home.  His brother helps him with the business; he is in charge of the car wash.  

Alfredo is considered to be a very hardworking and tenacious fellow who works each day in order to have a better future, since he wants to expand in the market.  One of his dreams is to be able to continue to grow and expand his business.  He comments that he has already been doing this work for awhile, and so he already has an established customer base.

He requests a loan to buy tires and inner tubes so that he will be able to meet the demands of his customers.  He thanks the Fundación in advance for the opportunity they are giving him, since this loan will be a great help to him.

loans.use: to buy tires and inner tubes to later sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
La señora Julia vive en un lugar muy lindo donde la gente de su barrio es de una sola religión, en esta  localidad la gente sigue muy cerca su tradición y comenta que no lo dejaran de practicar.

    Ella es ama de casa y solicito el préstamo para invertirlo en la compra  de  productos naturales. como son: incienso de madera,recinas de copal, raises de plantas medicinales , entre otros, en donde lleva cuarenta  años practicandolo y comenta que le va bien ya que con ello ha tenido un mejor ingreso y a sacado adelante a su  familia.

    Lo que  lo  motivo a esta actividad fue su familia ya que fue madre de siete hijos quien afortunadamente ya todos están casados  y esta muy orgullosa de cada uno de ellos, pues la poyan con  ingresos y no le haga falta lo mas necesario.

    Lo que más desea es que con esta pequeña actividad pueda  seguir trabajando hasta que dios  le preste vida, así también que las sigan apoyando con el préstamo.
texts.en:
Julia lives in a beautiful place where the people in her neighborhood are all of the same religion. In this place the people follow their traditions very closely, and say they will not abandon it. 

Julia is a homemaker and is asking for this loan to invest in the purchase of natural products which she has done for many years. The products include: wood incense, copal resin, and medicinal roots, among other things. He has been in this business for 40 years and says that she does well and that she has had a better income and has given her family a better life. 

Her motivation for this business was her family; Julia is the mother of seven children, all of whom are fortunately already married, and she is very proud of every one of them. 

What Julia wants most is to continue working at this small business for as long as God gives her life and that she gets continued support from this loan.

loans.use: to buy natural products and medicines.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 50 years old, single, and has three children who are over the age of 18. She is a resident of Kahawa Sukari. Her primary businesses are managing rental houses and keeping poultry. This loan is to help her in her poultry-keeping. She has been in this business for the last six years.

This is her first loan, which she will use to purchase chicks to rear and poultry feeds. She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for the children in college. 

Her hopes are to educate her children through college, expand the rental houses, and consistently keep a large number of chickens.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feeds

loans.name: Arlindo

texts.pt:
Nasceu na  cidade de Maputo, provincia do mesmo nome, sul de Moçambique, casado e pai de 1 filho que ainda frequenta a escola. Fez a 7ª classe e não continuou devido a falta de condições financeiras. Vive na casa propria com a sua familia e sustenta mais uma enteada enviando dinheiro para auxiliar nos estudos. 

Nunca saiu da sua terra natal, é refretário na empresa DICKSON Moçambique ha mais de 6 anos e tem um salario de 8.000.00mt, por mês que aplica nas despesas de casa e poupa algum na sua conta bancaria.
Nunca teve emprestimos em outros bancos, conheceu a Hluvuku atravez de amigos que tambem saõ clientes desta instituição. Este é o seu segundo emprestimo na Hluvuku no valor de 10.000.00mt com qual pretende comprar material de de construcao de uma casa (areia, ferro, chapas, cimento, pedra, e outros.) para dar continuidade a sua obra. O primeiro emprestimo foi de: 10.000.00mt para a sua obra.
No futuro pretende solicitar mais valor para ampliar a sua casa e oferecer mais conforto a sua familia, irá solicitar mais emprestimos a Hluvuku.
texts.en:
He was born in the town of Maputo, in the province of the same name, in southern Mozambique. He is married and has a son who still goes to school. He completed 7th grade and didn't continue for lack of financial conditions. He lives with his family in a house he owns. He also supports his stepdaughter by sending money to help with her education.
He has never left his homeland. He has worked in refractory services for Dickinson Mozambique for over six years and earns a salary of 8.000mt a month. He uses it to pay for home expenses and saves part of it in his bank account.
He has never had loans in other banks. He first heard of Hluvuku through friends who are also clients of this institution. This is his second loan with Hluvuku. It is for 10.000mt, which he intends to use to purchase house construction supplies (sand, iron, metal sheets, cement, stone, etc.) so that he can keep building. The first loan was for 10.000mt to build his house.
In the future, he plans to request more money in order to enlarge his house and offer more comfort to his family. He will request other loans to Hluvuku.

loans.use: to purchase house construction supplies (sand, iron, metal sheets, cement, stone, etc.).

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 29 years old. She lives with her parents in the village of Pinto Alfonso Lista in the Philippines.

Christina engages in retailing to earn a living. She has had this business for six years. It was her field of interest even when she was still young and single. Christina has a good way of tending to and treating her customers, and for this reason they prefer to buy in her store. Before she goes to her store, she feeds her four raised piglets. She is grateful because she is able to operate her business well. 

Christina would like to request additional capital in the amount of P7,000 to buy stock of groceries and feed for her hog-raising business. As her business grows, she wants to have as many products as possible so she can offer her customers more variety and satisfy their demands. Through the amount she requests, she will be able to improve the quality of life for herself and her entire family.

loans.use: to buy stock of groceries and feed for her hog-raising business.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is 30 years old, a married woman with five children, four of whom are in school.  She has a business selling tomatoes and onions in Yei, South Sudan. She has been in this business for four years.

Susan requested this loan through BRAC South Sudan to purchase more onions for sale. The profits of this loan will help her to pay for her children to go to school.

loans.use: to purchase  more onions for sale.

loans.name: Genaro Segundo

texts.es:
Genaro Segundo tiene 56 años de edad es soltero tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo de 22 años de edad en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia de bolívar.

Genaro  se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz, soya y cacao las compras y las ventas lo realiza en San José del Tambo cada fin de semana.

 Solicita el crédito para poder comprar semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, insumos, abonos  para los cultivos.

Con la ayuda del préstamo mejorará la calidad del producto, Enfrenta desafíos que son muy frecuentes como la competencia y las plagas a los cultivos.

El sueño es llegar a comprar una finca y una casa.
En los tiempos libres le gusta disfrutar de las festividades del carnaval.
texts.en:
Genaro Segundo, 56, is single and has a son.  He lives with his 22-year-old son in Chillanes Canton, Bolívar Province.

Genaro is a farmer growing corn, soya and cocoa beans.  His purchases and his sales take place every weekend in San José del Tambo.

He asks for the loan to be able to buy seeds, manure, fertilizer and supplies for the crops.

With help from the loan he will improve the quality of his products.  He faces frequent challenges which are competition and crop pests.

His dream is to buy a farm and a house.

In his free time he enjoys celebrating carnival.

loans.use: to buy seeds and farm supplies.

loans.name: Leones

texts.en: Leones is 35 years old and lives in the Philippines. She is married with 2 children. Leones has a shop that sells canned goods, snacks and beverages. She has had this business for 5 years. She requested a loan for PHP 9,000 to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages. Leones has been a member of HSPFI since 2011. In the future, Leones hopes to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, snacks and beverages

loans.name: Amina

texts.en: Amina used the previous loan to pay fees for her children.  In her business of a clothing shop, she still faces a challenge of limited capital, price fluctuations, and inflation.  Amina intends to use this loan to buy more clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell this Christmas season.

loans.name: Buenaventurada

texts.en:
Buenaventurada is a married woman from Trinidad, Bohol. She has seven children. 
Buenaventurada is a farmer. She primarily grows rice crops to sell. She works hard to support her family and keep them healthy. She has applied for a loan to purchase fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor. She hopes this loan will help her achieve an abundant harvest.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seeds and pay for labor.

loans.name: Ruben

texts.es:
Rubén, actualmente  vive solo, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos y de ganado, atiende las labores agropecuarias por las mañanas y después trabaja en un molino de maíz, son sus dos ocupaciones.
El solicita un préstamo para la compra de concentrado para alimentar el ganado y los cerdos, ya que no tiene lo suficiente para los próximos meses, esta inversión le ayudara para que sus animales tengan la alimentación necesaria.
El sueño de Rubén es tener la granja de cerdos más grande, comprar buena calidad de ganado y con el préstamo tener una buena experiencia y responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en:
Currently, Rubén lives alone. He is engaged in raising pigs and cattle. Attending to his agricultural labors in the mornings and afterwards working in a corn mill are his two jobs.

He is applying for a loan in order to purchase concentrated feed for his cattle and pigs since he doesn’t have enough for the coming months. This investment will help him since his animals will have necessary nutrition. Reuben’s dreams are to have a bigger pig farm, and purchase good quality cattle. He hopes to have a good experience with the loan and to be responsible in making his payments.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed for his cattle and pigs.

loans.name: Annetten

texts.en: Annetten is 27 years-old and lives in Congo Town.  She is married with two children aged three and six years old.  The children are attending school and all live at home. Annette has been selling used shoes for the past three years. She started this business with money given to her by her husband and she learned this business from her friends. Her favorite part about her business is that it pays her children's school fees. She is requesting a loan to purchase more used shoes for her business, in the future she want to buy a piece of land and build a house.

loans.use: to purchase more used shoes for her business.

loans.name: Jàppalé Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe a été créé le 17 mai 2010. IL est composé de 15 membres issues du même village, elles ont pratiquement toutes des les liens de parenté.

Elles ont pour responsable Marèma. Elle est debout à l'extrême droite de la photo. Elle est âgée de 49 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants dont une petite fille. Elle a aussi la charge d'un petit fils. 

Elle fait de la couture et comme activité parallèle elle fait de l'agriculture. Elle pratique ce type d'activité depuis 26 années. 

Son prêt va lui permettre de s'approvisionner en marchandises (tissus, fil et semences). 

Son objectif est de prendre en charge ses enfants pour leur santé.les membres du groupes font la même activité.Notez qu'il y a un membre qui n'a pas pris de prêt et 02 absentes.
texts.en:
This group was founded May 17, 2010. It is made up of 15 women who come from the same village and who are almost all related to one another.

Their leader is Marèma. She is standing at the far right of the photo. She is 49 years old, married and the mother of six children, one of whom is a little girl. She is also responsible for a grandson.

Marèma sews and, in parallel, is involved in farming. She has been conducting this type of business for 26 years.

Her loan will allow Marèma to purchase supplies (fabrics, thread and seeds).

Her goal is to care for her children and their health; the members of the group are involved in the same business. Please note that there is one group member who did not take a loan and two who are absent [from the photo].

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fabrics and thread.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 49 years old and married to Christopher, who brings some additional income to the family. They have four children of the following ages: 30, 25, 20, and 18 years respectively. She runs a salon, and she has been in the business for 16 years. Right now her monthly income is KES 10,000.

She is borrowing her first loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to expand her business by purchasing chemicals and weaves for sale. She will repay her loan with the anticipated profit.

loans.use: To purchase items to be used in a salon.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Leonel es un humilde criador de animales más específicamente de aves y cerdos con los que ha logrado darle alimento, educación y techo a su amada familia conformada por su pareja y sus 4 hijos que no superan la mayoría de edad, en busca de mejorar su negocio siempre con la intención de apoyar a su familia económicamente y tratando de superarse como empresario Leonel pide una ayuda crediticia para la compra de pollos para luego engordarlos, lo que daría a su negocio más prestigio y presencia ante sus clientes quienes verán gran cantidad de pollos y en muy buen estado.
El principal suelo de Leonel es poder tener un negocio grande que se destaque por la calidad de sus animales y la calidad humana de los empleados
texts.en:
Señor Leonel is a humble animal breeder, who works, more specifically, with birds and pigs. This has allowed him to feed, educate and house his beloved family. His family consists of himself, his partner, and their four children, all of whom are under the age of majority. 

Leonel seeks to improve his business in order to support his family economically and to become a better businessman. Leonel is requesting this loan in order to buy chickens to fatten up and raise. This will lend more prestige and presence to his business in the eyes of his customers, who will see that he has a large number of chickens in good health.

Leonel's main dream is to have a great business that stands out for the quality of its animals and the quality of its employees.

loans.use: to purchase chickens to raise in order to meet any demand that may arise

loans.name: Junjie

texts.en:
Junjie is 27 years old and has three children. Junjie is married and has two children who are in school.

Junjie is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Junjie requested a PHP 19000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins, and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Junjie has been in this business for 2 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.
